nUIyBw9iE2GI--PW5z41nw.text: The noodles are hand-made fresh and you can watch it being made on-site.  They offered knife-shaved, and hand-pulled Noodles.  The flavor of Lan Chou Noodles was excellent.  My husband liked the beef noodles.  One of the best noodles restaurant in town.

XIZERAdN8m369rgWrcym4g.text: These noodles are so FRESH! Made to order! Staff is super friendly. Food is amazing! My favorite is the chicken w/ mushroom noodle & the spicy dumplings. Fried rice is also good! Definitely worth trying!

J3He013Mf02eXwRUVsSsoA.text: I love noodles. Especially fresh, hand pulled noodles. This place did not disappoint- the noodles were chewy, and the broth was tasty. They could have added veggies but I think I was too busy gulping down yummy noodles to notice.

8igDM1l7nSFOJZR6CMwFeQ.text: Five stars for the only hand pulled noodles in town and I got to say I really enjoyed their noodle however I am disappointed and missing the sauces I am used to from NYC, but overall a fantastic experience and one that I enjoy in town just left me wanting more

pGj8hZrPIVmBMBaE1y4d4w.text: Small hand pulled noodle place in the southwest part of town. I was a bit hesitant at first, however everytime I pass by there's always a crowd waiting. Finally gave it a shot and boy it did not disappoint. I had the Shrimp Fried Rice which very flavorful although a bit on the salty side. Shrimp Chow Mein noodles was also very tasty. Servers were efficient although the place was busy. Entire time I was there, about 15 people were waiting in line. Wait time on average around 10 mins (Saturday midday when I went).

KXOeAPIwOaK-y7OVb5_DyA.text: It was my 2nd time today. Love the fresh noodles.  Tried the beef brisket and the chicken mushroom noodles so far and loved them both. We also ordered the fried rice and the son loved it

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jJDGcoQH2IaCgmwQZNPW4g.text: Do you ever watch a movie and crave something the characters are eating? That's what happened when I was watching King Fu Panda. After the first few minutes of Po and his dad talking about noodles, I was done for. I looked up the nearest (and best rating) noodle place around me, and lo and behold The Magic Noodle came up. Although the restaurant itself is quite small, the food is by far worth the wait and the small dining space. Watching the chefs hand-pull noodles and cook your meal was definitely a highlight. And the food. OH, the FOOD. Delicious. Simply delicious. My husband and I got 2 separate orders (because I wasn't about to share with him lol), and the portions were hefty enough for us to 1) be full and 2) take the leftovers home. If I could give more than 5 stars, I would. I'll be returning.

lEiqqKuTA9bIa5MbtRRH9w.text: Great restaurant on the westside of town , waiter was very funny and easy going. Food was full of flavor. Hot when served . Will be back

XbiaAEViW2kXy9VhLDFFrw.text: This is by far my favorite noodle spot. I had the sweet and spicy noodle and my husband had the beef ramen- both were delicious. I have been begging my husband to go back because I can't stop thinking about those noodles!!  The staff was super sweet. I loved being able to watch the noodles being made. Oh, and the prices are so affordable- you get a lot of bang for your buck.

VdZhNS277YIt6xdPc9Yltg.text: Great Noodle house. Love the Tomato egg noodle soup. Great atmosphere, its a small spot so get there early.

KxR29jYm-QJZCvohu4FrQw.text: Hands down the best beef noodle soup in Vegas. The prices are more than fair and the portions are large. The restaurant is clean and the employees are helpful. Although, one time they did mess up my to go order, they replaced it with the correct items when I went back. The food still carries the rating to 5 stars.

MEEe_PzPdMpNC2ypW-F8WA.text: so it was my first time coming here after hearing all this great stuff. coming in i had high expectations seeing them hand make the noodles. when my order came out i first took a sip out of the broth and it was pretty good and all the meats were tender. the downfall would have to be the noodles. it doesn't feel like ramen noodles but instead Italian pasta noodles

HrZfeLzZfXvKljXDra5h0w.text: So we had hi hopes for this place but it fell short of our expectations. The good part is that the food is not horrible BUT the noodles are very greasy and that's kinda their specialty. We thought the noodles would be magical ! We also tried there most popular soup. I'm sure the soup tasted like it was supposed too, but it just wasn't for us. The broth just had a very interesting flavor I could not handle. It was hard to communicate with our server due to a language Barrier which also made things difficult. Lastly , the place could have been a lil bit cleaner .

IeEF0_zj9d7HLDZ8PoYTOQ.text: Love this place! The customer service is outstanding. We've eaten here since they opened and have never had a negative experience out of numerous visits. We usually get the beef pancakes, the won tons, the fried rice and Mongolian Beef noodles. We have also tried the brisket knife cut noodles and still loved everything. Everything we've tried here has been fantastic.

R1mM-g7199GK0xh_S3QgIg.text: Freshly Made noodles as you order.   It is entertaining g to watch the chefs behind the glass wall node preparing the meals and especially to watch them make the noodles similar to the way that Italians make their pasta.  Kids will be mesmerized as will most adults.  It is an art form.  Being able to taste the difference in freshly made noodles from other restaurants will keep us returning to Magic Noodle. Must be the magic in the fresh ingredients recipe.

8f93E9ppv-BqTSmvprk-Kw.text: It was absolutely disgusting. Their food wasn't good at all. It wasn't worth driving here I regret going here I felt like I was going to vomit. My vote is a total thumbs down  I hated it there take my advice and don't go there please!!!!!!! I'm doing you and who ever you are bringing there. UGH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Adm2fSQNPcub7rGsl5SYvQ.text: When I tell you.... the pork pancakes..... and the veggie ones delicious. I really wanted to give them 5 stars.... but the veggies on the kung pao chicken were to thick cut. However, the flavor was definitely on point. Now the service was another story. It was ok at first.. we were eating our meal when the waiter came over and insisted we pay. He didn't even ask if we wanted anything else. He said it was shift change. Ok... I understand that, but it appeared that he came looking for a tip. Sorry but now you're not getting one. Other then that.... everything was good.

6KUhJd6Iy8knxEDv94_wYg.text: Great service; tasty food and always very consistent in flavor, texture and presentation...

VM2ppXXoxBzZjxm4IG325w.text: Best place EVER ! I've been eating here for the past couple of months and still amazed from the  flavors freshness and super great service ! So happy it's by my house :)

tPRkn0HcfDSUntYdRRfBAw.text: Really good food and you get to watch them make their "magic noodles"  food was 5 star but seating is limited and waits are long sometimes so the 4 star rating.

aoTXrSzOuGRB-PvYfm0HvA.text: Kung Pao noodles are awesome!! Only 2 servers both times I've been here - be prepared to wait. Iced tea is in cans.

dx2UZ4xwWmBXgxT-2slgMQ.text: This is a pretty good place to eat some noodles. You can eat in or take out. Sometimes the soup can be a bit salty to some, but for the most part I think it is perfect. They usually aren't to busy with no wait. All of their noodles and soup are homemade and taste wonderful.

FYoFOZsQC8qzYp6C4OpsVw.text: This place definitely surprised me. The last time I had noodles this good, I was in Chinatown, LA at this place called Lao Tao, but I'm not comparing them two at all. They both have their unique styles of Chinese pulled noodles. This is one of the best noodle places in Vegas. Forget Chinatown in Las Vegas, this place is located discretely in the Summerlin area. But nevermind that, the food is main star. I had the spicy cold beef as an appetizer and then the Szechuan beef brisket soup. The cold beef was delicious, you can definitely taste the pepper and it numbs your mouth a little. The soup was the best; definitely try the knife cut style noodles. They were chewy but still tender. They absorbed the rich broth and the beef brisket was so tender it melted. The soup might of said spicy but it was not too overwhelming. I had just about every last drop. Feeling chilly outside or just wanna feel warm ? Come to this place. But this place is so good I'm still going to come here on the hot summer days of Vegas because it's that amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Szechuan Beef Soup

oGQ1F3gYYpYxf-xHmQU6zQ.text: Tried the Mongolian beef chow mein as it was recommended by the waitress. It was amazing. Love the decoration too. Will definitely be back!

HwU4_SW0juToGWCJrc7y7A.text: I tried Magic Noodle three times ordering 6 different dishes. Every dish I ordered was really sparse on the meat. The noodles were better than ok I would rate them a solid B but the meat was the cheapest meat possible and very little of it.

GxopZ2dvjFbEnumXgUMrOA.text: The food is amazing! The noodles are fresh and tasty. My children are not fond of Chinese food, but begged to eat at the Magic Noodle again. We love the vegetable chow mein and fish Noodle soup with pickled vegetables. The staff is very friendly, and always keep your water cup full.

VGQK40NxcoRiLjvfqno_Ag.text: Excellent food. Mongolian beef was spicy and flavorful. Big portions... I swear I ate and ate and the plate didn't seem to go down (I think that is the magic they are referring to in the name!) . Give this place a try. You will be glad you did!

-DChMc5FsXljkJYvVRS3sA.text: Great addition to the Southwest! The house pancakes with pork and the beef brisket noodle soup were both fantastic. Neither of us liked the Mongolian chow mein- way too sweet. We ordered with the knife cut noodles with the chow mein and those were awesome- really great texture. Will definitely be back to try those in another dish!

3xEstZzGcIhkhhxvM01TAg.text: I would of gave it @ least 4 stars, but... Let's get to the food, hands down delicious. Not one complaint! We tried 4 or 5 different items and needless to say outstanding! Now the 3 stars!  My wife saw the servers take a glass of water from a table being cleaned, and pour it into another glass for a new customer. Then, I remembered I wasn't offered anything to drink so I asked for a Coke, and I was surprised to see she brought me a Coke in a can...room temperature! Disgusting! Other than that, eat the food, not the drinks!

wqBhuJSp1nf_WNHPqeDzAw.text: Good place!  It was packed when we got there, but they were still pretty quick.  Fun to watch them make your dish too.

yPJmdQpa9DPD4oAASmqe9Q.text: My boyfriend and I have been here numerous times and have never been disappointed. The flavor is so good on any plate i have tried. The portions are so big and so delicious. So good!! Love coming here!!

I had the Szechuan beef brisket noodle and my mother had the chow mein, and both were delicious. Everything here is definitely flavorful! & the service was great! This place is worth the try!

BjicQcm876IgFw4-ICK8EA.text: Enjoyed our first experience very much! My favorites were the veggie pancake, pickled cabbage and Mongolian beef chow mein. It is fun to watch the noodles being made. Great service and reasonable prices.

kttl4rlW59_xejaS7bgcXg.text: Freshly hand pulled noodles in an inviting, cozy atmosphere. The service was awesome too. Go here ASAP. You won't regret it!

kl-iJTMR8F7skxVMd7h0kA.text: First time trying this place and it was SO good! Very nice servers and quick service. You are able to sit at the bar and watch them make the noodles which is cool entertainment. I had the Mongolian beef chow mein which was so flavorful and spicy. Had leftovers for such a good price too. Def coming back!

4Zb2OZLAzpVoV1_9ZJcGcg.text: I love this place. Quaint, clean and prompt service. I usually call in my order for pick up and it takes only about 15mins. The noodles don't disappoint. We have gotten the tomato and egg, the chicken and mushroom and the beef brisket noodle dishes. All were flavorful and the portions are generous. I highly recommend this place if you want a hang over cure, a quick and filling meal or something yummy to keep you warm in cold weather.

UjNoZ2mu_bjSD73CF1MR9w.text: This place is fantastic!  Great service and very delicious Chinese noodles!  We've been here 5 times in 2 weeks.

DuqEz-27K5xaObh1bfUUyA.text: The place is clean.friendly staff.u can watch how the noodles are made.must try beef burrito and beef brisket noodles

hjEMDhezMqggdSjMgz1FwQ.text: Man this place! Close to home so we no longer need to drive to China town to get some good Chinese food. Noodles are made in house right there so you can stare and watch and make them feel awkward, but they don't haha. Very awesome and polite staff. We've dined in and taken out numerous times and not have any issues with them.  We usually order fried rice and some noodle soup. Beef brisket is my Go To soup there. Meat always tender and of course juicy, cuz well, it's in soup. I've eaten the Shrimp, Chicken and Beef fried rice, all depends on what I want determines what I'll eat. Any of these choices or even the house fried rice is good as well  The place can get busy so plan accordingly

w8xXk2QC8zuCrQrpuGo_cQ.text: The Magic Noodle is my personal place of delicious noodles worship. I'm absolutely obsessed with fresh noodles and, mind you, I'm the toughest critic when it comes to evaluating them.  These guys just hit it right on the spot. The noodles are hand pulled per order, so make sure you take a seat next to the Chef's island, to get the spectacular view of how your noods will be prepared.   The menu is relatively compact yet there are quite a bit of options to choose from. Here's my typical order:   Onion pancakes - 5.95 USD (deliciously crisp and full of buttery goodness)   And/or (depending on how hungry I am) spicy dumplings Szechuan style - 6.50 USD (bursting with flavours, boldly manifesting spices)  Szechuan beef brisket noodle soup - 8.95 USD (you will here the mouth watering aroma of the soup when it will just start making the way to your table - it's the God of all the soups to me, with perfectly chewy fresh pulled noodles).  Parking could be a bit of the hurdle during dinner time but, trust me, the food is absolutely worth the hassle.

A7fsw_HE6WmD_U5RCONOXw.text: Really good, great service! Definitely recommend! We got the garlic pork, wonton, beef roll and the spicy beef noodle soup with wide noodle, all really good!

Owners, please hire some more people to help your employees they deserve it.

dErofDu2WqG-knFyAZAfWQ.text: I've ordered food to-go several times but this is my first time dining in. It was a busy Sunday night, we had a party of 4 and waited about 15 minutes. We got our drinks and everything but what annoyed me was when I was trying to flag a server down to take our order. I think the servers was just feeling the rush and had tunnel vision but I had to get up and get someone after waving my arms 5 times. That's where they lost the star.  The food is great! I love the braised beef noodles, spicy wontons, and spicy Szechuan dumplings. Delicious broth and perfect amount of heat in the dumplings. My siblings got the Mongolian Beef Chow Mein and it has a bit of a kick with plenty of beef and veggies.  I might stick with to-go after what happened. We'll see...

8YK3JojvzQEWCJEIUX_vKg.text: This is new to us so we decided to give it a try. They make noodles by hand, which is always better. The noodles always come out chewy, which is how I like it. My daughter tried the beef brisket noodle soup. Beef was tender. Broth was tasty and the noodles were cooked perfectly. I had the Dan dan noodles with cucumber, peanuts and ground pork. Sauce is a bit spicy. Hubby tried the Mongolian beef chow mein. I tried some of the noodles and that was really good. I think I like it better than the dan dan noodles. We had the House special pancakes filled with glass noodles, green onions, diced tofu and mushrooms. The pancake was browned perfectly. And very tasty. We will definitely go back

TdrV7O70j8g22Z3bij8hJQ.text: Wow this place is pretty damn good everything we had from pancakes to burritos were amazing. Will definitely come back and try the other stuff they got. Service too is awesome.

2ori8S06l7YJkX3Jh4UqCg.text: I've been addicted to this place lately, and I can't stop coming back! They sure know how to work their magic. The hand-pulled noodles are sooooo good, and the texture is just perfect, not too chewy nor too soft. If you prefer chewier, you can opt for the knife-shaved or the flat, wide noodles. You can also watch them make your magical noodles fresh behind the glass in their open kitchen.  My favorite items include:  -Szechuan beef noodle  -spicy pork ribs noodle -Dan Dan noodle -Mongolian beef chow mein  -House special fried rice -spicy wonton -homemade style cucumber -sweet and sour black fungus salad (yes that says fungus) -Chinese beef burrito   -steamed chicken with chili sauce    The food and service are amazing, and the prices are very reasonable. Heck, you even get a show out of it. What more can you ask for?

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy beef noodle soup with knife shaved noodles.
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Have you seen such thick noods?!
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lan Zhou noodles

eu-mfnc2ei_Q3YhpEZhheA.text: -CRIES- I wish we had one of these in Texas.   You can't beat the service here. We were a group of 9 girls and walked in around 3:30pm, most of the tables were taken and some workers were even on their lunch break. Those employees, got up from their table, cleaned it and then added it on to a few tables just so we could fit 9 at one table. Talk about awesome service.   They quickly took our orders, our server even paused a few times to joke with us and explain some dishes.   Honestly I can't say enough about this place. The kitchen was in a rectangle glass box in the corner so you could even watch the chefs handmake the noodles!

YZuxi7sWh7c7M6c3ROAu5A.text: This restaurant makes their own hand pulled noodles and it's flour noodles. I watched the guy through this glass window and it was very amusing watching him throw it up in the air and twirl it all around and pound it on his table. I couldn't download the video on here. I got the shrimp and vegetable with broccoli chow mein and it was really good. I normally don't like flour noodles because I prefer pan fried egg noodles because flour noodles are slightly thicker and usually the sauce is too much but their sauce wasn't too salty and it was flavorful. So they make their noodles three styles. Original, flat and knife cut. The knife cut is thicker than the original. So I got my chow mein with the original style noodles. They also have noodle soups and and some appetizers there and some salads and sides. Not a very big menu. The restaurant is small and just with 1 or 2 waiters and customer service is good. I would come back again and try their soup and other items on their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and vegetable chow mein with broccoli

5OWKU4RL0nLDtPyTgFgCMw.text: First and foremost: food = I was prepared for what to expect as I have been to Shang Artisan Noodle and Noodle Man.  I learned from last time that knife cut noodle is cool but original or rounded noodle is more of my favorite texture and just tastes better to me.  I ordered the Szechuan Beef Brisket with original pulled noodle and I was very pleased overall.  I think if you aren't familiar with this style of asian noodle soup, you might be surprised expecting ramen house flavors (miso, shoyu, shio) or udon.  This flavoring is similar to the Chinese 5-Spice that you might taste at asian buffet offerings.  I like the spicy aspect of it (Szechuan) and the beef was fork tender - or should I say chopstick tender.   I loved the beef pancake, tastes like a deep fried wonton with a hint of black bean flavoring, not sure if they include that.  Mongolian Beef ChowMein was a bit on the sweet side and better for those who don't want the soupy noodles.  Overall I liked the food and go back to try again.   Ambiance/Service: maybe because it is a new and upcoming place but it was a bit of a long wait.  Also the seating itself is very limited so they can't seat as many.  It was perplexing why they would have a party of 1 be sat at one of the larger booths enough for 4, but seat a group of 2 or more at the counter...that was the only part of the experience I thought was disappointing.  Overall, service was friendly and the upside to sitting at the counter was to be up close and personal with the noodle pullers/makers and chefs - a little insider!

sIJieeZLrLzOvRTbTENDfQ.text: The food is always great!! I usually get the spicy beef brisket noodle soup, spicy won tons or chicken chow mein. Both are great choices. The staff is nice and prices are great. This place is definitely worth a try !

HQMenRG3c-tMlfuuArFR-g.text: Fantastic noodle dishes and soup bowls!  I would come back daily if I was closer to this place.  The spicy Szechuan wonton appetizer is amazing!

JCjQNUf1uewkhoqC8qhxyA.text: 1. I love this location - especially since there is pretty decent parking and it is close to my home.  2. The food was delicious and very fresh.  3. Our waitress did not have the best English but thankfully, we speak Chinese and the owner or manager was also very helpful.   Our beef noodle soups came out fairly quickly and we also enjoyed some cold side dishes and spicy wontons. In addition, the stir fried pork belly and string bean noodles took a little longer to come out. I would have also liked the string beans to be cooked a little more, they seemed to be steamed and then stir fried in.   My family greatly enjoyed their noodle soups and the side dishes. I loved the spicy wontons and it's always great to see any place making fresh noodles in their restaurant. I give extra props since it is a difficult and tedious task to do.   The pricing is extremely reasonable and their menu reminds me of the Noodle Man and Shang's. However, I really did enjoy this restaurant and will definitely be back, especially since it is so close to home.   We went when it first opened and I'm positive it has gotten even better since we have been there. We look forwarded to going back in the future!

VY7SLNVc7xYNhiWYMwh8mQ.text: Nice traditional Chinese noodle with cheap price and good service. I definitely will come back later since it remind me the taste of my hometown in China. Strongly recommend the beef stew ramen and the chicken appetizer.

WE28KDjMQytpsjVkyH5zzg.text: We got there and stood waiting for about 30 minutes...standing the entire amount because they didn't have a sitting area. k99Tpm1Aj08M1WncmQzOug.text: I have been searching for a new noodle place here in Vegas that compared to the chinese noodle house I loved in New York City; I have found my new favorite noodle joint here at Magic Noodle House.  I came with my dad and nana after being recomended this place from one of my coworkers. The staff were fast to seat us and to give us time to look over the menu; our waiter Alex was fantastic during our entire stay. He made sure to check on us and give us time for questions if we needed, once we put our orders in they were fast to get us our sodas. I asked for a fork for my nana since she wasnt very good at chopsticks, and Alex made sure to give us a fork for evrry dish so she would alwayd have a fresh clean fork!  I got the Pork Belly and Bean Sprout noodle dish with the wide flat noodles (minus the bean sprouts), we also got the house fried rice and mongolian beef noodles.   It took a few minutes for them to cook our food but we were able to enjoy the scenery of the joint; simple modern decor, nothing flashy or overwhelming but it allowed us to focus in on the kitchen which is surrounded by glass and you can watch the chefs stretch fresh home made noodles! So amazing to watch!  Our food came out and the portions were HUGE! so much flavour on all the dishes and my dad was so impressed with the fried rice especially. I almost cried from joy over how big my noodles were and how tender the pork belly was; seriously the best I have had EVEN WHEN I WAS IN NYC!   Not only will I be coming back to get some pictures for this review, I will be dragging every person I know to this noodle house to ensure this business succeeds and stays here forever.  If possible please open another location in North Las Vegas, until then TOTALLY WORTH THE DRIVE.

Jebvzu3YFwbcS37LimNpng.text: Didn't realize how popular this noodle joint was - ended up randomly choosing it as a destination point for my friend and me, and I was incredibly surprised at how busy the small noodle shop was.   The Magic Noodle is located in a pretty busy plaza with Infusion Tea Lounge and Makai Pacific, but parking is super easy to find (thank you, Vegas!). This shop is quite tiny, with a lot of tables crammed into the dining area for max capacity. Noodles are made by hand - they have an open kitchen, which allows for you to see what the chefs are doing. If you happen to come right when they're pulling the noodles, you're in for a treat!   The menu is not too extensive - soup noodles, sauce noodles, stir-fried noodles, fried rice, and appetizers. And they do have vegetarian options! All noodle options can be hand pulled (original style or flat-wide style) or be knife-cut.   I went with the my-go choice - the beef brisket noodle with the noodles being flat-wide style ($8.95). Not spicy at all and the broth had so much flavor! I loved that there was a good amount of cilantro sprinkled on top, and I was surprised at how many pieces of beef brisket I kept ladling up! Beef was tender and incredibly flavorful. Loved the richness of the broth; while it was a little on the oily side, it still tasted incredible. But the noodles definitely took this dish and made it infinitely better. I absolutely love thick/flat noodles in soup broth, and The Magic Noodle made it so well! Super chewy but the noodles helped retain flavor from the broth, making me want to eat more and more. I had enough for dinner that night because the dish felt like it was pretty endless.   My friend ordered the tomato and egg noodle soup - I think he wasn't a fan of the over easy egg on top of the bowl of noodles, but he said the flavor was good and he liked the texture of the noodles.   We also split the sweet and sour cucumbers ($4.95). I thought the appetizer had a good amount of acidity from the vinegar, and the garlic definitely packed a punch. It wasn't out of the world amazing though since my aunt makes a pretty mean cucumber dish herself. It was refreshing and a good way to start the meal. I don't think I'd order this again though.   Workers are super friendly and helpful. People are in and out pretty quickly, so you don't have to wait too long for a table.   tl;dr - love the noodles that they make at The Magic Noodle. It's a little away from the Strip, but definitely worth the drive. Big fan of the beef brisket noodle with the wide-flat noodle! And prices are very affordable, which makes it all the more better.

MFu4gQ14C5sZHN1O5EZ4Qg.text: I had been told by all my noodle loving friends that I'd never go anywhere else after I had magic noodle.  I think they were right.  I walked in was seated quickly despite how busy they were.  My waiter took my order quickly.  I had the Dan dan noodles with a side of spicy dumplings.  The noodles were great and the dumplings had a very tasty level of heat.  It's cool watching the kitchen make the noodles fresh as you wait.  I paid my bill and was in and out with a great meal in less than 20 min.  All for a very reasonable price.  Wonderful spot!

r8zkaV2_1HZ_C3r8qzutzA.text: I've been meaning to come to this spot for a while and sorry I didn't go sooner! From the service to the food was so good and I'm pleasantly surprised.   We ordered: Spicy wontons - enough meat and tender wontons great spices   Sichuan beef brisket- brisket was soft and falling apart delicious, noodles were bouncy and chewy the broth was perfectly seasoned  Sweet and sour noodles- this was pretty sweet for my liking but my husband finished it anyway. So that was good.  Cucumbers- these were great full of garlic and just the right amount of salt. I added vinegar but that's just the way I like it

1yaaaBe8M-WTyFpB0r6Eug.text: I learned about this place from Philip T's noodle shots.  Never have I felt the chewiness of noodles by simply looking at photos, but somehow The Magic Noodle pulled it off.   On a recent trip w/ friends to Vegas, we drove about 15 min. from The Strip to come eat here. At 8pm, there were others in line. There's no room inside, so we all waited outside in the 100 degrees LV evening. About 20 min later, it was our turn.   I ordered the Szechuan spicy beef brisket noodle. Great broth flavor and not too spicy, very tolerable. The beef was so tender and almost melts in your mouth. I'd def get it again.   Also tried the spicy beef shank & tenderloin as an appetizer.  Nice flavor, just a little spicy.  Can't speak for the others in our party but the consensus was everybody liked it.   Noodles are hand pulled or knife cut. There's a glass with a view into the kitchen to see them perform their 'magic'. The results; the noodles are perfectly chewy and works so well with their flavorful broth. I would come back, but driving the distance and waiting in the heat is a small deterrent. But it's worth at least one visit.   Notes:  * Large shared parking lot * Put your name on the sign-in sheet as soon as you arrive.  * They close at 10pm, but even at 9, there's a short wait.  * While waiting outside, there are no seats.

ZVUG0tMw6kSqbx-NxyfiVw.text: A friend recently introduced me to Magic Noodle and after that first visit I was compelled to tell other friends about it and to start making return trips for lunch.  My recommendations after several visits include:  Appetizers:  I highly recommend the House Special Pancakes or the Spicy Wonton.  Or just get both.  You'll thank me later.  Soups:  I can definitely recommend the two I've tried so far:  Lan Zhou Noodle, and Chong Qing Style Spicy Noodle.  I need to be disciplined and try others as well, but both of these are so good, it's hard to force myself to give something else a try.  Even so, absolutely everything I've seen brought out looks tempting.  Now read on; you'll have some choices to make when you order:  Types of noodles.  All the noodles are hand made right there in the restaurant.  In fact, the magic happens right behind a glass wall separating diners from the kitchen, and it's pretty cool to watch as the noodles are being stretched/pulled by hand.  If you have kids, bring them--they'll be as fascinated as you are to watch.  When you order, you'll have the choice between original noodles, flat noodles, or knife cut.  They're all good, but give the knife cut noodles a try.  Rather than being uniform in shape, they're literally cut by hand and you'll end up with a variety of sizes and shapes in your broth.  The waiters will always be happy to recommend a noodle type deepening on the broth you're going to enjoy.    Types of broth.  Speaking of broth, ask the waiter to explain the varieties.  There are six or seven different broths available based on the various soups you chose.  You may want to focus on the broth when you order rather than just what's floating in it.  The staff is awesome!  They'll obviously talk to you about the menu, but one of the best things about everyone I've spoken with there is they seem genuinely excited about the restaurant.  Parking:  The Magic Noodle is in a storefront, and there's always sufficient parking available.  So many delicious choices and at a very reasonable price!  If you enjoy noodles and haven't tried Magic Noodles, treat yourself and add a Chinese noodle house to your noodle house options!

Cx5HBiKhOUseyQdjmuL_ww.text: We tried the Lan Zhou noodle and the Fish Noodle w/ Pickled Veg last night, and I highly recommend trying the fish noodle. NP8pAO2t1Pn3udNEsCR-bg.text: Before I thought about writing a review for this joint, I wanted to visit this place several times. So, after four visits, I finally feel like I have an unbiased opinion of this establishment. This place is an outstanding combination of great prices, quality and service. Every visit has been consistent for me. Looking at the menu, every item is priced very well and you get a lot of food for your money. You won't ever feel like you are overpaying for anything.   When you receive whatever item you order, the quality is there. Everything is so tasty and fresh. You can even get a sense of that the moment you walk in, as you smell the fresh dough being made. A little more detail about the food... you have a choice of three noodle types: hand pulled, knife cut or flat noodles. I've tried all three and they are so chewy, which is exactly how I love my noodles. Many of the items are spicy as well, so if you need to have them tone it down, then simply ask. Their appetizers are also very tasty. Just try one at random.  This place is a bit on the small side, but I like that kind of "hole in the wall" feel to it. Unlike other holes in walls, you get to see the cooks in action from beginning to end, so enjoy the free noodle pulling show! Because the place is small, it's usually very crowded so you should expect some waiting time especially if you go during peak dining hours. The servers are always hustling and making sure every table is covered. They seem to have a joint effort system there, where all servers cover all tables evenly to insure that all customers are attended to properly. I've never had to ask for a water refill and I've never had to repeatedly ask for anything. They bus the tables themselves and have everything ready for the next customer to sit right away. Very impressive. On one of my visits, I had the privilege of meeting the owner "Andy". I've seen him actually pull noodles himself on one occasion. I think that says a lot about him as an owner.  I think this place is a definite must-try. You get a lot of bang for your buck here. I'm determined to try everything on their menu! Oh! Don't forget to sign in as soon as you arrive!

QxKcoZNpQfBk9byzp9uBzw.text: I'm weak when it comes to Spicy food, but they're spicy dishes are the best. They're always supper busy and there's always a wait. Family and friends drive up from Cali and they always ask to come here. We eat here about twice a month and try to bring friends and guests here when we can, usually we take it to go since there's always a long wait.   If you take it to go ask for extra spicy oil on the side, for some reason they're to-go dishes are less spicy than when you dine in.

pUynIOA2o6Zom4v0e753kA.text: Five is excessive, but they're so nearby, so filling, and so tasty that I gotta give it up.   When I see the words "Spicy beef noodle soup" c4 and  fresh hand pulled noodles", I get more excited than I should, and fear I will never burn off the calories to justify my noodle habit.   One caveat: I think the soup, at least the spicy one, goes better with the hand pulled noodles than the knife shaved. I enjoy a doughy noodle every now and then but it's almost like they soak up too much spice.   If for some reason, you come to magic noodle, and don't want noodles. The house fried rice and appetizers are bomb too...detour  Literally (not literally but almost literally) everything tastes better with the chili oil from the spicy Wontons. I know it's just(?) chili oil but maybe it's the flavor the wontons leave behind that make it taste better than straight up chili oil. I like to use it for as many different non soup items as I can. End detour  Seeing the word burrito gave me pause but the burritos and pancakes (A3 was my choice) at this Chinese restaurant are quite good. The sweet and sour cucumber, B5 are a refreshing treat as well. I could easily imagine coming here splitting a bowl of noodles (I haven't tried it yet so I don't know if there's an associated fee) and splitting two or three appetizers the cucumbers might be necessary if only to make me feel less guilty about all the carbs (bonus that they taste good).

75_01apmXgbBix8UeQ5OAw.text: So first time going here. It was a Friday night and when we walked in there were no tables. We had to add our name to a list to be seated. So that was a sign that this place was good.  We were seated probably in about a 20 minute time frame and we had a party of 3 so it was pretty reasonable and it was about 8:30 at night. We had a front row seat to the noodle making as well and our 7 year old loved that. The waiter was on top of everything and thanks to yelp we saved a lot of time and already knew what we wanted.   I got the brisket noodle bowl soup , daughter got chicken fried rice and husband got he Mongolian beef chow mein  I was kind of disappointed in the brisket because it was sooooo fatty, like extremely fatty very large chunks. All white pieces . And that's my only complaint. So for that bowl being all the rave that was the only let down. Noodles and broth were amazing. Chicken fried rice was absolutely amazing. The Mongolian beef chow mein was great and perfect amount of spice .  The service was very fast and the mason jar waters are a great touch. Will definitely be returning here again and can't wait to try other dishes!

S_kqDLJdNzA_X8mVxM_jdQ.text: Came here with my fiancee a few days ago, wasn't too busy for an early dinner time on a weekday, no wait for the 2 of us. She is a Chinese food "connoisseur" as an LA native  and have her stamp of approval to Magic Noodle! Tasty hand pulled noodles, and really tender beef Might not be as well known as some of the other noodle places but just as good, if not better, in our book!

rlf7Taiu8yYI4qaXZ-7Miw.text: The food is good, but I wish they offered something aside from noodle dishes (crazy considering the tittle, but let me explain). I ordered kung pao chicken and it was basically chicken mixed with noodles which I wasn't expecting, but it was pretty good regardless. Ive found that most dishes are heavy on sauces. I've gone several times, but would be there more frequently if they had protein dishes with rice as an option.  The restaurant itself is a small, modern place with adequate dining space, but the staff is awesome. Everyone I spoke with every time was friendly, inviting, and accommodating.

xh6NRljz9eTOsnnf2Px7uw.text: Awesome!!! Fast service and were on top of filling up waters and drinks.  Noodles came out super quick and was delicious. Great tasting noodles, like really good.   Price was super cheap.  Also got the pork belly onion pancake thing and it was amazing

LXaBFodmz2VS4HWJdsbA7g.text: Such a cool place! My husband and I were looking for some great dinner and we started looking on yelp and found "The Magic Noodle" we were so happy and excited to try something new to us. The noodles are hand made there so they taste so fresh and yummy! They melt in your mouth  good job!  I highly recommend this place

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Making some fresh noodles! Good job!!

pxMHIBoaCXpnI27IbSXJbg.text: The first I have to say they use laminate plastic.please google it is no good for over 160 degree.The taste is good.noodle is good.busy over there.it is worth to try.I ask for hot water but the waitress say they do not serve hot water.All they give ice water.

i76lGmC9pdbDcut4ZkiuEQ.text: This is probably my favorite noodle house in town. Delicious food and best service. I would like to recommend it

Y2fSRhS4NNdVrsYfRco1uA.text: IFast and attentive, friendly service. Filled up on a weekend lunch pretty quick, you know it must be that good.   The chili wontons ARE a definite must. The wontons have the perfect texture, not soggy at all and you can taste the meatiness of the filling without the heat overpowering the dish. Would order two of these next time. Don't let the chili in the name stop you from getting them!  Also ordered the szechuan beef brisket noodle soup and the reviews weren't kidding, the beef is super tender!! Plus there were plenty of it. We had it with the original noodles and I'm not too particular about noodles but the bf said the soup doesn't really hold onto the noodles well but it's a soupy soup you know. Cooked al dente. Broth was also light and not too oily which was surprising. No msg here!  And last, we had the combination chow mein. Again the sauce doesn't stick well on the noodles but the flavor was all there. Simple but satisfying, would like it to be a tad bit more saucy but that's my preference. Lots of veggies and meat (shrimp, beef, chicken, spam?). Good enough for two people too.   Definitely coming back again, especially for those wontons!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Szechuan beef brisket noodle soup
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination chow mein
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili wontons

nTXi-B-6KnwvnX1hmZiYig.text: Noodle Man, Shang's, move over. There's a new player in town and it's better.   I got the beef brisket noodle soup with shaved noodles. I couldn't be happier with my decision. The shaved noodles are perfect to my preference. Great chewiness, not too long, not too short. The broth was delicious but I've had better. The beef was so tender and just melted in my mouth. Hands down, there isn't a beef brisket noodle soup in Vegas that can compare.  My wife got the black fungus and the chicken and mushroom soup with the wide noodles. The broth was pretty good, there were a ton of mushrooms and the chicken wasn't dry as I was half expecting, especially for white meat. The wide noodles had great texture but they were extremely long and it just felt like the noodle was too overwhelming for the dish and took away from the flavor. I would personally prefer a thinner noodle that would be able to absorb more flavor and broth. The black fungus was awesome. The last time I had it was probably in my childhood when my parents ordered it somewhere. Definitely something I wouldn't have ordered on my own. It had great crunch and texture with a nice sweet and sour flavor. My wife loved it, we would probably order it again.   I looked over and saw that someone had ordered the pork belly and string beans noodle stir fry. It looked so on point! My wife hates fatty meat and even she was eyeing that dish. That and/or the Mongolian chow mein is on the to try list for our next visit. And there WILL be a next visit. Probably tomorrow. It was that good. I'm excited to try some more apps.

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apparently the beef brisket noodles were pretty good.
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Mushroom with wide noodles
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black fungus. Try it. Delicious.

YNC1ViUqyHR_BN-LBUHuPA.text: After seeing countless mesmerizing photos on Unlokt and LasVegasFill's IG , I finally tried this place out. I ordered the following:  Appetizers: - Wontons in chili oil (not too spicy and the wontons skins were fresh and soft.  The meatball inside was flavorful and juicy) - House Special Pancakes (slightly crispy and the meat inside was juicy, but it made the pancake outside a little soggy. The vinegar that came with it was such a great dipping sauce.  I also used the chili oil from the wontons for this too)  Entree: - Szechuan Beef Brisket Noodle with the wide noodles (I personally like my pasta a little al dente and that's the texture of the wide noodles.  It's a little thicker, with slightly more chew.  The beef was tender and flavorful.  The soup base was sooo flavorful and not spicy.  Don't be deterred by the all the chili oil-- it's not bad at all)  Service: Their staff was welcoming and friendly.  Great service every time I visited and you can tell the server was really passionate about their food.  I don't know how you can ignore some of these noodle pics.  Try this place out!

jjNbsDScrA9kQvtEXreRVQ.text: Great food and services Everyone here are very friendly. !!!!!!Just moved to the area. Looking for good food outside the strip. This noddle place is at Summerlin and Its  AAA+++ and highly recommend.  If you crave for good noodles ...yummy and food price.. definitely this place is for you.  We will be back... and bring our family and friends.

jFF8WguMbHAhi-mNcqLuGA.text: This place has amazing service and the wonton soup is so so good! It's a cozy place and enjoyed my experience there. Prices are decent and food is tasty with their hand made pulled noodles right in front of you!

Gj33jaxeFXwX752-mllR_w.text: Great noodles made from scratch. They make them right in front of you! Portions are ok.

ADL8wxq0bW_APXCqmR0yww.text: Really great authentic noodle place. If you're into hand stretched noodles this is the place to go. I went here two days in a row. That's how good it is! Haha

We had C4 and C7 which were both fantastic and spicy. The noodles were perfect and taste of both were distinctly different. We will be back again- soon!

AGlh15T6553L6zt2nT9BVA.text: This was is really delicious. I love that you can get different type of noodles for your soup. The staff is really nice and helpful in choosing when you're unsure of what to get.   I'll definitely be back or maybe just order some to go one night!

PyzbylM0gtIU1WnwTJG_Qg.text: This place is so good. I crave their garlic chicken noodles regularly. They hand pull your noodles to order so everything they make is super fresh and delicious.  They have a wide variety of dishes with noodles, so it may be hard to pick what you want. Their fried rice isn't that great, but the noodles and appetizers are amazing.

Kd2s4BY8rDXG_vdhksdScg.text: Can I just tell you... you'll be so satisfied! I've been waiting so long to try this place after following them on Instagram and seeing all these post of their chefs hand pulling noodles. It was so so sooooo satisfying watching them make the noodles while slurping on their delicious bowl of noodles. I got their chicken with mushroom and the guys got some of their spicier broth which was freaken amazing!! We ordered their spicy wontons and the beef tripe as an appetizer. The waiter definitely recommended the tripe and he was totally right! He said he gets it all the time on the side during his lunch. The spice level was perfect and the flavor was amazing. The spicy wonton, I couldn't eat but the boys were raving on how it's probably the best one they've had by far because the chili oil that it was soaked it was just perfect. The noodles were tender and chewy + all the broths were just simply satisfying. I pretty much got all the broth splattered all over my dress after I was done haha. I ate like I was a toddler.. haha! I didn't care because it was so good. I can't wait to try their stir fry noodles next. Until next time! Happy eating my fellow Yelpers!

BoQe1Aoh06caADZA-q-vHw.text: This. Place. Is. Everything.  The noodle wars in Vegas are in full swing and Magic Noodle is a clear winner in my book, and of just because it's within walking distance to my castle.  The noodles have the right bite, the broth has the the right richness, and the meat is plentiful, fatty and like pure, hot, sex. Yeah...I went there.  I'm referring to the "Szechuan Beef Noodles". Get the regular hand pulled.  Hungover? Well...let me just say that this brought me back to life after St. Patrick's Day. I had died. I think. So there's that, too.  The spicy wontons are great too, just add some extra chili oil that is at your table. Unless you're a wuss.

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FBtDhQ_dooGWskfB-sdLBg.text: I saw photos of this place on my social media, and added it to my list of places to try. I came here with my girlfriends on a recent trip to Las Vegas. This place is located off strip, which is nice because we usually stay on strip. We came here for lunch, and there was a bit of a wait but we didn't wait too long for a table for 4. I had the spicy beef noodle soup with wide noodles, and it was delicious. The broth had the right amount of spice and was very flavorful. The beef was really tender and fatty, which I love. The beef was just delicious. And the noodles had a good amount of bite. My girls had regular noodles and the knife cut noodles, and we all agreed the wide noodles were the best. I made the right choice, haha. The other noodles were still good, though. It was fun watching them pull the noodles. Even watching them make the knife cut noodles was pretty cool. We also had the spicy won tons and beef wrap. SO. GOOD. Yum. I highly recommend this place if you're looking for a relatively inexpensive and delicious meal off the strip. It was a very satisfying meal.

bd-yQvMIdNu_41nJ1tgJEg.text: After a long night of being at EDC, my friends and I were looking for something soupy and warm to help rejuvenate our souls a bit before heading back out for day 2. Walking into the small restaurant to say that we had nine people with us, the server laughed and told us we can either split up into two booths (five minute wait) or wait until the center table finishes (which they just sat down and just received their waters). We agreed to splitting up because the booths were next to each other anyways. The restaurant seemed clean and you can see the man behind the window pulling the noodles. Imagine doing that all day long everyday, what a work out.  There were a lot of items on the menu that had a little chili pepper next to it representing that it's spicy, but since I can't handle spicy, I ordered a plain bowl of wontons. My boyfriend and my friends all ordered different types of spicy noodles (my non-asian friend surprisingly liked his bowl of flat noodles even though it was new and completely unexpected from what he believed he had ordered). My wonton soup came out first after a few minutes of ordering, even before the beef roll appetizers that we had ordered - which was a bit weird because I didn't want to eat before everyone else at the table and my wontons were basically cooled by the time everyone else got their food. The beef rolls were alright, it was literally a little piece of meat stuffed into some type of dough/wrapping that got fried. The wonton soup was average. The noodle soups that everyone else didn't really amaze them in anyway, it was good but not a WOW factor. Also, as I've told, you shouldn't be afraid to order extra spicy which was what my friends did and they still didn't think that it was spicy enough.  I would stop by here again if I was a local, it's a good cheap meal. The bill came out to only $14 a person and that included 20% tip!

gY_oCa15mC1kXW6bSOA3wQ.text: Wow, what a great noodle place.  We drove out to this area just to eat here. The first thing I noticed what how small this place is. It is a tiny restaurant in an unassuming strip mall. We got there at the end of the lunch rush on a weekday and had to wait, but it was worth it.   We got the chicken and mushroom noodles and the spicy beef Szechuan. We also had the spicy won tons for an appetizer. All of it was delicious. It was all great but the noodles was the star of the show, here. I'm assuming that the noodles are all hand made in house. You can see a guy making noodles in the window to the kitchen. We had good service, but keep in mind that it is tight seating. We also had canned sodas instead of fountain drinks (just an FYI, if that matters to you).  We will definitely be coming back!

Wp7zwFDVXdMi920lRY2C4A.text: Fresh noodles and authentic Szechuan soup! Finally was able to venture out to The Magic Noodle to try a delicious bowl of noodle soup.   If you follow their page on IG - every single photo of noodle pulls makes you want to drive over to this restaurant and inhale their entire menu. I had an appointment over on this side of town last month and stopped by for a quick lunch. I ordered the pickles as a cold app and the Szechuan Beef Brisket Noodle with knife shaved noodles.   The brisket was a little fatty for my liking (usually hit or miss at restaurants) but the broth was full of flavor, balanced with the perfect amount of heat. The fresh knife shaved noodles definitely did not disappoint!   The pickles never came out (sad day - the server did apologize for forgetting) so I will have to try another time. It's a bit far from where I live to frequent - however, if was ever in the area, I wouldn't be opposed to going back!

YeV6OVAipnT5-awQRLnQAw.text: Ran across this place by accident. But I'm glad that I did. Not only do they make fresh noodles but they have a transparent glass window, where you can watch them make and prepare the noodles. The food is fairly priced and the taste of the noodles and broth is excellent. I have officially replaced my love for ramen for my love of the spicy beef soup with knife cut noodles. This has become my new Noodle place and just like the name entails, these noodles are just magic!

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Szechuan spicy beef with Knife cut noodles

SO8M4Njz5H9SkLqdNGyEWQ.text: It's small inside so it's not fit for big groups. But the food there is amazing. The waitress recommended the original noodles over the flat ones but I prefer the flat ones. So it's basically up to preference. We ordered one with original and one with flat noodles. If you like thicker noodles then I suggest getting the flat noodles. The beef brisket was very tender and soft, probably the best beef brisket I've had. Besides from the beef, the soup had plenty of flavor. I also enjoyed the spicy wontons and would recommend it to everyone.

My positives:  Close vicinity to where I live The food quality and authenticity  The open noodle making window where you can see them make the fresh noodles They can do to go orders  My negatives:  It's too small or a space. We just stuck to our own individual bowls and I could barely finish. Hand pulled noodles were fresh, broth had so much flavors, plenty of meat!!! Everything in the bowl was perfect! At0wGVBcFCVof9BNF3H_nQ.text: Getting to try hand-pulled noodles in every place I visit is a fun goal to try! After an adventure in Red Rock Canyon with the girls, we decided to try this place out. Service was quick to accommodate 9 girls and order was efficient. The menu is not super extensive but I don't like a long-winded menu haha  I got the Dan Dan noodles, scallion pancakes, and a few more items that are escaping my memory. Everything was yummy but not nearly as spicy as I thought. The server was kind enough to offer chilis cooked in oil and I immediately jumped at the chance. The addition of the chilis definitely elevated the dishes.  I heard no complaints from any of the other ladies so I take it everyone enjoyed what they ordered. The noodle soup bowls are quite hefty so be mindful if you're going to be ordering a bunch!

kFWFAjyLzPwA9LE468zgqw.text: If you want to eat amazing noodles and other wonderful authentic Chinese food, this is the place.  How do i know? I have lived in China since 2007.  Great atmosphere and great service! Stephen is outstanding and everyone makes you feel welcome.

f1162_sP8MzkEoCNeJ2cEg.text: I've eaten at the Magic Noodle a handful of times but last night was probably the last time I eat here. The first few times I've eaten here were very good. I really like their knife cut noodles with anything. My personal favorites were the mongolian beef chow mein, burrito, and the beef brisket soup.   Last night when I came in, it was really busy and the service was soo slow. We had to wait a long time for them to take our order. The table we were sat at was dirty and the condiments on the table like soy sauce were so filthy and sticky.   The thing that did it for me was when they delivered our waters. It wasn't filled to the top and the ice was melted like it had been sitting out for a long time. The cup itself was so dirty that I felt like they just gave us a cup of water from the last customer that didn't finish theirs. My bf wiped the inside of my cup with a napkin and was actually able to wipe off some suspicious residue. Needless to say, I didn't drink water for the rest of my meal.  I still gave 2 stars because the food is really good. However, I wouldn't want to eat at a restaurant that I feel is not clean.

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty cups, water was served like this (not filled to the top)

H7R7mQhvSF-466Fke-nk2Q.text: I met up with a dear friend of mine and had seen this spot was close to him.   Craving a comforting meal, and good company, I ventured across town to make this happen.  Very soon after arriving the restaurant became super packed, which I took as a good sign. They had many yummy looking options, but I had been craving  spicy beef noodle soup, and hoped theirs would make me all warm and fuzzy.   I got the knife cut noodles for my soup, and first off let me say the noodles were the best I have ever had. They had just the right amount of chew,  and the meat was tender and plentiful.  The broth however was a bit one note for me,  and underdeveloped in flavor.  I only ate half my soup because without a delicious broth,  I got a bit bored with the soup.   The place smelled amazing,  and I will try to order another dish next time that maybe highlights their exceptional noodles in a better light.

FMV8idWeZfLTXy1gDEOSyg.text: I would give this place about 3 1/4 stars if it was possible.   It's popular, and the interior is small. There was about a 15 minute wait on a weeknight for a table. You sign up on a clipboard hanging near the entrance.   We were offered two seats at the counter directly in view of the kitchen where the noodles are being made. You have a great view of this process which is cool.   They have a very limited beverage selection. No soda fountain and cans of Coke, Sprite, and Fanta Orange only. No diet drinks. Weird and disappointing.   The beef pancakes were very good. Crispy pancake surrounding juicy and tasty beef.   You can choose from a variety of different noodle types including original or knife cut.   I tried the Mongolian beef chow mein. The beef was fairly tender. The noodles were pretty good though not as amazing as I had imagined for a place that makes them in house. The sauce had a very heavy Chinese five spice taste. That was pretty much the flavor of the entire dish, and it was pretty overwhelming. I would've preferred a more complex and nuanced flavor rather than being overwhelmed with the five spice taste.   Service was ok overall though you had to flag someone down if you wanted more water.   Overall this was an ok experience but didn't seem to live up to the hype.

6qJkqsEX_TbFu76bM9Lnsg.text: Just tried their C3 Brisket noodle soup.  It was fantastic.  Noodles had the right amount of chew.  The broth was tasty, and they gave so much brisket.  The restaurant was busy considered it was just opened for a couple of months.  Clean place.   Will come back.

OhWnG5OfAtFKdN6DUThMTA.text: Good atmosphere to begin with. Got the chicken chowmein which was how i wanted on a chowmein.. very tasty and not dry. Order was somewhat good for two. The sweet and sour cucumber was good too . Also ordered chong qing style spicy noodle, very unique taste , something to try.. but the best of all is the noodle.. so fresh!

R5kC-5LaR6099WC2GUzeIQ.text: Why does Yelp only let me give 5 stars? This place should get ALL THE STARS! We are new to be world of hand pulled noodles, and they're amazing. This place uses great ingredients, everything is fresh, amazing flavors. And the fresh made noodles are leaps and bounds better than dried and reconstituted noodles. The noodles add flavor & texture to the food, they aren't just filler. I had he knife cut noodles with Mongolian beef. My wife had the hand pulled noodles in soup with spicy pork ribs. Both were amazing!

5HJ4lYSca88DkUVfhnq1Mw.text: Noodles were so fresh and good. Kid loved watching them make the noodles. Too bad they didn't have pan fried dumplings. The burrito dumplings were good but not the same. All the noodles were good

HT-5_iHmQFwys3xwu5uy0w.text: Love the spicy dumplings. The sliced pork with Galic sauce are good. Also order fish flat noodle with pickled vegetables and Dan Dan noodle. Yum yum yum. Another favorite noodle place found.

cz5yDQJ4w1wutkVpy-r3EA.text: I lived in China for a few years and have been back in the States looking for a place that had authentic Chinese food. Magic Noodle is a excellent restaurant. The staff is super friendly and helpful.. Please come.

3GXi77xj--LzriRm96eTBQ.text: Found a new must visit restaurant in Vegas.  We were up the street getting a massage and were in the mood for noodles so we found this place and we were in for a treat.  The soup had the perfect amount of spice savory flavors.  I can't wait to come back and explore the menu.

RV2DnhMayAXkxoZVdLrVWw.text: So this place is good, real good. You get to watch the guy make the noodles which is a lot of fun. The food itself is great, the noodles are sooooooo good and the prices are very reasonable. It's a sit down restaurant, but nothing too fancy. Downside, the service was so slow. I went on a Tuesday at 6 pm. All the tables were full and it took 45 minutes to get our food which was a bowl of soup and chow main. The poor table next to us waited for over an hour for their food. It took their server 30 minutes to bring them their hot tea. I needed leftover containers and got sick of waiting, so I went and grabbed them myself along with the check, and left cash at the table all without our server even knowing. Keep in mind the  dining area is small.  Yep, it was that bad. I am going to chalk it up to them being a new restaurant and still working out the kinks. I'll be back in a month or two.

rwwumLd6RO_0bT4kb3W-Mw.text: Tried this place for the first time and boy they do not disappoint. I am a noodle fanatic and this is by far the best Chinese noodle restaurant ever. Their noodles are freshly hand pull, unlike some other places that used store bought noodles. I highly recommend their hand pull noodles or the knife cut, you can definitely taste the difference as it has more texture compare to regular noodles. I can't wait to be back and try other items. Highly recommend if you love noodles like me.

tLOMi620mhxUAO8ZtPH9Yw.text: We were so happy for The Magic Noodle to finally open, as the other noodle house we go to is very far away.  The restaurant is really nice - they've done a fantastic job of decorating, and the kitchen is open so you can see the chef making the hand-pulled noodles and doing all of the food preparation.  We were greeted immediately and given a table and menus.  We do wish the menus had descriptions of the items so that we could better know what they were.  My daughter and I split the Chicken Fried Rice and Chicken Chow Mein.  The Fried Rice was to die for, and the best we have ever had!  The Chow Mein was delicious as well, and the noodles had great texture - we went with the original noodle, but next time may try a different style.  Overall, we were very pleased with our meal, although they do not have Diet Coke which we're hoping they will decide to get in for the future as that would have made our meal perfect.  We will definitely be going back!

_uFBcpc60BjUje-yhF5mnA.text: First time here try the noodles all I can said this is the best noodles in town , this place will be my noodles place in the future.

jX_BehLxN1WAj567I0s9fw.text: Very poor service.  They do understand what you are saying:ordering & or lose your order.  First visit we set down and had to order three times before I got what ordered.  Last night my wife called in an order & when I got there 20 minutes later they had done nothing for our order with only one table of customers in the restaurant.  I just walked out & bought dinner elsewhere.  Never going back.

JIJgtSMakY4cKU4RLsOs8Q.text: This place is amazing, hand pulled noodles made fresh to order.  We started with the spicy dumplings they were delicious, not too spicy and an order is enough for 2 people. I ordered the Mongolian beef chow mein it was not what I expected, it was way better. The beef was tender and flavorful. My friend ordered the beef brisket noodle, the broth was excellent. Large portions, reasonably priced and friendly staff.  I highly recommend this  restaurant

CgBSmaDhWoua0Kpy3fBO1A.text: 25 or so minute wait so be aware. This place gets busy and it's small.  Service was good. Food was pretty good.

rdspfV0hQd_8tEUy9YVUrw.text: I crave their food!  Freshly pulled noodles done right in front of you.  I love their pork belly noodles, their beef brisket noodle soup and their thick noodles with vegetables.  I will say I have not had anything that I was not a fan of!  Not a fancy place and you might have to wait a few minutes for a table, but well worth it!

MSyrOvf3UBi97tSKJat-Xw.text: Cured all of my cravings.  Not an easy task! I called in a order, easy and fast. Highly recommend the spicy wontons and the Szechuan beef soup. Loved every bite. only complaint is that its a little too oily.  Love this place!

OvUz1R1yywe4uhqQ5K59BA.text: Ok so besides the fact that the food is really good, i have a funny story that will never let me forget this place:  The guy told me, "Everything on the table is yours." I paid, grabbed my 3 bags, and left. I got to my car and checked my order...  1 bag: broth  1 bag: noodles/beef  1 bag:   The third bag was the roll of carry out bags! I brought it back in, and we both had a laugh. Luckily, the food is delicious because I'd love to go back and steal his bags again......i meeean dine here again!

yCzNMWPlXg_j9n3XJZPIRw.text: Never in my life have I put anything better in my mouth than the Szechuan Beef Brisket Noodles here.*  The broth is so flavorful and authentically spiced, with lovely chunks of fatty and tender beef. I got the knife cut noodles, which came with a delightful texture.   After my meal, I almost wept out of ecstasy, as well as heartbreak knowing that I'd have to say goodbye to my new love and return to LA within 24 hours. This will be the most intense long distance relationship of my life.   *Stipulation: this was my first meal of the day at 3 pm, which may have had some sway in this review.

v3-19CF_YGoN9E9GOKSIvw.text: Really good hand pulled noodles! My all time favorite is Fish Noodle with pickled vegetables with knife cut noodles. This place becomes my go to place,the staffs are very nice and friendly every time I come here. Totally recommends this place if you are looking for some authentic Chinese hand pulled noodles.

Xmhj3NHD08lPwMO_o9A-iA.text: Service was terrible. Waited almost 20 mins just to get water as I watched everyone else who was seated after me get water. The only reason why I even gave them 2 stars was because the food was okay. The spicy wontons were amazing but my zhajiang noodles were very bland.

iPLx6dFAd4OcKzx2vKU_Vg.text: HANDS DOWN EASILY TOP 3 BEEF NOODLE SOUP!! Now coming from Cali, I've had many bowls of beef noodle and no other places makes me crave their knife cut noodle in the beef soup more than this place!   GET THE BEEF NOODLE SOUP!  Great service, friendly staffs so this place definitely deserves 5 stars!

g5Sb52clR90BeeyhiR3uEQ.text: My favorite Chinese artisan noodle place in town. I love sitting by the window and watch them cook and make their pasta noodle. Such simple food but is properly done with military precision and deliciousness amount of "Q".

DsPx1PxNm3UVeGcL3CeUMw.text: Incredible hand pulled noodles!  This place is amazing and we have been back a couple times already.  The brisket is an endless bowl of meat and noodles.  The chow mien is to die for.   Be warned, this place is very popular and they are in a small space, so expect some wait time if you plan on eating inside.  Best bet... get it to go.  This is our new favorite place in town.

zo6CV3RM3_pq-CZmrsqwWw.text: We all like their noodle. It is a small store. But the food is good. The servers are friendly. We will go again.

2-69hjJ4EnNSoQb2kRsRSw.text: I got the hot and spicy noodles and the noodles were very good and chewy!! I wish it was spicier though, I can just ask if they can make it spicier the next time we go. The service was very quick and the employees are very nice!!

kOFZoe-zscz0oE5dagv1_Q.text: This place is super yummy and affordable. I've been here twice and it was pretty tasty. You can look into the kitchen and see them making the noodles which is actually a lot more complex than you'd think. Everything is pretty clean and the staff in nice. It's really cold in there btw so I'm going to remember to bring a light sweater. Other than that go and enjoy!

p5GyWGZh3Nst8LJwnD5n8w.text: Love this place - just as good as the other pulled noodle joints but staff friendlier and noodle maker more engaging.  All the food has been good - been here 3x still working way through menu.  Sit at the bar and enjoy the show.

PPjH2CWeLlwUjbtvoECZ7A.text: Wanted some noodles on a cold night and visited The Magic Noodle for the first time. The restaurant is pretty small and it gets pretty crowded but we got seated within a few minutes of arriving. We ordered the Szechuan Beef Brisket Noodle, Chicken with Mushroom and Noodle and the Braised Pork Belly with String Beans Stir-fried Noodles. The food was delicious, the broths were great and the thick noodles in the stir fry was delicious. The food is definitely 5-star worthy and it is super cool to see them pulling the noodles through the clear window in the kitchen. The reason I give this place 4-stars is due to the service. The service is pretty slow. The one girl that was waitressing, you could tell she was trying really hard to keep up with everyone. What was annoying was seeing the other younger guy that was working as a waiter moving so slow. He was waiting by the kitchen for the food to be put up or standing at the register while the poor girl was almost jogging between tables. We had to wait awhile before getting our waters and our orders taken. After getting our waters, we noticed one had a bug in it and the male waiter said it's just lemon in the water and we said look at it, it's a bug and then just walked away with the water and brought another one back without saying anything else. Overall though, highly recommend their food, you will definitely not be disappointed!

sYh9Vn29ZNNes2g7fG-frQ.text: This place is incredible. Absolute best noodles in town and they are hand tossed. Flavors are always on point. We order often! Will have to try the soups one day when we can dine in.

k0XmZhWTgUO627tTc2Sv5A.text: Excellent noodle house. Menu not to big, and good variations. A small issue with dirty vinegar and soy sauce dispenser s on tables.

QxfM_NgIMYAm9jO9XF-vnw.text: The handmade noodles are delicious, I especially like their beef noodle soup and they're spicy beef noodle soup. I've tried some of their other dishes but it's really not my thing, their version of the jajiangmyun  is not very good but overall when I go here I go for the beef noodle soup!

MDsomG44yGC1Lb1HcFWapA.text: The noodles are great... So great that the restaurant is packed every time I go there. Sometimes it is so packed that I have had to eat elsewhere because of the long wait for a table... Still, I thoroughly enjoy the noodles and look forward to dining there again.

PvvB0TYsCrWFfHxqk7mOnA.text: I ordered the szechuan beef brisket noodle soup and it was delicious. The soup is spicy (just the way I like it) and the noodles were handpulled. Would definitely return to try other dishes.

XDWeE8vd7FJqsWLuHedsVg.text: DELICIOUS is all I can say! Perfect amount of meat, veggies, FRESH noodles and both! Clean environment, friendly service and great price! I ordered Ching Qing spicy noodle soup and beef pancake! THE best noodle house I've tried in Vegas so far! I'll definitely be returning! Family friendly. Space is limited and worth the wait!

bJRRcw7MunYsACgT3imyWA.text: First time ever coming here with my boyfriend and it was SO GOOOD! Service was so attentive and SWEET!   There isn't any alcohol but we had a long night out before so we didn't mind, two cold coca colas on ice did the job. The best part is you get to watch them from the kitchen hand pulling the noodles.   We started out with the app that was a shanghai style dumpling in a spicy oil and green onions, def recommend!   I got the most popular soup noodle dish that had a delicious broth. The one I got wasn't as spicy but they have the same exact spice paste they use in the kitchen you can use on the counter so I spiced mine up to my liking! SO yummy!   My boyfriend got the chow mein garlic noodles with ham, shrimp and chicken. He loved his as well!   Highly recommend.. I'll definitely be coming back on our next Vegas trip!

o3v26A3XA5vZfzd-0XQVTw.text: Order ahead of time twice through the yelp app, and it was very good. They give you more than what you pay for

lxlH93WYRj3OexTYjjdwFg.text: So not to be an asshole but I held off on publishing this review for a few month solely on the fact that I wanted to keep this spot on the DL as long as possible...   Well looking that the love that's on Yelp now, I guess that the secrets out...   Fresh Hand pulled Taiwanese noodles is one of those cuisines that the Vegas area has been lacking for some time which only in recent years has seen an uptick in the category. Anyhow, this place is a great example of quality dining that bucks the stigma held against the Chinese restaurants.   My default order,  Onion pancakes: some pan fried goodness.  Spicy wonton(A4) (sometimes 2 orders just for me) this is such a simple dish but their spicy sauce is one of the best that I have ever had. I'm not sure if it's Szechuan or shishito peppers but it give you a cool numbing taste to accompany the kick from spicy sauce when you eat the won tons.  Szechuan brisket noodles (C4) with large noodles. The traditionalists will say that this dish was meant to have thin noodles but I tend to disagree. The thick noodles stay firmer in the soup and help balance the the spice of the dish. I feel that the thin noodles get lost in the sauce. The soup is also very robust and hearty. Prior to eating the magic here, DTF's braised beef version was my favorite but no more!   Beef Brisket Noodle (C3) is usually the default choice for the lady. This is your prototypical beef base broth and a calmer non-spicy version of the C4; a solid and simple dish for those who aren't so adventurous.  House Special Chow Mein (E1) General of them at any Chinese restaurant is to typically stay away from anything that is labeled " house special" ; once again this place breaks the mold. The house special chow mein is a great changeup from the broth based noodle dishes. It is here, you can feel and taste what truly fresh noodles are supposed to be like.   This is one of my favorite eats in the west side! At one point I think I was eating here at least once a week until the lady told me that we needed a break from the magic so now we hit it up about every other week.   For those that are Noobs to cuisine this place is very friendly and explaining the process and the dishes so fear not my Gwai Lo friends and followers... Eat with confidence.

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A4. My favorite dumplings in the world; spicy wonton

Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. C7 with thick noodles

UbAOkM0rX7bH37jEynSDXA.text: Environment: An average-sized restaurant, with a hall that leads to restrooms in the back, and the kitchen off to the side with clear panels so that you can see the chefs preparing your food (especially the noodles).   Service: When you first enter, there is a sign-in sheet where you can indicate how many are in your party. However, both times a waiter had quickly greeted my friends and I to inquire himself how many people were in our party, and the wait times were not very long.  Food: I have tried the chicken with mushroom soup, as well as the beef brisket soup, spicy wontons, and house pancake appetizer. First, the house pancake, and spicy wonton appetizers. My boyfriend and I ordered the house pancakes with pork inside, and they were amazing. The filling was similar to that of pork dumplings/gyoza, but what really sold them for me was the outer bread encasing. It was light, crispy, and tasted like pastry dough. A must try! And although I do not mix well with spicy foods, the wontons were not overly spicy, just more on the chili-oil side. They were soft to eat, and the wonton wrapper actually reminded me of the noodles used for Pad Kee Mao.   For both soups, I ordered the original noodles. You can also order knife cut or flat-wide noodles. The original noodles had a good texture to them-- not too thin or too thick, and had a good amount of chewiness. There were a variety of mushrooms in the chicken with mushroom soup, which I really enjoyed. The chicken was not over-seasoned, but still very moist. For the beef brisket soup, the meat was very soft, but made the meal misleading as the brisket came in big chunks, so it seemed like there wasn't enough protein at first glance. However, the broth for both soups was very light, which allowed for the noodles, meats, and other garnishes in the soups to take the spotlight.   Overall: The prices were cheap, the food was really good, and I will definitely be back the next time I am in the Vegas area. Definitely would recommend to friends.
