8VxM4XCn3dwUhV9LDX5uGw.text: Omg I so love this place it is my favorite noodle place and this is the only noodle place I will go. I will bring my friends and family here!!!!

D4QaZ9wzNa7V6bJselIRLQ.text: Beef Noodle Soup with knife cut noodles (Period).   I'm not a usual fan of Beef noodle soup until The Magic Noodle changed my mind... I don't know if it's their "magic" noodles, or the amazingly tender beef, or rich soup broth, but I am a convert.   My mom also likes this place and coming from a Chinese woman who is more critical of restaurant Chinese food, that's saying something. And yes, she also gets the Beef noodle soup.   They have gained popularity since the first time I tried them, and now there is sometimes a wait. So for proper planning, call first to find out the wait time, or be prepared to wait if you are going during lunch or dinner times. Slurp!

j4U8rrH9c2xdMq2kp-EeBA.text: Like many culinary "trends" it took just one local success story to start the proliferation of hand-made Noodle houses in Las Vegas, The Noodle Man's 2015 debut on South Rainbow since giving the Valley Shang, Mian and The Magic Noodle on Fort Apache where five guests sat down to Dinner this past Saturday.  Located in the busy strip-mall across from Wal-Mart near Tropicana, a center also home to Sweet Addiction, Squeeze-In and ACE Donuts, it was just past 6:15pm that the small space was found packed full with persons mostly of Asian ancestry, many satisfied faces visible and conversation kept low as eyes focused on a team of five visible through glass spinning or cutting Noodles, pouring Broth or wok-firing Vegetables.  Pleasantly decorated and family friendly, a trio of servers featuring one man and two women seating guests from a list hung near the door, it is immediately as one party departs that tables are bussed with the next seated, a double-sided laminated menu proving easy to navigate and yielding one Appetizer plus four sizable plates or bowls that all arrived simultaneously just fifteen minutes later.    Dining mostly with novices to this style of Food, a Midwestern upbringing further gifting three with a low tolerance for heat, it was beginning with six segments of crispy Dough flecked by Green Onion that Dinner was underway, each greaseless bite richly flavored and nice for transitioning between various Noodles though the Pancakes are additionally offered with Eggs or Pork that other tables seemed to be enjoying like Tacos.  Moving next to the Restaurant's eponymous item, all four selections served with "Original" hand-pulled Noodles instead of flat or knife-cut versions as a result of guests not realizing the various choices were available until later, it was almost exactly one week after another disappointing Chicken-based Pho that The Magic Noodle's Chicken Soup fared much better, the umami-rich Broth studded with at least three types of Mushrooms leaving behind just a touch of grease on the lips and no two bites the same thanks to a plenty of Meat and Vegetables.  Continuing with Chicken as the protein of choice for Chow Mein, a lot of Bean Sprouts and Cabbage plus reduced Soy adding complexity to springy Starch, it was veering spicy that classic Dan Dan Noodles left lips temporarily numb, a surfeit of Ground Pork and Peanuts welcomed to counter Sichuan Peppers and Chili Oil while Beef Brisket Soup was rich with surprisingly tender Meat but a bit too much Cilantro and a peculiar lingering sweetness.  FOUR STARS:  Offering great value on the Dollar, four adults plus a child all sated for just $57 including tax and tip, it seems as though The Magic Noodle has found its stride less than one year after opening and with good Food plus service better than most of Spring Mountain Road additional visits to try more of the menu will surely follow.

c6h0zo17RFAtByZdKiI0_g.text: Absolutely amazing.taste and value. We sat by the bar and enjoyed the view of the noodles being pulled and made. I highly recommend it!

1oV3Ku0IY_iBdY5RRjQ75g.text: DAMN this place was so freaking good that I want to go back before I leave Vegas. The place isn't that big and it was packed when we got there. Fresh noodles and tasteful broths with so much flavor! We got to try the beef "burritos" and the spicy wontons for appetizers and they came out and was gone as fast as they came to the table. I opted to try the C4 which is the spicy beef noodles and it sure as hell didn't disappoint. I got it with the flat thick noodles but you can choose the original thinner noodles also. The beef pieces were in abundance and tender as hell. Drooling thinking about it. I like spicy food and it had a good kick to it for sure.  There was something wrong with their alarm system and it kept making loud ass noises the whole time but I enjoyed all the food regardless. Highly recommend trying the fresh noodles here!

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef burrito and spicy wonton apps
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. C4 spicy beef noodles. GET THIS!

kq11SWZE5twjqOWxTNKIRA.text: Stopped by The Magic Noodle at the recommendation of a Bougie BFF.   This is as good as it gets...  Magic Noodle Service:  We came in with a party of 12 which included a baby and a 2 year old and our timing was good, we were seated immediately.  We sampled a lot of appetizers and ordered individual dishes as well.  Appetizers came out quickly and our main dishes came our shortly after.  Great work by the staff and kitchen.  Magic Noodle Cuisine:  My main dish was the C4/Szechuan Beef Brisket Noodle and it was very tasty.  The broth was spicy enough to make me sweat but didn't burn the mouth, love it.  The fresh noodles made in house is evident.  The Spicy Won Tons were so spicy and delish, we had to get another set in and I'm definitely ordering on the next visit.  The Onion Pancakes with the braised pork belly is another one I'm ordering again, full of flavor.  I sampled the House, Chicken and Mongolian Beef Chow Mein, all were good-tasting.  Magic Noodle Ambiance: The kitchen ahs glass windows which showcases the chefs tossing the lovely in house noodles.  The kitchen is surrounded by bar seating and the dining area is aligned with wooden tables and seats.  The wall is adorned with Chinese drawings and Hanzi in black and white to make for a very clean look.  Every noodle I sampled with our big party of 12 had the same characteristic, you can taste the freshness and it will bring you back.  The $ pricing for $$$ quality food will also bring you back.  The overall Szechuan cuisine at The Magic Noodle is very tasty and I enjoyed my first visit.  See you at the next one...enjoy! =)

knqq66MqcXKMDeYgktb_Qw.text: My favorite place for noodles in Vegas, I come here a few times a week.   Their dough is fresh and handmade and the texture is chewy and doughy.  My favorite is the szechuan beef noodles. I recommend getting it with the knife cut noodles.  I only wish they put szechuan peppercorn in the soup!  Their dan dan mien is also pretty good if you like the mouth numbing peppercorn flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Szechuan beef noodle soup. Knife cut noodles

tvUGNP7TSQcChbRzrmUBEA.text: I found a new noodle spot only blocks from home. This is my 2nd visit. Both meals were delicious and tasty food was piping hot when served. I had a soup one time and a spicy soup. We are new regulars for sure. Great food and awesome staff. A must try.

6JHngakO-XDjxaZqllq-6A.text: The Magic Noodle is a wonderful establishment with a unique taste. The spice in the noodles and the sauce are absolutely delicious. Personally, I wasn't a fan of the soup noodles, however, the Mongolian beef chow mein knocks the ball out of the park. The spicy wonton appetizer seems to lack taste/seasoning on the dumpling itself, but the sauce that it is placed in is a delight! The burrito is also splendid and is a favorite among my friends and I to share when we come here as a group. I personally can't recommend the Mongolian beef chow mein enough. Get extra noodles and you'll see why it's my favorite thing to order!

wL0frp9RLvk5nLXz_tnEHg.text: I'm Asian, I'm from Hawaii and no matter how hot it is, I can eat saimin (IYKYK) anytime!   I was told by a friend of mine who's a self proclaimed ramen connoisseur to give this place a try.   Like most ramen places that that I've visited here, the establishments are smaller and have limited table seating. There is a bar area for those like me that day eating solo. Walked in, noticed it was quite busy, it was lunch after all. Although I had already looked at their menu and of course, other yelp reviews, I had to look around to see what everyone had ordered.   I opted for the spicy brisket with Szechuan beef brisket with original hand pulled noodle and spicy won ton. I really liked the spicy won ton, the noodles had really good texture and I loved that there was cilantro in there, I just felt like the brisket and broth was not as flavorful as other fresh pulled noodle places I've tried.   Everyone has their own flavor palate, while others may like the flavor not the broth here, I felt like it was lacking. To each their own!

5qViehEMC96HxYSpCvRNpQ.text: Authentic Chinese noodle!  We went around 630 on a Thursday night, the place was busy but no line.  They only had two servers working, and one was helping out with a to go order, so the service was a little slow, but I can't blame them the server was working hard and fast running around every where.  The restaurant itself is not very big though, clean and nice decor. There is also a see through mirror to the kitchen and you can watch the chef pulling noodles right in front of you! So if they pick their nose or spit in your food you would see it right away, and of course that wasn't happening here :)  I love the noodle soup I got (lan zhou beef noodle soup), soup was perfectly seasoned. The noodles were chewy and had great taste!  I also got the spicy wonton as an appetizer, and that was wayyyyy too much food. I was very hungry too before dinner, I still could not finish all the noodles and soup. The portion size is not bad at all. Even if you don't get appetizer you will walk away more than satiated.  Price is decent as well compared to other noodle places, around $8-10 a bowl. Other places charged up to $12-18..

Ohls5LeJWYUaaf1R7cMSqw.text: This place is good. The house special fried rice is good although it is a little oily. The spicy wonton, brisket noodle, beef shank. The food is good, the staff is very attentive and nice. We come to this place every time we are in Vegas.

xj6paFI-W4Ru6_aWVYz_MA.text: My mom and I went there for lunch & the place was busy but with a short wait. I enjoyed the food & I loved the friendly atmosphere and decor.

9rsIXFcQOyWcDTqP_wiPlw.text: I'm visiting from out of town and was really craving noodles and found this place here on yelp! I came here with two friend for lunch and we ordered the chicken appetizer, and three noodles: Dan Dan noodles, the fish noodle soup and the sechuan beef noodle soup. All were super great. The chicken appetizer sauce had great flavor and the chicken was tender. My favorite of the noodles was the Dan dan, definitely get that. The other two were tasty, the beef was a touch salty and the fish was a little bland. The noodles were an amazing texture though! Awesome to see them pulling it in the back through the glass.  The is a small place so we did have to wait a little. I got a little annoyed because a table was done and it took them a long time to clean it before we were able to sit. After that though we had good service!   This place is super good and I highly recommend!!

T-52H0Gff2QztaYvQzZj8A.text: Best Noodle Soup I've ever had. Tried the fish noodles and perfect amount of spice and savor. The fish recipe was amazing. We also ordered the vegetable chow mein and vegetable fried rice which was delicious as well. Definitely recommend this spot. The server Annie was so sweet , even the server assistant was a great help. We met the owner who created the recipes, supercool and down to earth people. Environment is awesome. Definitely a must if you're looking for good soup / ramen.

7usLrhjA8lQrxpZp5LfobQ.text: Love this place I come once a week. There soup the noodles the pancakes mmmmmmm they all hit the spot.

sXY0bcIPEN-cw39ND7nISg.text: Authentic Chinese food and very affordable. The spicy dumplings are a must and this was the best chow mein I've ever had.  Very friendly staff as well.

bXBEMXpU83nxdVDd-UjnsA.text: Food was so good I unfortunately didn't get a chance to take any photos. We ordered the chicken fried rice which was so good, it was cooked well with flavor!! We also ordered the beef pancake I believe which had a side sauce I wasn't sure what the sauce was but reminded me of a bit of cinnamon, it was different but something about the tangy yet sweetness to it had me wanting more, beef chow Mein was yummy and a little spicy so the little one couldn't have any as well as the spicy dumplings which were even more spicy. Other than that they did forget about our order and for that they receive 4 stars but the lady did give the little one an apply juice on the house and that was nice of her, they were apologetic and very nice! The place is small but you can view them making the noodles and the food so fresh while you wait which keeps the time running quickly. Good little spot when you are in Vegas spending hundred on meals, I believe we paid about $30 which wasn't bad for all that we had! Can't wait to come back!

Rj4WJZY8hzK0WWlBlkYcSg.text: Loved it. Prices were lower than expected, service was quick. Food was delicious. Like you can tell it's hand made right there just from the taste. Also you can see them making it by hand right there in front of you.

R4Qr5MOR1F1VLWpnFk69sg.text: Amazing meal and great presentation. Ordered beef noodle soup, chicken fried rice, pancakes and Dan Dan noodles. Noodles were all hand pulled. The family was fascinated with the chef that did the noodle pulling. Truly an artful. Most of all, food were super delicious. Would like to have more noodles in the noodle soup next time. Perfect meal.

cor-DZgCDMv10oFLYcUo5Q.text: We Love every single thing we ever ordered here!  Fresh noodles and very yummy dishes/soups!  Even our picky toddler loves their noodles.  We will definitely come back here.  Thanks very much, The Magic Noodle!

BfFI7Udg27GHUjEeyVMAyg.text: Everything I tasted was delicious, went about 7pm will definitely be back. Magical indeed!!

PHU_frDcI1oT8xqCiZwMDA.text: Before we could even get seated we were asked to move seats because some lady didn't like the fact that I'm Black my boyfriend is white and we were there with our extremely well behaved 9 yr old. The restaurant was empty except for us and the table of horrible women and the waitress attempted to sit us right behind them until one of the women said something to her. The waitress who seemed very nice let us know the woman was talking badly about us but instead of saying something to her she asked us to move. I thought about it for a second and let them know we wouldn't be ordering. I'm appalled at the way we were treated and how it was handled. I was very excited to try this place out since we eat out a lot and love some of the other noodle houses in town but we won't be back.

-_UZjc_B9RaAy4MNSq_QYg.text: Loved this spot!!! We ordered the Szechuan spicy noodle soup, and it was awesome! Spicy, but not burn your mouth off, and we couldn't stop eating. Also the beef pancakes were tasty as well. We will be back!!! All they need is a better variety of beverages, and some music in the building. Super happy with this place.

pOrZDFijFrjN9H-7GiTdhQ.text: Finally tried it. Took recommendations on noodle soup and fried from our server. Both were tasty, noodles texture was good. Service was slow at first. Order bottle water!!

BCl9NMgyKLxYRBexWFz_eQ.text: If I could I would had gave it a 4.5. Very good noodle spot. Decent prices. But it's a very small restaurant and had a to wait for a while for a table. We ended up sitting at the bar and got to see them hand pull the noodle and put together our delicious bowls. We also got the chicken chow mien and that was very good too.

EGuRswEXI0-68lIkHSDcaw.text: Yum!!! Noodles are amazingly good. I watched them make the noodles from scratch. Friendly staff!

Vs9lodJevOfH4mwOWLoOdw.text: Happened to notice this restaurant while headed to another restaurant in the same shopping center. Decided to try it and SO glad we did. We tried the Beef Brisket Noodle, Spicy Pork Rib Noodle and Braised Pork Belly and Green Bean Chow Mein. Everything was outstanding. My kids - one the pickiest eater alive - both ate multiple bowls of the chow mein and beef brisket soup. This place is a winner.

9FxL5UOgFrZv3tzrX1kE4Q.text: This place is amazing. Let me start off with the service is spot on even when they are busy and overwhelmed. The food is spot on. I have been here a couple times and the food and service have been the same, amazing. Definitely one of my go to spots.

V5gf5RLw9k03xLFh3s3Ppw.text: We ordered the pork appetizer to start it wasn't cooked completely in the middle. We sat by the kitchen glass watching the knife cut noodles being made was quite a wonderful show and they were very yummy when they came out! Service was also very attentive.

K2OX0UFvBqX9t8B4j7lrVg.text: Amazing service! But The soup I got was very bland and it was supposed to be spicy but wasn't at all. The spicy wantons though were amazing I'd definitely order that again!!

DGjZA4YttRPXWTU3ImKxYA.text: This place is so good! My husband and I both get the house special chow mein. He gets the hand cut noodles and I get the pulled noodles.  Both are really good. The service is good too

mDSrahC4Dd1ZeB7Plwj0fw.text: Went here on two separate occasions.  I love their beef brisket soup with the hand cut noodles.  The noodles are not too thick like other places I've tried.

IdZoImnF0gsrHTBgq3zzPQ.text: Food is very good . The noodle is best . Staff are very nice . I dropped my purse :) he run out and gave me back :) thank you

rbc_gYTATsRxIICGJjoS8Q.text: Let me start by saying that the food is GREAT! Which is what those stars are for. The service however, was absolutely not. My brother and I were greeted and seated upon arrival and the experience just depleted from there. The older lady that was our waitress seemed to be servicing the entire restaurant which I know can be stressful, so I didn't expect much. But she literally paid no attention to us AT ALL.. she walked by our table on several occasions with not even a "how is your food?" or "do you need anything". We asked for napkins and she threw them on the table. Our water glasses sat empty and unattended, while we watched her walk by our table and happily refill the glasses of the other guests. Luckily, one of the other younger girls working noticed we were being ignored and attended to us. I honestly feel that we were discriminated against racially, since we were 2 of the very few "non Asian" people dining.  Nonetheless, our experience was very disappointing and we will be getting take-out moving forward.

-RIm75za5lmpky6MtZOBfg.text: Finally tried this hand-pulled noodle house & it's delicious! All dishes were on point! Both hot & cold appetizers were great! Excited to go back for more!!

Bvukn0ito2bDF15pPpADsg.text: Went here seeking recovery food from a long Vegas night of alcohol and junk food.  Walked in and the first thing you notice is the set up.  Large window so you look in the kitchen and watch them make the noodles.  Pretty cool set up.  I ordered the beef brisket soup with flat noodles and the Szechwan spicy Potstickers to go.  When I got home I noticed they gave me the regular noodles instead of the flat ones.  Frustrating when you don't get what you order but oh well.  The broth was really rich, you could taste the real marrow that cooked out of the bones.  The brisket was ok not too tender and chewy.  Noodle were fresh and good. It was ok overall...  The Szechwan Potstickers were delicious, you could taste they hand make these and the Szechwan Sauce is really good. I'm giving them 4 stars based on just this sauce...  Worth a visit....

KhBIxwIotClmmDTMlU4dwQ.text: This place was legit when it come to home made noodles.  They make.them fresh for every meal. The service started out really excellent but then they brought someone else's order out before we got ours.  OK noticed that the order came out in order.  Either was the waiter was good and we got some really good things.  The Wonton with added noodles was tasty but on the bland side.  Good for people in restricted diet.  The Mongolian fried noodles had a slight kick to it.  It didn't taste like Mongolian beef it lacked the green onions but it was still full of flavor.  Beef was tender and noodles aldenti. The garlic chicken was very garlicky for the others not so much for me.  It did have a kick at the end.   The onion cakes were crisp and thin.  It didn't get 5 stars for the price it was 5.99 and oil am use to paying less than 4.00 or even way less.  Beef brisket soup noodles was very tasty I wish it has some spicy to it.   The  Chicken chow mein was on the bland and but it was okay for seniors.  The pork belly with string beans was very favorable and the pork belly melted in your mouth.  Overall it was pretty good.

ae5MEHYUA4IUmlzNedrVuw.text: Probably my favorite Chinese noodle place in town. Their Mongolian beef chow meson is amazing in spruce and flavor. You can tell how fresh their noodles are!

8QU5nPCeXnglGaQpNn6grQ.text: some of the most flavorful noodles we have had. great portion size and texture. as authentic as I could expect. we will be coming back to try other dishes soon. highly recommend this place

UsZ3dEK621Hd-487kQP6-g.text: Atmosphere was nice. Food was prepared quick for a call in order. Food appeared to be cooked with fresh ingredients

jkUDyUbtKEB6awhDKbIITg.text: Best noodles ever. Great freshly made noodles with your choice of the type of noodle you'd like to have. I love the knife cut noodles, and the portions are fantastic!

7x91jYkLFu5-B5sGKMnVnA.text: Excellent noodle shop. it's a small place, but not many seats so get there early. The noodles are very fresh, hand-pulled, and you can get any style you want. The brisket meat was very tender and very tasty. Very authentic flavored Chinese dishes. We will definitely be back.

cqCsOJXsLdHTb1xbGetGKA.text: HOLY FmotherUfCrazyKoo I usually get Thai food... spicy drunken noodle, or pad Thai..  This place is close and opened a few month ago, great reviews so I figured give it a shot.  Called in my order... I wanted the king pow chicken and chicken chow mein. Told the guy to pick me the most ordered or loved appetizer.. he suggested the spicy beef wonton.  Picked up my order, the restaurant was close to full... with happy faces. Bounced back home with my food opened up the wontons. WOWWWWWWWW. I don't eat this type of food very often.... I love these. Good thing my lady doesn't eat red meat or pork...is pork red meat? The spicy beef wontons blew me away. I ate them all in less than 3 minutes. Added the spicy oil stuff after the first one I ate. Straight firrrrre  Now, I move onto the kung pow... don't know how to compare it... cause I don't usually eat this. But it's GREAT. I add the hot oil to bot the Kung pow and chow mein....  All I have to say is try it. DEFINITELY GET THE SPICY BEEF WONTON!

JbnjPTZdLhfNT1019BZUpg.text: Everything I've had here has been really good.  From hand made noodles to their appetizers, i havent been disappointed.  This is one of my favorite spots in LV.

jxWKuPrj4zhyK85ueKp7lg.text: Best place ever !! Sense moving to Vegas this has been my number one noodle shop of choice !! They have the best hand pulled noodles I've ever had !!  And their beef fried rice is literally the best I've ever had !! Even better then my moms ! And that's hard to beat !!!  The workers their are super friendly and happy to explain any of the items on their menu!

W7jKtcnI9oMqigRJdTS1Wg.text: Wow! I loved this place. Thanks to Yelp I discovered this place and I was supper exited to go. The Magic Noodle did not disappoint a single bit. I love the open kitchen and the view of the making on noodles by hand. I had the  Beef Brisket Soup and cannot wait to try the Szechuan one next time. This is the kind of place that is worth the 45min drive and it caters to True foodies. Awesome!

01XNxBBSewKcYAB3Ctsc-w.text: So I enjoyed a new place tonight. It was a Togo order, and am very glad I did that as the place was packed and people waiting to sit down. The place was small, which I liked. I ordered a Szechwan beef noodle soup, spicy pot stickers, and a appetizers that was like a pancake with pistol inside. All three were very good. The only thing I would have to change was the broth was very salty, now I don't mind that, but my doctor says too much salt is not good for the heart! One other thing is the pork inside pancake was a bit greasy. The flavor was awesome though.  So I rated 4 stars as the flavors were amazing. Some don't mind the salt and grease, and normally I do not either, however I have to listen to the doctor! I'll only go once a month. so please, if your near by the Magic Noodle, please do go in for some amazing tastes and flavors!

obrz_1PfjfUEcVLKC9mmbg.text: And i'm definitely not coming back here to eat again. I was disappointed. The broth was plain. There was nothing about my dish that made me dance as I ate. The noodles were good. Wasn't the greatest. I finished my food, only because I was starving. But at the end of it, I felt horrible for eating something I didn't enjoy... and paid for. Our service was fantastic though. He was kind and informative about their menu.

U9ik6Fho2SFnAqys3VhfgQ.text: Amazing good and fresh..... best fried rice as I have had.  Great pancakes!  We had 6 folks and service was great. Did not have to wait long.  Also great spicy dumplings.

ojATAAgMtaida93o9JKxmA.text: Really cute and clean inside. I had the sweet/sour cucumbers , Chinese burrito and chicken fried rice. Everything was delish. Large portions , good value for your money. Service was quick and professional.  Loved watching the noodles being made

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Water served in cute mason jars!

b4cONfiho5pchICzj37z5g.text: Some of the best noodles I've ever had. Been here probably 6-7 times already. LOVE IT.  Grest prices grest food grest atmosphere .

ioxN_XcrjF9nkek4Yf-NxA.text: So good!  Amazing noodles, great value and a kitchen that's really fun to watch as they prepare your meal and stretch the noodles.  I didn't get a chance to try the spicy dumplings or pancakes but that's a go-to the next time I head over there.  The noodles I got (beef brisket) were flavorful, fresh and delicious.  The portions are great and the value is fine too.  My wife had the special chow mein which was also great from what I tried and we both left full and happy.  We'll be back around for sure in the future.

p-zZDWeaX7-OB8X5pDFEcQ.text: I really enjoyed watching the chef's make the noodles and they were the best I ever had for sure magic in the noodles

aIZ4LNytkJ9UR4hnlP1Zrw.text: My wife and I love this place.  We are definitely coming back whenever we are back in Vegas.  We can't stop talking about it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8h0og8gB-MLB_e61ewgvMg.text: Wow and wow. Picked up several dishes for takeout.  The restaurant owner(?) told us the food would not be as good as if we ate it in house. Well, I can't wait to try it in house. The food was amazing. You just can't match the taste of the homemade noodles. And, the house fried rice was amazing, too.

hfCGCMSUVdEPhV9XKLmvMw.text: Ah... just discovered this place. Tried C7 with the wide noodles. Wow! Spicy, delicious and the noodles are amazing. Can't wait to try the other dishes!! Beware though... can be messy

ecCsIC_uXDMC-XEGOMHlEQ.text: Love this place! Pricing is great for the amount of food you get. Reminds me of shang's noodle house on flamingo. Both places has great service and ambiance is perfect for a quick bite.

Kpdj7dT1CBrxQLB8RJR--w.text: Always good and friendly. I enjoy their beef noodle soup and Dan Dan noodles during the colder months. Surprisingly friendly for a Chinese spot

WQxLyK_Hsg8Z42pokH_FOw.text: This is by far the best chines food I have ever had. They hand make the noodles in front of you! Everything is fresh! its a small place and is always crowded but it is so worth it.

DV9UT4id09TlU1LNvC-GXQ.text: We don't live on this side of town and are now bummed that we don't after finding this place! Man what a gem! Best noodles I've ever had. The house special pancakes with pork are out of this world! We will definitely be making a trip out this way when we want noodles!

A2qA_KFEpFcJ4uXsfJzycw.text: I've seen some guy hand making noodles a restaurant on the strip, but I didn't expect to find something similar so far off the strip.  I guess this place is magical.  The handmade noodles have a nice bite to them.  The tomato egg noodle soup wasn't what I quite expected, but the fried egg on it was really good.  Wontons in spicy oil are great as everyone else stated along with their special pancakes.  And those Dan Dan noodles will numb your mouth into that.  This is a great find off the strip.

L0vWrq-ST15NYU4qv82Oaw.text: The Mongolian Beef Chow mien is the bomb!  I ordered the beef noodle soup (spicy) to go ... I think it would have been better eaten at the restaurant.  The price is very reasonable and the noodle pulling is a delight to watch!

sAmm9SjA8XtV-APuUNivvw.text: Came in on Friday afternoon. Very nice decor and atmosphere sit in restaurant. We order something on menu is kind new to us. Pork pancake and fish with sour pickle noodle. It taste different yet very delicious. Next time I will try the knife shave noodle. Will be back soon with next review

J2m-uv3TqvW9wajg5aE_2g.text: It's about time they got a good noodle bar on this side of town! Always fresh hand pulled and knife cut noodles with great texture and flavor! Can't skip the onion pancakes here either, a lot less greasy than other ones in town. Must try!

lit1LZc5OJqYqWUzPgm17g.text: Noodles are really fresh & great texture! Parents and husband love it! Their beef pancake rolls and pot stickers are so good too!

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Everything is really good! Love their hand pulled noodles, really fresh and great texture! We ordered a lot!

si_VdAo1s3YF3WNkAsLC0Q.text: Great place to enjoy noodles made in house. Although this place is super busy, the staff does great to accommodate the demand. I usually order the Mongolian beef dish, wish is delicious. Just be prepared to wait a few minutes during busy hours.

5GDinhpI2sO0pKEuGmCsUg.text: Very good food for very reasonable prices. The noodles are made in house and the service is good. I like the selections of noodles. I had the fat noodle which is perfect for anybody who likes a lot of noodles in their ramen. This place is perfect for sick days and made me feel ready for a nap lol

hjd_Y9HioxgFgUOA8qcwnQ.text: Delicious every time! My favorite hand pulled noodles on the West side. Either in soup broth or wok fried, the noodles are the star. The fried rice is also outstanding!

IDGA-fojUgthtwJb8OhJRw.text: So tasty. had the Chong Qing Style Spicy Noodle w/ the Knife Cut Noodles item C7 on the menu for lunch and it was savory spicy goodness. I buried my face in that bowl of noodles and didn't come up for a breath until I was done. There was a lot going on in that bowl, spicy broth, minced meat, diced peanut, bean, onion, vegetable and of course the knife cut noodle. When my focus wasn't totally on that bowl I watched the kitchen chefs preparing the dishes through a large glass window for the other patrons, entertaining for me. The establishment is clean and the serving staff are great. I haven't had a better bowl of noodles.

NMBjV6bC63kJ2fBhdcgDdQ.text: Food was fresh. Waiters were very attentive and kind. Had excellent vegetable chow mein and vegetable fried rice. Food came out quickly and watching them make the noodles is a pretty cool show.

ZiUSwnX0H6VP4yUMEHmKDw.text: Chinese burrito, sechwan beef and fish noodles are very delicious. Sometimes a little wait but worth it.

5F6FHK5Y7EBjxMGU1Kd9GA.text: This place is my favorite spot especially my daughter..  We probation go here 3 time a week...  Beef brisket noodles.  Chicken noodle.. Beef fried rice...  Beef burrito aSian style...  Spicy wanton...  We tried mostly all if there item and thus place never disappoint..  Definitely recommended..  Amazing stuff as well

-7quP67ag5AzXnspEOW1vw.text: so delicious! the taste of the fresh noodles is unlike anything I've tasted before. came for a hangover fix and it definitely did the job! will definitely come back, even after I haven't been drinking

DEu7ymzoJZ4p-LMab4kzbw.text: Ordered the Mongolian Beef Chow Mein and schezwan beef noodle soup. Talk about great flavor and being both a spicy dish, they provide a great heat that's not overpowering. You can taste the flavors of the dish! Highly recommend. Noodles are amazing and fun watching them make it in house!

Cv4af17HYBCsSC5kUrDpzw.text: Love this place. It's reasonably price & food was yummy. Also gave great portion sizes. It was cool watch them make noodles. They even made my Dan Dan noodles with chicken which was very nice. I don't eat pork. I will be back

-5HibpgqbVUdlD4-XL0Qlg.text: This place is legit! I decided to try the fish noodle which was wonderfully sour with the pickled veggies and spicy even though it doesn't look it. I ordered the knife-cut noodles to go with my soup and it was a great chewy texture, really well-done. I'm hungry just thinking about it. My friend loved her beef noodle soup, she said the broth was super flavorful. I will definitely come back anytime I am in the Vegas area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish noodle

Yb1ATpFdnYCH7acrlR77SQ.text: I love coming here every time I'm in town! Favorite noodle place in Vegas. I ordered the Szechuan beef brisket with knife cut noodles and Lan Zhou bowl with original noodles -- delish! Super chewy and fresh noods    I also really like the spicy beef shank w tenderloin -- great appetizer to start with and the Chinese burrito (gotta get it spicy!) -- super fragrant with cilantro, green onions, shaved spicy beef.

UEpb619jkXPHPB8aJK1qdQ.text: Decided to come here last minute for dinner.  Very low key and so flavorful. We ordered Mongolian beef and spicy wonton. It was was better than I expected and hardly any wait time.

uslRcEmZ4NZFzal_3xOqrw.text: This place is a must! They make their noodles from scratch and there is a great variety of different flavors. We got the Sechwan style wide flat noodles and the brisket soup original. Yummmm!!

vmIJzziV1aAOf71aDBEMSg.text: Recently found this place during my business trip. I haven't had this kind of food since I was in China last time. The knife cut and hand pulled noodle are both awesome and authentic. My favorite is the brisket knife cut noodle soup.

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Szechuan brisket knife cut noodle soup! Awesome!

31GNaqyZVYdrjDYd4q1ybg.text: Man these noodles were magical! I was a first timer for this place and I will definitely keep coming to this restaurant.  When you walk in it looks really small and nothing to crazy and fancy but u get more of a "mom n pop" feel. The one thing that really stood out was the kitchen! It  wasn't all hidden in the back but it was right in the back left side with big windows around so you could see everything that is going on. How they cut the noodles, spin the noodles and just the whole process on how the noodles start and end up on your plate. The one thing that I didn't like was the fact that they bring out one bowl at a time if everyones food isn't reAdy. I might just be use to everyones food coming out at the same so that's just what I like but my friend got her plate first and I'm just sitting there waiting for mine all awkwardly until maybe a good 8 minutes later.  But overall Food and ambiance was great. Will definitely show this place to others.

Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. C4 with wide noodles
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O2b18LZfWI8vhA32wlKWEQ.text: I tried out Magic Noodle because my other fav place was closed.  I tried the brisket noodle - no spice to go and wished I had checked my meal before I left or perhaps tried something different.   The beef was so fatty that I had to pick through most of it and only managed to eat about 4 pieces.  You can look at other's pictures of their bowls and see how fatty their meat is too so I know it wasn't just mine. It was also odd to me that you didn't pick out the broth and it just came with whatever but then again this is a Chinese place and not Japanese Ramen. The service was amazing and quick and the restaurant itself was clean and friendly.  I also liked the open/glass kitchen so we can watch the folks cooking. I probably won't be back because for a place that calls themselves 'Magic Noodle' I didn't actually like the noodles.

bFsufMYw903eBg3npcC7qg.text: Stopped by the Magic Noodle this evening and all I can say is... when can they expand? The place was packed the entire time we were there (and I'm saying this and a good problem to have). We got to sit at the "bar" area and watched the kitchen in action. Was nice to see our noodles being pulled right in front of us! Flavors are spot on and staff is great and kept checking on us. There are many noodle places in Vegas but this one makes their own noodles fresh... shouldn't taken a video but didn't want to mess with the guys rhythm. Go check them out! Great prices as well. These two dishes were $20 total

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket noodle soup
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef chow mein

DuPRb7lkY4V3yw3XZwK8pQ.text: OMG. Can you pleaseeeeeee open a location in Orange county, CA???? This is as authentic as it comes!  So I have bookmarked this place since forever whenever my favorite LV foodie comes here with his yummy posts. The noodles had me at hello and I just hadddddd to come whenever I could.  Arriving there was a wait. It didn't take too long for us to be seated but that could be because it was just my husband and I. If my kids were here... probably a longer wait.  Sitting down everything on the menu sounds delicious. My husband and I had only planner to get an entree each just so we can venture and eat more elsewhere. But glad our eyes were bigger then our stomachs. I ended up ordered two appetizers with our entrees and it was worth not saving any room for anything else LOL  Szechuan Beef Brisket Noodle: OMG that brisket though just melts in your mouth. Every bite was like a bite of happiness taking us back to the good eats in China. It wasn't too spicy for us but I can't say it won't be for someone else since the spice levels for everyone is different.   Chong Qing Style Spicy Noodles: My bowl was packed with flavor. Again the spiciness is different for everyone and for me it was not spicy. But I did love how soft and chewy the noodles were and the broth just had me already. The ground pork was good too but I kind of regretted not getting the brisket since I loved how the beef just melts in your mouth.  House Special Pancakes: These were more like rolled dumplings. Again everything we had here was super packed with flavor. Every bite was a bite in heaven lol. The outside was crispy and the inside was juicy. It says its 3 pieces but they cut it in half and it still looks like a lot.  Spicy Dumplings Szechuan Style: These were probably the spiciest on our table. Each bite again was packed with flavor but get ready to have your mouths numb from the spiciness. Super delicious and still not too hot where we couldn't stand it.   My husband and I love the food here so much.. this is going to be our go to spot when in Vegas. Pleaseeeeeee open up a restaurant in Orange County soon!!! I super wish we had this closer to home!!!! Really good place to have authentic REAL chinese food with freshly made noodles. A must when in Vegas!!!!  Yelp Review 2018 Challenge 80/100

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C_GHGalCdDO1EeIhX-ZuQg.text: I love the Magic Noodle! It is everything I look for in a restaurant - it scores in cleanliness, food quality, and customer service. I came on Christmas Day, and the place was packed. Luckily enough, there was one table open. There were a lot of take-out orders as well, which is a sign of a tried and True popular restaurant.  For appetizers, we ordered the spicy wontons, steamed chicken, and beef. They were all delicious, and one of the best spicy wontons I've had - and trust me, I've had a lot of spicy wontons from all types of establishments! Theirs was garlicky, a welcome change. I also loved B1 and B2, which I consider staples when ordering. B2 packs a lot of flavor, and was not too spicy or oily as its appearance may have you believe.  We got C1 for the main, which can be shared with another if you load up on appetizers. The noodles were perfect... the brisket in the soup noodle was immaculate. It's the same type of meat used in B1. Honestly, I have nothing to complain about. The green onion pancakes were also fresh and crispy, and not oily.  Lastly, the service was splendid and the waitstaff have some amazing communication skills! Our main waiter even told us that we ordered too much, and I appreciated his genuineness. All in all, I recommend and would definitely come back, and it's at the top of my list for take-out.

KmTcgL6YZOSM572vnBKPNQ.text: One of the BEST noodles I've tried. All of my friends got the wide, flat noodles. They're handmade and take a little longer to come out than the thin noodles, but so worth it and we didn't even have to wait that long. The broth was very rich and oil/spice heavy (perfect hangover cure ). We also got the wontons and dumplings and they were so soft and flavorful! I came here last week and I'm still craving it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Szechuan Beef Brisket Noodle
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Szechuan Beef Brisket Noodle &amp; Qing Chong Spicy Noodles

L-4yBOOjsaB38RbaMmQKKA.text: If there's hand pulled noodles around, I will always find it and eat it - FACT.  I have been dying to try this place since it flooded instagram with the most gorgeous noodle lifts that I have ever seen. They also have a window to see them tossing & pulling your noodles. It's quite mesmermizing how one can take a piece of dough, pull, fold and bounce to create strands of noodles. Watching the noodles made in front of me got me salivating for my noodles.  Both hubby and I ordered the spicy beef stew noodles and it was freakin spicy. We can both handle spicy but this was too much. The broth was delicious and flavorful but a bit oily. It could be that we arrived when it first opened so we're getting soup from the top of the pot, where all the oil is. As for the noodles, they were silky, slightly firm, and a little bit chewy. I would definitely be back if I'm ever in Vegas again.   Tip: Go early for lunch. We got there 10 minutes after opening and half the restaurant was full.

cu_MQ8g2XwvACbnn91BgvA.text: I've been a repeat customer to this place and the staff is really nice, however the food portion and quality is very inconsistent. My family and I will always order the house special chow mein which comes with shrimp, veggies, beef, and chicken. We also order the house special pancake which you can choose whether you want beef, pork, or chicken in it. What disappointed me the most was that when this restaurant first opened, consistency was always there and it quickly became one of my favorite places. A few days ago I ordered take-out and in my house special chow mein, all I received was ONE shrimp, ONE beef, and TWO pieces of chicken. There was more veggies than the noodle itself which made me quite disappointed. If this place had kept its consistency it would easily be 4 stars and possibly even a 5, but with all the recent inconsistencies ranging from burnt appetizers to cutting corners on dishes, unless this place gets its act back together, my family and I have no reason to give them our business. Fortunately the house special pancake came out decent this time.   Pros:  +Nice staff +Clean interior   Cons: -inconsistent food quality

Mt75iedX_M_kYx8NRyyGpg.text: Yes! Love this place and their hand pulled noodles! The price is very good too at around $10 a dish.  The Magic Noodle creates their hand pulled noodles in house. You can watch the noodle pull from behind a glass wall which is always fun for kids to watch. The restaurant itself is modern but in a small space. Depending on the time of day, there can be a bit of a wait.  The noodles here are definately delicious since they are freshly made. They make both a traditional noodle and a wide width noodle but I prefer the wide width noodle. The wide width noodles hold the sauce better especially if it is a fried dish. If you are looking for a dish with seafood, I recommend the shrimp fried noodles with wide noodles. I have yet to try the soup noodles but it did look delicious.   Magic Noodle is definitely a noodle house worth trying! Bon Appetit!

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wide hand pulled noodles

4jQhFJiFk0q7_V8dt_HDWQ.text: I go here a lot with my significant other and though the noodles are hit-or-miss (we're trying to try everything on the menu) but the noodles definitely always taste fresh and the utensils appear to be delicately cleaned.  But the appetizers! The appetizers are the star of this restaurant! The appetizers are to die for! They're really good! Sometimes we go and just order the appetizers. Sometimes we just get the same thing over and over again. We especially love the onion pancake with the braised pork. We get it every time and we love it every time. The pancake was so crispy and the pork compliment it so well. I've just never tasted anything like it. They should just call the restaurant: The Magic Onion Pancake with Braised Pork and I would eat at least once a week just to get that.   Service was good. Nothing extraordinary. Nonetheless, our servers always check in on us and made sure our waters never empty out. So I do recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VFR96ijf4n2Qzsu_wFTc2g.text: We really enjoy Szechuan noodles and have tried a few places out. Stumbled across magic noodle and came in for lunch. Glad we did!   Had the spicy wontons for apps and the flavor wasn't just of spicy oil but it had some rich deep notes. The spice was just perfect, not volcano spice but made you sweat a bit.  We tried out two different noodle soups. And they were both delicious!! Rich in flavor with that Szechuan numbness you come to expect from a good Szechuan dish. The spice was right on again. Meat was super tender and juicy. The noodles made fresh where also perfection.  Portions were a good amount and we were able to take some home for a small bite later.   Staff was courteous and attentive and place was busy.  They have an open style kitchen where you can see them hand stretching the noodles.   We will def be back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their popular beef noodle soup and spicy wontons in the back

g0QfUE6rlWW0ecUaSR0ECQ.text: Magic noodle! I've had this placed bookmarked for quite some time but never consider this spot when figuring out what to eat cause 1. We are barely on this side of town and 2. We tend to focus more on eateries in Chinatown and/or Southwest. But anyway, a friend of mine posted pics and I was reminded of how much I wanted to check this place out so of course the husband said we were going after the kid's wrestling match.   Although this is a noodle joint, I highly recommend you start off with their Sweet and sour black fungus salad and spicy wonton - both delicious! Honestly, I enjoyed the black fungus more than the noodles. The flavor and texture was perfect.  The spicy wonton wasn't too spicy, which made it enjoyable.  With that said, I decided to go with the spicy brisket soup. And although the texture of the noodles and beef were perfect, the broth was too spicy for my liking that it was actually hard to enjoy.   Would I come back though?!?  Yea I would. But next time I will definitely go for the non spicy or ask them to lower the spice level on my noodles.

Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. C1 - Spicy brisket soup

XBF2qd78Cjv8ukfDNJ3fZw.text: While visiting Las Vegas, I usually eat at my usual favorites located on the Strip or Fremont St.  But after reading the review of Lori N., The Magic Noodle was on my list to check out.  After arriving in Vegas, we met our Vegas friend for dinner at 8pm.  Located in a mini mall, parking was easy!  Win! Expecting a wait, the restaurant was half full and we were immediately seated.  Win!    The casual restaurant has three booths, several tables for two and fours and a five seat counter.  The kitchen is open and you can see the chef making the hand pulled noodles. Yes, the noodles here are hand pulled, which I love for its unique taste and texture.   After checking out the menu of appetizers, soup, sauce and stir-fried noodles and fried rice, we started with: Green Onion Pancakes - cut into six wedges, they were light, crispy and not greasy.  One of the best I've had.  Spicy Wonton - Six wontons to the order.  Love the thin skins of the wontons. Delicious.  The spicy oil was medium in heat and was a little spicy for one in our group.  We then ordered: Sichuan Sweet & Sour Noodles in original noodles.  Concerned with the spiciness, our waitress said we could order it mild. You toss the Sweet & Sour Noodles with the peanut, green onion, cucumber, sesame and garlic sauce on the bottom of the bowl.  This was good, but was a little spicier than mild.    Shredded Chicken with Garlic Sauce with knife-cut noodles. The shredded chicken and noodles were coated in a garlic sauce with bell peppers and onions.  We loved the chewy texture of the thick knife cut noodles with the garlicky mild sauce.  Decided to finish it off by ordering Beef Brisket Noodles in original noodles, as recommended by the waitress.  The bowl had Chinese greens, green onions and cilantro in a beef broth. But the star was the beef brisket. Wow, it was so tender and flavorful.  One of the best Chinese briskets that I've tried.    It was a great first meal in Vegas. So good that our Vegas friend is coming back.  Delicious hand pulled noodles with friendly/helpful service and water glasses that were always filled, which you'll need with the spiciness of the food in a nice, clean casual atmosphere with reasonable prices.  Win!  Hey, that makes three wins at one stop!  Winner!

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef brisket soup
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shredded chicken with garlic sauce knife cut noodles
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sichuan sweet and sour noodles

HNbtDzTPT0snqZNj7Q569Q.text: I must say, the noodles here quite magical! From the noodles to the broth to their appetizers, it was all a wonderful experience for my taste buds.  So first let's start with the House Special Pancakes. It had a crispy wrapper that enclosed deliciously seasoned and perfectly salty ground beef. It was accompanied by a slightly sweeter version of soy sauce, enhancing the flavors of the beef.   I had the Beef Brisket with the wide noodles and it was AMAZING! The broth was flavorful with the perfect balance of saltiness and richness of the beef. You can also tell that the noodles are freshly made and cooked, as they have a nice bite to them. The cilantro gave the soup a slight fresh and citrus flavor. The beef that accompanied the soup was also very tender and just fell apart in your mouth.  The Mongolian Beef with wide noodles were also delicious! The noodles were also made and prepared fresh, and the sauce was spicy, giving it a good kick to the dish.   Do yourself a favor and try out Magic Noodle! It is an amazing local spot for anyone who loves Chinese style noodles.

XVFs1zuJBO012268Sl3Glw.text: Wow wow wow, this place completely changed the way I look at noodles, it makes other noodle joints I used to like to go to not good anymore for me, it totally raised the bar,

X114Cx0NAERxwqn14OewiQ.text: I have been to magic noodle now on multiple occasions and have also received it by postmates more than I care to admit lately. So far I have truly enjoyed everything I have tried.   My current favorites: Appetizers: Onion pancakes (add the egg) and their spicy dumplings Szechuan style. I am in LOVE with thei Szechuan style dumplings. if you can only get one appetizer, I highly suggest this one. You can tell they are home made and their sauce is just amazing.   Soup Noodles: My favorite is Szechuan Beef Brisket Noodle. I love the spice to it and their beef brisket is delicious. The broth used for this soup noodle is really flavorful. They absolutely nailed it. For more spice, I like to add some of the szechuan dumpling sauce to it for just a little more kick. But this is the soup noodle I recommend the most if you love a bit of spice.  Sauce Noodle: I love their Dan Dan noodles. Decent amount of noodles, minced meat and onion. Love it when I'm looking for lighter sauce.  Stir Fried Noodles: My favorite is their Mongolian Beef Chow Mein. Beef, bell peppers, onion, what could be better? This is one of my favorite dishes I keep coming back to. Another great one is the Braised Pork Belly with String Beans. Pork belly is just absolutely delicious.   Atmosphere: This place definitely fills up during the busy lunch and dinner times. It is definitely worth the wait since their food is just amazing. This is definitely a place I frequent often and will continue to do so. I highly recommend it.

I do have to add that I was originally unhappy that we were seated for 15 minutes without water or service (hence minus one-star)... but once I walked up to the staff and let them know they apologized & went out of their way to treat us very nicely, brought our food quickly, and gave us a free cucumber salad appetizer.

q6PT7gTuezy7L4AdtKzeoQ.text: I truly enjoy Magic Noodle. I've gotten an appetizer every time I was there and the Mongolian Beef. Ucs5Agfdo_Vm9fbAORcAbA.text: The food is amazing. They need a larger location so customers aren't turned away. Looking forward to our next appointment.

EPEdUVfmWWdZ35C0ypk1hw.text: OH. MY. GAWD. Amazing. I was scoping this spot out for a week before we took a trip to Vegas. I was on a mission for good food this trip and boy oh boy, it did not disappoint.   We ordered the cold appetizer: steamed chicken in chili oil, spicy wontons and both my partner and I ordered Szechuan beef brisket noodle soup. Everything was brilliant!!! Each dish had layers of spice and flavor that varied in different ways. It was my Boyfriends first time eating Szechuan/sichuan and was the perfect way to start. He kept saying "My tongue is tingling." lol  By far my favorite dish was the Steamed chicken in Chili oil. I swear I have dreams about it now, or when the next time I can get it. Only down side is that I live in LA :( Its 4 hours away! Please open a location in LA!!!

wMrjmeY8xM9MQZkgQ79QLQ.text: Prior to magic noodle my only experience with hand pulled noodles were little hole in the walls in New York. This spot does not disappoint.   As soon as you enter you are greeted and quickly shown to your table. From the table you are able to peer into the kitchen and see how the noodles are made.   The food was amazing. We started with the scallion pancakes & Braised Pork Belly. Pancakes were brought out quickly and the pork belly were cooked to perfection. Following the appetizers was my Szechuan Beef Brisket Noodle. The only thing that did not meet my expectations were the spice levels (nothing that the complimentary chilli oil couldn't fix)  Overall I loved everything in my meal and will definitely be back to try the rest of the menu

_i3KPJHITdQr2BDdPYzp7g.text: Everything is delicious!  Be prepared to wait unless you come early. The seating is very limited. But the wait is worth it.  You can sit at the bar and watch the guy make the noodles right in front of you.

5rqYPBD46v7AI0ss2YNyeg.text: Didn't read too many reviews commenting on the Fish Soup Noodles at this place so thought I'd add my 2 cents. I really enjoyed it!!! Very light, flavorful and perfectly balance with the pickled vegetables. The noodles are super fresh, al dente and all around delicious. My husband enjoyed the Mongolian Beef stir-fried noodles as well. The chili wontons are very good but I've had better at Yong Kang in the Paris hotel.

8NCmHn9vdDDTz5t4Rvfx_w.text: This place is across the street from where I used to live and I can't believe I never tried it until this past weekend! So we weren't super hungry when we went and a friend wanted to try it so we didn't try any appetizers, but the soup we got was good nonetheless. I love how you can see them making the noodles fresh from the kitchen. It's so cool. One of the guys winked at my friend LOL...he's probably used to get filmed and watched all the time. As for the food, we could have been more diverse in our selection, but we got the beef brisket noodle and Szechuan beef brisket noodle. Both were good but of course the Szechuan beef noodle had a little more of a flavor kick to it. The broth was savory, the beef was tender and the price of everything is soooo cheap/reasonable for what the portion you get. The service is great, however the place is a little small so the wait could vary. We luckily got there before a huge family came in. They seem to be a popular place so I hope they expand. I can't wait to try more items here!

s_rX9Ay5LtZ0k3JqoUEoyw.text: Loveee this place took my boyfriend when he came in to Vegas and he loved it too! We got the chicken noodles and those vegetarian pancakes things were bomb!!! So delicious! Recommended 100% !

cx8akv5uVLwd1fc8kl-33Q.text: I'm gonna have to step away from the crowd for this review and say that I wasn't impressed with the food, service, or the fact that people who were waiting for a seat were breathing down my neck as I was trying to slurp my noodles down.  I guess I was given the unlucky table by the entrance, but it's awkward and annoying when a crowd of people are basically standing all over you and bumping elbows every time you move your arms to use chopsticks or your spoon.    All of the Szechuan offerings were overpowered by whatever oil was added to the soup, and there was no nuance or depth flavor-wise, unlike pho or ramen.  I also initially ordered the wide noodles for my soup, but the server said to go with the original noodles as the wide ones were only good for IG photos.  Huh??    The apps came out after the soups and only after I reminded the servers that we were still waiting for them.  Food and the bill took forever - the restaurant needs to hire more staff during the evenings as other tables were waiting a long time for their meals, there was occasional confusion as to which waiting party was to sit down first, and the carry-out crowd was non-stop and basically took precedence over the patrons seated inside.  We were never checked on once during our meal or offered drinks, refills, etc.  This would all have been tolerable if the food was fantastic, but it was not.    The chow mein was the only redeeming feature of this experience, but even that is not enough to justify a return visit.  And definitely don't sit at the center table by the door, unless you don't mind 10-20 people glaring at you as you eat as they try to subliminally spur you on to finish your meal already.

oFFBhdnrNNa5BVdhb9ZeGg.text: The best chinese hand-pulled noodles I've had in the states. The broth was so flavorful and they didn't skimp on the meat and noodles. Service was fast and the environment was very relaxing. I had the chongqing noodle soup, beef pancake and the wontons. All were superb.

Uu0THLqzE4dDeIbPXHEANw.text: Noodles were good. The noodles were savory and delicious. Would have given a 5 star if the restroom was cleaner, other than that a good experience. Need to try the beef pancakes for sure

5caUlXuugMEXqL-gtqmSDg.text: Came here for the first time on a recent Friday, to pick up some lunch for myself and my friend while she was at work.   Magic Noodle is located in the same plaza as Infused Tea Lounge, Makai, etc, just south of Tropicana on Fort Apache. I had arrived less than 30 minutes after they opened but almost the entire restaurant was full already. Every table was occupied, if not mildly over occupied. The layout of the restaurant is fairly similar to that of Shang's Artisan or Noodle man, with an open kitchen blocked off by a large glass wall showing the noodle being pulled.   I had ordered a dan dan noodle for myself, shredded chicken noodle w/ garlic sauce for her, and a beef brisket noodle for another friend at the office. It took maybe 15-20 minutes to get my order but it was still fairly quick, considering how busy the restaurant was.   The food smelled really good in the car as I was being mildly tortured while driving over to the office my friend is at.   They separate all the sauces and soups since it was ordered as take out. For some reason, the dan dan noodle sauce got all over the place, leaving like less than an inch of sauce left in that huge take out bowl. Fortunately, that was still enough to cover all the noodles, if anything, it was still a bit salty. Sauce had a good amount of numbing spice/oil to it which was pretty decent  The noodles, even after sitting in a take out box for give or take 30 minutes, were still quite al dente and had a good amount of bite to it, which was great. I noticed their strands of noodles are not too uniform throughout. Thickness varied quite a lot in the same order.   Great to have a hand pulled noodle place so close to home. Beats driving to Noodle Man or Shang's Artisan when feeling a bit lazy. Parking is much easier here than Shang's !

Q2SNRKr2pXWUJegIoWvFbg.text: Went here for lunch. Great prices and even better service! Michael was an awesome server!

_UvdvC6LDDzkF_NS4oQFEA.text: I got the lan zhou beef hand pulled noodles. It was really good. The broth was flavorful. The spicy wontons were awesome! It looks really spicy like it would burn your whole face off but it was mild and just right. I hate it when restaurants use face numbing chili oil. I cant taste anything. But it was perfect here. Couple times i looked up and around the restaurant and kitchen, i saw the cooks staring at me with an angry demeanor. Like an bitter old neighbor whos watching you play in your yard to make sure you dont step over on to their grass and the moment you do they unleash hell. But our waitress was really cute so i stopped looking at the cooks and just focused on her (in a non-creepy way)

PZqtszDPpbKUKC_G9faYGg.text: We ordered food to go, so maybe that detracts from the food a bit.  The beef wraps were tasty but small and more expensive than other places.  The beef noodle soup wasn't too impressive.  The broth didn't stand out and the noodles were a little too soft for my liking.  The beef was tender but again could use more flavor.  I'll probably have to give them a try in person before I write them off, but so far I think Noodle Man and Shang Artisan are more impressive.

U0keyTyciMUjW292du1Ofw.text: So good!!  The food is served timely and you just get the feeling it's authentic.  I LOVED the opportunity to pick "hand cut" noodles.  The fact that you can see them make the noodles from scratch is also a kick.  I was there for dinner once and then again for lunch both times the experience was the same. Perfect.  The staff is friendly even when they're busy.  I was checked on frequently and my water glass was never empty.  Important when you like it spicy!  Great place and atmosphere. I see them expanding soon!

dlQZ3aYjmEqNN04fsAPA6A.text: The food is good, but lack of service and attention is ridiculous. We have tried this place twice and both experiences were bad.   First experience we ordered from here on Postmates. We were really excited to try this place because of all the good reviews. Order finally gets to our house and they didnt give us the noodles to our soup and instead of noodles we received rice. We aren't ones to complain and everyone has an off night. No big deal, so we ate the rice and had the broth.   Like mentioned earlier we thought the food was good, so we decided to try the dine in experience in hopes for better luck. We went for a late lunch. We ordered two soups and a fried rice. The rice comes out pretty quick, but they didn't give us plates to make it easier to eat it. About 10 min go by before someone pays attention to us long enough for us to ask for plates. Another 20 minutes later my husband gets his noodle soup. Enough times goes by that he has now finished his soup and me trying to get someone to pay attention to us so I ask where my soup was. They said oh sorry 3 minutes. Which at that point it really only took 3 minutes for them to get me my soup. Which makes me wonder why did it take so long in the first place. We saw many tables come and go in the time we sat there waiting for food. For what we thought would be a pretty quick meal we were there for over an hour and I ended up just getting my soup to go because my husband had to go back to work.   The food was good, but not good enough to deal with the horrible service and lack of attention. Much rather go down the street to Mr. Chopsticks for the same food and better service.

KMcHRcQElKDMNAurVC9rww.text: Scallion pancakes were really good, spicy won tons were amazing, I ordered the Dan Dan noodles, which were really good. Best part was the texture of the noodles...they're chewy and hold sauce really well. Definitely worth the trip across town.

cG0LQdgufzOT-NkyaddGGg.text: Great, flavorful dishes. Quick and attentive staff. Small joint, but very worth waiting for.

I6shI2pNFPIyJRfJ2EXo-g.text: Magic noodle is the best fresh hand pulled noodle in the town, noodle are chewy soup are tasted, portion are good for a person

JCxdOdndfTjP51OSBYObFw.text: Avoid the Szechuan beef- it was so fatty we literally took out over half of the meet. Super bummed the food wasn't better, the hand pulling is cool to watch.

Pl8mVpHkYjp0acXrvvROcQ.text: The homemade noodles from scratch will never fail me.. My boyfriend and I tried this place out for our first time a while ago and this place is still one of my favorite noodle places. Even the appetizers are delicious and the price is not bad either. I would recommend this spot if you want to enjoy some amazing noodle dishes.

ilL8UHAFxmzvw2Jif3BUCw.text: Delicious! Fast and efficient service. Ordered brisket noodle soup, beef burrito, and spicy wonton. Every thing had good flavors and fresh. Servers were very attentive. 5AaNrYmNTCRhgjVTxH8vnA.text: Hands down the best magic food ever this place is deff 5 stars there spices and food comes together for perfection .. house fried rice and Szechuan beef brisket out of control....I went back a second time and had a bad expierence it's unreal every1 is so clean and had on gloves except 1 person who was the wok chef who was doing the wok fried rice ext.. he had on no gloves and rubbed his nose twice and scratched his ear and touched his pants then perceded to grab food and put it in the wok with his booger hands ..also when he walked out from the back he had a mouth full of food and started cooking while chewing food this guy is absolutely disgusting and there's no reason he should be working there !! The place is so good and so nice and this angry looking fresh off the boat guy looks angry while he's cooking as well  and obv is very dirty to act like that while cooking just horrible ! should be Instant loss of job fire that guy ! He's horrible and ruins such a great place with amazing food... the food is deff 5 stars but the gross wok chef needs to be fired he brought the review to 3 stars for being so gross he's a health hazard also he was talking with food in his mouth he really needs to get a job at Walmart where he belongs instead of such a nice restaurant... the manager said he will be replacing our order hopefully that guy is gone next time where there

xEpJSW35mXYtgFhb22LOBQ.text: My first impression was good compared to noodle man. And I came in with no expectations. Second time around, I ordered the same dish C4. Broth was underwhelming.  Tasted watery. So due to inconsistency, I'm giving it 2/5.

zJe0O96jgA_TsZFlGgjkrA.text: Last time I went there got bad service and waitress ignoring me. After 30 days I try give them last chance If still give me same Attitude I will never go there again. For the main course I ordered Mongolian beef Chow main and my husband ordered the brisket noodle soup. None of them had a delicious flavor. Mine was too sweet and no garlic! fMTLPmhnRasHVVXnCF0WjA.text: Food: Noodle is made very well, the texture is nice and soft yet has a hint of chewiness to it.  Soup base is good, it has a lot of flavor. The good part is how clear it is, no cloudiness which means it was cooked repeatedly.  Service: I like the service here. They acknowledge you once you walk in. I usually go off hours so I never catch the rush hours, which works to my benefit. The servers are always coming around to check for empty dishes and to refill our drinks.  Environment: We enjoy looking into the kitchen area, where we see the noodles being made. The sitting area is nice and clean. That tables are not sticky like most Asian restaurants.

c6UZ4SEhiQ_ThwkLjZKxVg.text: Noodles were amazing, rice was amazing, service was okay, who cares the food made up for any shortcomings.

hvJonhNVII4jcPJbmxmf6w.text: First time here with my son, very happy to see other noodle shop opened around my house. Came here around 8pm on the Saturday and it was packed. The wait isn't bad. Food came really quick. Beef Brisket Noodle, Sliced Pork with Garlic Sauce, Beef Tripe w/ Spicy Sauce are all of my favorites. It's just like what we had in Sichuan. Will be here again for sure. Good to have another place for take out.

2UPHcLRlYM8rT5V9V57XhA.text: OMG.. so fresh and tasty noodles. It's so good. Definately back for more when in Las Vegas!

vHXJJZXMJMykVuYzkdbPQA.text: The food was 4 stars.  Why 3 rating?    1) I ordered an appetizer and a main - the main came out 4 minutes after I ordered and the appetizer arrived when I was 1/2 way through my main. I had a feeling I should have ordered the app and just waited.  But I thought I would give the service a try on timing.   2) If you are going to run an open kitchen and seat people along the counter area by the glass to watch -  be ready for all eyes on you.  You are the show.  You are the star.   2a) If you're going have an open kitchen with glass - the glass should be clean.  It was not.  I'm not talking about a little flour from the hand made / tossed noodles being on the glass...I'm talking the glass was hazy and needed attention. 3) The containers on the tables that hold - Chili Oil, Soy Sauce, and Black Vinegar were dirty.  The spoons looked like they've not been changed in a long time and the dried crusty residue around the top of the lids was nasty.  May take a bit of effort but when a customer is finished dining the  spoons should be changed and the lids should be wiped down.  Perhaps keeping the condiments "to serve" would be a better remedy instead of leaving them out on every table.   4) One employee came into the open kitchen. He wasn't wearing gloves.  He reached into his pocket, pulled out his wallet, went inside and brought out a sum of cash.  He began to count and fan it.   He put it back in the wallet and walked behind the rear curtain (you could still see his legs)  4a) Another employee came from behind the curtain and when he did you could see the employee from (4) peeling fresh leafy vegetables with his bare hands.   He never washed his hands from handling dirty money.  5) When I informed my server of the situation he said he wasn't a manager but would tell them.  He went in the back for a minute or two and came back out to me and said "thank you' 6) The employee that needed to wash his hands was still standing doing his work.   I then said to the server - HE NEEDS TO WASH HIS HANDS NOW.  He went back and had the person washed his hands.    They are still a new place.  The food was indeed delicious.  Am I a bit worried about eating my full meal and watching the sanitary habits of the employees?  Yeah....just a bit.  If you have an open restaurant like this you need to be on TOP of sanitation and all employees need to be handling food properly.  I will try it again.  I hope what I noticed the first time doesn't happen again or to anyone else.

mYKf6OatIBkgMi4kYFyuAg.text: Absolutely delicious. We had the Szechwan Beef Brisket noodle bowl, my grandmother with original noodles and I with knife cut noodle. It was made fresh while we waited and got to watch as our noodles were being pulled. The service was great and the waiter was super friendly, helping us to decide what to have as this was our first time. I'm definitely coming here again and recommending to everyone I know.

CYJtVXZkIYEKLNtauOie3Q.text: Freshly made noodle.. The place is small but very busy. Food is pretty good, the servers are pretty friendly.

dJ_PjQiiXr6SwXDS_X1XwA.text: This place is my new favorite noodle restaurant! I have tried the pancakes, spicy wontons, the C7, and the C4. All of which are amazing. The service is also really good.

8inJZ7qhx4bdpiLdirOQfw.text: Great place I have been several times and the service along with the food has been great. They hand make all the noodles. This along with great servers it makes it in my eyes 5/5.

2j_mP5h4kF6lTiM91oOQzw.text: Really great place for some Szechuan flavor. A lot of options of different noodles and an open kitchen so you can see them make it. Prices are also reasonable.

K0Sb8MxNXvo2nC8ywWZOww.text: We get the c3 and add the amazing oil spice they give you with it. Wide noodles and omg the taste is just amazing!!!! I crave it every day!!! Yummmmmaaaaaaayyyyy

8eElgWtNJJHDUssAKIQTxg.text: Literally a one of a kind authentic experience. I was basic and got the mongolian beef. it was spicy but i finished the whole damn thing

88ZEuY9oi70COMK7_Wo3zA.text: We ordered takeout from here and got two orders of the Szechuan Beef Brisket Noodles. The beef was seasoned well and very tender, the you can taste the freshness of the noodles, and the broth was very flavorful and delicious. The staff was also prompt and courteous. Overall, highly recommend this place and we will definitely be back to try more!

2cBqq2ELWdgqUQCwoJlnZA.text: This is a restaurant in a popular strip mall that has pretty much all types of options. My boyfriend ate here before and he recommended we go for dinner. It doesn't seat very many, maybe 25-30 people max? Clean and barely smelled of food until the people next to us got their order. I got the Vegetable Chou Mein and he got the Szechwan Beef Brisket. These are good portions, might even need a take home box. I would wish for hot tea as an option vs just cold drinks, as hot soup and cold drinks don't really go well for digestion. And perhaps a non-spicy egg/spring roll to enjoy since not everyone eats spicy? It seems they do a lot of to-go business too since there's not a lot of seating. We ate well for under $20 w just water to drink.

vyRNzPUjx1ASPysdAXxCXw.text: Came here on a Sunday afternoon, overall it was okay. There was only one waiter servicing all the tables from what I could see. From the moment we sat down at the bar facing the kitchen all I could focus on was the "B" health grade on the wall. The kitchen from what I could see wasn't the cleanest, but despite my nervousness we stayed. Being Vegan, I ordered the vegetable chow mein. Once I received my food I soon realized that the plastic chopsticks make it difficult to eat noodles with because the noodles slide on the chopstick. The waiter didn't check on us at all throughout the interaction and the food was just okay. Tbh I enjoy the chow mein at Panda Express more. Not worth the hype, and the mediocre service.

b3brYHeqHEpQ53Zli-07uQ.text: Food tastes great, but service is horrible. I go there quite often because I love their food but servers never seem to know what they are doing. It's a busy place but they need to train them better. Open kitchen is a good idea but it also lets you see the cooks never changing their gloves and sipping a can of soda during cooking food.

emi6kkN0y5kD-imIb-qOYA.text: Love the spicy wontons (flavor bombs, not really spicy at all), Chinese beef burritos, and the brisket soup with hand pulled thin noodles. DEFINITELY the brisket soup, broth is fantastic! I wanted to love their onion pancakes, and they had the chewy texture we asians love in breads, but it was heavy as increasingly hard and gummy as it cooled. I come back for the soup and the wontons all the time.

O9nCkSoZkNoyeLHktMgQkg.text: The food was amazing but the service was horrible. We went here last night and there was no wait list. When we sat down, nobody took our order, we had to actually wait 20 minutes for someone to come to our table and take our orders. Also, it took them the longest time to give our orders to us. I was looking around and the people who ordered after us received theirs first before us, so we just let it go. My spicy beef noodles came, then waited 15 minutes for the next noodles to come, and waited more minutes for our APPETIZERS to be served. The servers were rude when asked a question, trying to flag them because we needed a drink and a napkin but just disregarded our table and by the time that we were about to pay they started to be nice to our table. That's what annoyed me the most. Moreover, I asked for them to wrap our leftovers to go and when we got home, THEY GAVE US THE WRONG FOOD. I DO NOT KNOW WHOSE IT WAS BUT WE DID NOT ORDER ANY OF THOSE FOOD ON THE LEFTOVER BAG THEY GAVE US. IT LOOKED DISGUSTING WHEN I OPENED IT. I have no clue whatsoever what their deal was but this place has just SHITTY service at all. Your food is fine but the SERVICE IS HORRIBLE. Might want to ask your servers to be a little nicer sometimes.
