23GfWONJV846tCY14STCGQ.text: I was really excited to try this new noodle place, there's so many popping up in town. I was a bit disappointed. I ordered the Lang zhou noodle, the noodles were pretty good, a little on the salty side but good flavor. I started with the veggie pancake, that I enjoyed, that was probably the best part of dinner. I ordered a hot tea and was very disappointing, it's supposed to be hot!  It was barely warm, not enjoyable at all. The service was also not very good, not very friendly, a bit slow and not welcoming at all. The chicken in the chicken chow mein my father ordered were tiny slivers of chicken and were chewy, I don't recommended. It's a small restaurant, which is fine, no alcohol available.  It would also be nice if the menu had a description of what the noodle dishes contained. I had to google the names to figure out what was in them.

ChGEOknVFfJrlj3yx-x8PA.text: Although this place is away from the Strip, I think it is better for us. The price is very affordable and yet the quality is great. If you willing to venture away from the main Vegas Strip, I promise you will not regret the freshly made noodles. The flavor is awesome.

oRRyQx5dL4mMMN7uQqg99w.text: New noodle joint that just opened and they are my fav been here a couple times and haven't had any bad experiences. I love that their kitchen is all glass and you can watch them make the handmade noodles !! Defiantly recommend this place and it's good pricing !!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CpA70KUmDhTzqe6lGrUdCg.text: After reading the reviews for this place we had to check it out and it didn't disappoint. Szechuan Beef noodle soup and the Spicy Dumplings were both killer dishes and I can't recommend them enough. Service was also very attentive and it's cool to be able to see the noodles being made from anywhere you sit.

UU43HQnYO6ghzxsBmmqqAQ.text: Service has improved tremendously.  The food has always been very tasty & an excellent value.  The only problem I have is that when I go in I don't plan on eating a whole order, but it is so good I always clean my plate.

0zDa3bcOdUdF6MXkkgsQGg.text: A reproduction of the noodle king, it's the same setup, the same menu, probably the same owners. Perhaps a second location since the first one was doing so well. I still prefer the original but this one is pretty decent as well. Zha jiang mian and a stir fry noodle were essentially the same as the other place.  I like the knife cut noodles. Give it a try if you haven't had a lot of exposure to chinese noodles.

dLZcdPEtY1OyO3OIKvgxWA.text: This place is amazing.  I am so happy that I had no clue what I wanted to eat.  My son and I just opened the yelp app and looked through the list of things near the area we were in.  He thought the name was amusing and asked if we could try it.   We walked in and were greeted by a smiling face.  He sat us immediately and got some drinks right out to our table.  I cannot even describe how delicious the place smelled.  I had no clue what dish was creating it, but I was hoping that whatever I chose would be it.  While we decided, my son was entrances watching one of the chefs making the noodles that they use in their dishes.   The staff remained attentive through the whole meal even as the restaurant filled.  Every dish we ordered was absolutely scrumptious.   I cannot use the word AMAZING enough for The Magic Noodle. The atmosphere is AMAZING.   The staff is AMAZING.  The food is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING.  And the price is definitely AMAZING for all that they offer.   This is definitely a must visit again and again.  (By the way...  The smell that got me was the Mongolian Beef Chow Mein)

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My son is loving his beef brisket noodle soup
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I walked in and smelled something delicious.  This is it :)

DFUKN458CAmlD3Su9tnSfA.text: Fun place to go n eat noodle dishes. Enjoyed watching our food being made n tasted very good. Staff very friendly n attentive, place very clean.

G_Xjrr3YIxmd-N27VYc6bA.text: This place was hopping during the dinner hour.  Greeted and seated quickly.  We both wanted some noodles with sauce. We decided on chicken w/garlic sauce and Kung pao chicken over noodles.  Two glasses of water came right after our order.  The food came shortly after that.  Nice flavor and ample sauce to coat the noodles.  Good amount of noodles on the plate .  Both dishes were tasty.  Reasonable prices.  Lots of parking available.

VS37h_tVzGkZxMEMvg0r3w.text: Such a delightful find for Sunday brunch. We ordered the wonton soup and spicy Szechuan brisket soup. Both dishes were flavorful and they definitely did not skimp on the meat and noodles! Each portion could have easily been shared by two ... needless to say we had a good lunch.

1DdLCHM3qEAi1-bowZAC6Q.text: Good food. Price is ok.    Wait time os to long.  And i wish their portions were a bit bigger

Y1asTrxVAxvUgAQmzqI_4g.text: Like the name suggests it... this place is magic.  Coming from NY hand pulled noodles used to be a favorite in Chinatown. This is the first super authentic place I found (and if you know of more I'd love to find out too). The food is amazing - not a ton of options to choose from (which really makes it easy) and the noodles are super good. They taste like a little piece of heaven... truly magic. We drive about 30 minutes as often as we can for a meal there :) we will definitely return  PS - as a bonus kids love the noodles too. They get excited when they realize where we are going and always finish their plates. Service is always friendly too

sR0C0GTFbcE-GC3hKBq6gg.text: Okay food at affordable price. There's a bunch of hand pulled noodle restaurants in Vegas and although this isn't a bad choice, I don't think it's the best out there. Decor at this place looks very nice. There are about 8 tables and can probably hold about 30 customers. All the furniture is made of wood and they have a nice piece of art on their wall. I got the Spicy Beef Noodle Soup with knife cut noodles and Beef Pancake. The beef pancake was pretty good but surprisingly greasy, the bad greasy as in when you bite into it, grease shoots out. The soup broth was a great temperature coming out. I liked the soup and usually enjoy spicy, but I felt the spice hid the flavor of the broth. The knife cut noodles were delicious. Best way I can describe it is that there is a lot of substance and texture and does not taste starchy. The noodles are very fresh. I enjoyed the meal the more I ate it. My biggest complaint is that I came to the restaurant with a group of 3 but they brought all of our meals at different times, like between 5-10 minutes apart. I would of liked if we could of all enjoyed our meals together. I heard from friends that they also had the same complaint. Overall, this place is close to my work so I will be back, but I would not go out of my way to try it again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Noodle Soup
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Beef Noodle Soup. I enjoy spicy but felt it took away from the flavor of the broth

FlErMUuelDE-a9-WNhy5oA.text: Went because I saw their Instagram account and it looked super good, but don't believe the hype. Everything has a sweet taste to it, the only good thing was the shrimp fried rice.

FP8IljysfLgociE7ACkagQ.text: I drove over 35 minutes to try this place...and I was not disappointed. I had seen pictures of the awesome noodles of this place on instagram and I knew I had to try them.  The inside of the restaurant is fairly small and they can't really sit many people at the same time. That is why I think it is important to go early in order to be seated promptly. I went with a large group of people at 6:00pm and had no issues getting a table. By the time we left though there were at least 15 people waiting to be seated.   The food here is REALLY good. I ordered the beef brisket soup with wide noodles. The noodles were awesome and the soup was very flavorful. I was impressed with the amount of meat they put on the soup as well. They do not shy away from that!   I also ordered the pork garlic appetizer and I honestly think this was one of the best things! I had never had something like that before and it is on my list to order it again!  Prompt and great service received. Thank you!

WqsFLScG5hXTU9-3QlNl4Q.text: Very good flavors with the classic preparation of noodling making from China. This place is authentic and their dishes exude flavor they even have some options for vegetarian eaters, the service is attentive and on point

phJUROfKuhifTIOfQxYBrA.text: Service: 5 stars hands down!!  Food: Equally amazing!  -House Special Pancake is the best app here IMO!! We got the beef and it amazes me with the taste and texture. Def a must order!! -Spicy wonton wasn't bad but once we ate the pancake, nothing really came close to being as amazing.  -We ordered 3 beef brisket soups, each with different noodles. I loved my knife cut noodles! I don't think I'd deviate from those either. -Mongolian beef noodle had a spicy flavor, rich with sauce. It has a kick and can leave your lips kinda numb but the flavor was worth it, and I don't do spicy.  -Chicken fried rice? Yassssss!  We were really taken back by how chill they were with us. We had my 3 year old niece with us and they even joked around with her. It made my heart happy! They goofed around with us and told some jokes about green onions. LOL. It was great!  Fresh, hand cut noodles are WHATS UP!!!

p4z1D95RXq5fpJai6Bfa0w.text: So glad we came across this place. Delicious noodle place with good service and plenty of parking. So happy that they were open on Xmas eve! Appetizers were yum. Really enjoyed the spicy wonton. Looks simple but the sauce made it pretty amazing. I also recommend the pancake roll, everyone enjoyed that too. I had the spicy brisket noodle soup...totally get the knife cut noodles (wide noodles). Very smooth and slightly al dente and paired perfectly with the broth which was abundant with flavor. Everyone at our table enjoyed what they had ordered.   Nice and clean and was fun to watch the noodles being made behind the glass.

htkp_36mskmfwDiaMtos2Q.text: Yummm! The noddles are delish and they're made fresh everyday. I ordered the Kung Pao. It was sooo good. Definitely going back for more.

fh3wCluNVoTZWO2jAH8N_Q.text: After Earl's hockey practice, he wanted noodles so we yelped and found the Magic Noodle.  We were seated immediately and after some perusing, we settled for 1. Green Onion Pancakes with pork belly - compared to the soup noodle, this one was the winner.   2. Chong Qing Style Spicy Noodle - I liked the pickled vegetable (green beans) in this soup, but it was lacking in flavor.  I also wish they had included on the menu that this has crushed peanuts.  I prefer the spicy noodle at La Mian way more.   3. Spicy Pork Ribs Noodle - this one tasted better than Chong Qing, but still bleh.  Service was great!  Our kind waiter even gave my toddler apple juice when she asked for it.  But..I don't know if I will return because I do like La Mian better.

rTA98cfR-ioTIoB1ahlAKw.text: It was great. Had the spicy Brisket and the spicy dumplings and it was fantastic! The pork in the dumplings were juicy and the spicy oil was amazing. The Brisket was so tender and the broth was next level

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy dumplings
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Brisket C4 on the menu

fCyyrUSn5NWNevcEzqK8sw.text: "Vegas cold-weather season" hit suddenly so the family and I tried this new local shop to warm up. So excited to have a noodle shop similar to Shang but closer to home!  We tried the beef brisket with knife cut noodle and the fish with pickled vegetable and knife cut noodles.  Beef brisket: broth is ginger flavor forward, slightly floral and sweet. Overall good, but could have more depth of that beefy flavor. The knife cut noodles were fabulous, perfectly not-too-thin-not-too-thick. Meat was tasty, as well. Very filling on this cold night.  Fish & Pickled Veg Noodle: This one packs a good spicy kick. Loved, loved the spice level! Especially with the pickled vegetables cutting through the spiced broth. It's only missing some fresh thinly sliced cabbage or other fresh vegetable to add some texture. I noticed with the noodles, some were very thick and others more similar to the size of the noodles in the beef brisket bowl so their cook was inconsistent. Fish was tasty with all the broth flavor, but a little muddy on the finish.  The shop is small and steadily busy, yet tables were rotating at a good pace with no one left waiting too long to find their spot. Service was also good. For beverages, the hot spicy soup would be great washed down with a nice beer, so hopefully they'll add beer and wine to the menu eventually (soft drinks/teas/juices currently.)  Overall, solid dishes - more like 3.5 stars- and will be returning to try more.

CmCDbOusCo3I8nKvinWvCQ.text: Today was my second time at the Magic Noodle. The food here is always good. I had the beef handmade noodle and chili wontons. Super good. The waitresses and waiter are very nice and attentive. 5 stars for their services and 5 stars for Their food.

-yoil8cPng_ix1C3l0kvuA.text: The food was amazing. Just didn't like the wait. They seem to need more space for people to fit because we were lined up signing the waiting list to get to these fresh noodle selections! Will go again! And oh yea, my 13 & 8 yr old loved the food as well

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Majic noodles!

khe4Ia5MkkLSj5ezUft7PQ.text: Went there for dinner on a windy Saturday night.  First impression when walking in, "this place is clean, inviting and well lit.  And I'm really hungry right now".   Took a while to decided what to get but the waitress was very patient and helpful.   One complaint, there are no descriptions of the menu items.   I like to know what I'm ordering.  Usually I do, but I still have not a clue was Dan Dan noodles are.  And tap water had a normal great taste to it.  They might want to make sure that water filter is working.  Oh well,,,  Ended up with the Mongolian beef item.  It was really super tasty.  Noodles were obviously fresh and flavors were great.  Veggies cooked nicely.  Came with peppers, onion and carrot I believe.  Portion is solid.  Cost $8.95.   Not too shabby.  Wife got Szechwan Beef Brisket.  I didn't like it but she did.      Would I go back, yes.  Fresh food, reasonable prices and nice flavor.    I like the window looking into the kitchen and the guy swinging the noodles around all fancy like.

ul3xzOhGQOIjkdpqeh3Png.text: Give this place a try, their hand pulled noodles are worth a taste. The beef brisket, and beef shank soups are delicious. And the open kitchen is action is just a fun thing to see. Need to go back soon

ucxrW_912ToovcXBQ-0NDw.text: There are a few other beef noodle spots in and around Vegas, most notably Shang Artisan and Noodle Man. To be honest, they all sort of taste similar -- what it boils down to is the quality of the noodles and the meat that goes into each bowl. I like the Szechuan brisket noodles, which always clears my sinuses no matter if the weather is hot or cold.

aOBWNALTj0GruHPkBH9P8A.text: Came here for lunch. Service was pretty good. The staff was smiling and I came late joining my bf. She got me water without me asking.   I got the knife cut noodles C7. It was ok. The noodles were nice n chewy. I liked the texture. The flavor was def that numbing spiciness you expect but not super spicy to me.   My bf got the dan dan noodles. I didn't get to try the noodles but I tried the sauce. It was spicy and also numbing. I don't remember dan dan noodles being made that way but it was good. I liked his bowl more.   I think this place is alright for a noodle shop but I feel like it's not as spicy as I would've expected. Not bad though.

lbtQphvbznmjPG1JW7l_aA.text: Disclaimer: i came to eat here after edc so taste buds werent fully activated. Honestly, i was only staring at my wonton soup - but it smelled heavenly though! Tried the #3 some of the meat and it was definitely pretty tasty but it may have been my pilates overacting to the spice and flavor. Minus 2 stars cuz i somehow ate the table bill and the drinks i ordered (apple juice and orange juice were literally in commercial packaged bottles - not fresh) paid a premo for those too

SdHHG3w5P-Cv-JdDTqiiWw.text: A pretty good Chinese noodle place with a couple minor flaws.  We came in at peak dinner time on a Sunday and the place was pretty packed but nobody was on the wait list. They were able to seat us reasonably quick which was nice - but unfortunately the table was pretty sticky and dirty. Unfortunately the water cups were also very dirty (it had like pieces of noodles stuck inside) and had a weird odor to it. The waitress didn't come by to check on us during the meal or refill our waters but I guess this is to be expected from a quicky Chinese food place. A little disappointing considering there were at least 3 servers running this smaller sized restaurant that could be easily covered by 1 person.  Anyways - on to the goods:  Appetizer - B2 - Steamed Chicken w/Chili Sauce (aka "mouthwatering chicken") - excellent - it is a cold chicken dish soaked in awesome chili sauce.  They were very thoughtful in picking the bones out in preparing this dish which I really appreciate! This is usually a really bony dish that's hard to navigate at most places so that was a good surprise. It's pretty oily (supposed to be) but spiced/seasoned with just the right amount of heat.  B3 - Sliced Pork with Garlic Sauce - another cold dish, with some chili oil also - but more on the sweeter side.  The garlic flavor / amount of garlic was kind of weak considering how this dish is supposed to be done but otherwise it was ok. (I actually found myself dipping it into the B2 sauce for more flavor)  Noodle - C7 - Chong Qing Style Spicy Noodle - I got it with the wide noodles (which do take a little bit longer to prepare as advised by the waitress) and it was excellent.  Just the right amount of heat with the slightly crunchy peanuts combined with the ground pork made for a wonderful combination.  Quality of the noodles was excellent and portion size was good value.  I'd order it again.  If I were in the area I'd come back but maybe at a little less busy time in hopes of cleaner tables/cups and better service.

Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. C7 - Chongqing spicy, just the right amount of heat. Great flavor from the ground pork and peanuts

25K9OlulqEdrUVCUHUYENw.text: Found this pace while I was looking  for a bed for my son at mattress firm. As soon as I seen this place i opened up my yelp app to look at the reviews and the next night we came here for dinner. The place is clean. The service is really good and the food is good. After looking at the menu for a while I decided on the Szechuan Beef Brisket Noodle, it was good with nice size pieces of brisket in there with hand pulled Noodles, what i also liked about it was it was nice and spicy. My son always ask to come here now for their vegetable Chow mein . I will be back to try more items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Szechuan Beef Brisket Noodle

2Z8Do9aPO46xxMGHvIi5bA.text: After a long night of partying, noodles were what we were all in agreement of getting! Unfortunately the original place we went to had about a 90 min wait, so we decided to try The Magic Noodle. We only had to wait about 10 min. Our group was seated at the bar, so we were able to watch them make the noodles along with all the dishes coming out of the kitchen.   I decided on the chicken and mushroom soup with knife cut noodles. The waitress recommended I get the original noodles for the soup, but I was craving thick noodles so I went against her suggestion.   We also ordered cucumbers as an appetizer and the wontons. The cucumbers were delicious! Unfortunately, we were brought the dumplings instead of the wontons, and since it came after we got our soups, we weren't going to complain and send it back. The dumplings were more on the sweet side, different than what we were expecting but still good.   One friend ordered the fish soup and due to the pickled mustard greens, it was incredibly sour and vinegary. So beware! Another friend ordered the spicy Szechuan beef noodle soup and the broth wasn't too bad, though a tad on the salty side.   Service was on the slow side.   Prices are great though for the portions!

Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Szechuan beef soup
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish soup

TsAn0PtRsUhhAGZxoCFgxA.text: Super good! The dining area is rather small but it leaves room for quick service.   Being able to watch our noodles being made right in front of us makes it an even better experience. I ordered the hand pulled noodles and my boyfriend had the knife shaved, so we were able to see those made and food comes out very fast. These are some of the freshest noodles I have had and the broth is delicious.   The spicy wonton appetizer is a must-have!

335LwXGzV59xRGvXSZO2zA.text: I never believed in Magic so coming here, I was skeptical. We were recommended to come for lunch since it's pretty cheap but there normally is a long line out the door and the restaurant is small so we called for take out. It took 25 minutes. We ordered: beef brisket noodle soup with flat noodles, house special chow mein with original noodles, beef pancake, spicy wonton and pork belly fried rice. My fave was the beef pancake and the fried rice. The noodle soup was the worst. I wouldn't order that again. Unfortunately, I still don't believe in magic.

f6IbXq_TVHB1s_oB3zOOJQ.text: Landed in Vegas, checked in and dropped off our bags, and took an 40 min Uber straight here and boy it did not disappoint!! Started off with the dumplings and I ordered two bowls for myself (C4 Szechuan Beef Brisket Noodle - flat noodle and the D3 Dan Dan Noodle - thin noodle) and they were both amazing.. and I had enough for left overs. Everyone enjoyed their dishes so much we ordered food for the next day (E1 House Special Chow Mien flat noodle, Dan Dan thin noodle and more spicy wontons!) definitely drop by if you have the chance and watch the chef's hand pull the noodles, and indulge!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Szcheuan Beef Brisket With flat noodle
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dan Dan Noodle with thin noodles

CBpAgmPi0KY4YsspgDWPhg.text: "Vegas has been so cold all WSOP.  90's, low 100's" whines Midwest poker bud.  "We can fix that!  Hot, inferno spicy Szechuan beef noodle and a side of tripe in chili oil" Asian poker bud to nods of agreement.  "Oh come on!  Last time we had spicy Asian, it burned down there for hours!"  It's worth it.  IMPORTANT:  Those unfamiliar with Szechuan cuisine, lots of oil and chili infused oil used.  Can't handle the internal lubrication... you've been warned.  Known for their excellent hand pulled and knife cut noodles served a multitude of ways, don't pass on their spicy, but tasty starters.  The house special pancake, very good.  The same batter for the traditional green onion pancake, pan fried and rolled around seasoned, stir fried shredded pork, beef or chopped veg.  Crisp on the outside, very flavorful juiciness on the inside.   The chilled steamed chicken swimming in a chili oil sauce, delicious simplicity.  Spicy and very oily but you can clearly taste the natural sweetness of the chicken.  The chilled, viscous oil adds to the silky mouth finish.  The beef tripe in the same sauce, equally good.  Noodles are excellent.  Regardless the type, generous portions of thick, very glutinous and toothsome noodles with lots of natural imperfections for the broth or sauce to cling to.    The spicy broths (beef brisket noodles and pork based "chong qing" noodles) loaded with beef stock, fermented notes and lots of fiery but clean chili taste.  A mild Zhajiang noodle with diced pork, julienned carrots and zucchini and fermented soy bean sauce, simple but very flavorful.  The noodle is the star.  Asian service and not exactly cleanest restaurant (sticky table).  All good, this isn't a fancy place.  Another great option for authentic Asian dining.

JkvoF8lZqSDy8wUu0uPl_Q.text: Handmade noodle. Hand cut is the way to go. Def if you can handle kicks get one of their starred noodle soups off the menu. If you go with a few people, get the cucumbers and woodier mushrooms. Get the fried rice. Chow mein was unimpressive but it's cool cause you should be going for the other items anyway. Waiter made lots of jokes and it was a very nice experience!

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House special chow mein
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and mushroom hand cut noodle
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House fried rice

Ufbwt-Li1CxbMfiqLPmopg.text: I've always been fascinated by hand pulled noodles, but have never seen it in done in person.  Something about the way they stretch and spin the dough is just so mesmerizing to me.  On a recent trip to Las Vegas, I was super excited to take my family to The Magic Noodle - a very popular noodle restaurant known for their handmade noodles that you can choose to be either hand pulled or knife cut.  Luckily for my inner germaphobe, they hand pull the noodles behind an enclosed kitchen with glass walls.  The causal eatery was a hit with my family.  We started with the onion pancakes and sweet and sour black fungus salad.  I loved the onion pancakes and while I balked at the fungus, I tried it and it was really good!  It reminded my of seaweed and my parents assured me it is really good for you.  For the noodles, we ordered the beef brisket noodle, dan dan noodle, lan zhou noodle, and the chong qing style spicy noodle.  We enjoyed all the noodle dishes except for the dan dan noodle, which my sister was a little disappointed by the lack of flavor.  In their defense, I think she just likes my dad's version better.  The service was really great!  My parents liked the friendly girl that could speak Chinese and laugh at my dad's bad jokes.  We also thought the menu prices were very reasonable with the bowls of noodles ranging from $7.95 to $9.95.  A great find for authentic Chinese noodles.

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our feast
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A soup noodle
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excited!

pJF3tvMdHhrn-CdKWeIDBg.text: Not impressed. What can I say.  The flavor is average. The portion is big, but we barely touched our dishes.  This is not normal for us.   It's average Chinese food but nothing exceptional.  Call if you are really hungry

Hi6ofR9TuCL5hq9pksr73g.text: It's a drive to get here but worth it. The line is always long so just a heads up! There's not much of sit and wait area outside FYI. They have approx. 10-12 tables and a bar. The food is amazing! Our go to is their hand pulled noodle, beef brisket in spicy szechuan paired with spicy szechuan wonton! and oh their house fried rice is the bomb too! Service is fast, staff our accommodating. Highly recommended!

Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House fried rice!
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy szechuan wonton

oq2QPayqFrQlAj5x72D9Aw.text: Summary:  Hey there. Are you looking for a quick meal? Do you want your quick meal to be better than run of the mill fast food chains? Are you also craving Asian food? Well the Magic Noodle is the perfect place for you! Caution: more addicting than you think. Also, if you don't know what to order, keep reading! It's definitely worth it ;)  Recommendations: Fried rice- I had the veggie fried rice and was thoroughly disappointed when it came out and wasn't dunked in soy sauce like others. I thought it would have NO FLAVOR (my worst nightmare). I couldn't stop eating it. I thought I was obsessed with it. Correction: I was obsessed with it. All their noodles and broths are good.   Overall experience: I'm not big on Chinese noodle dishes, but this place is glorious. I had to volunteer for face painting children and was running short on time. My friends and I decided to stop by here, and we were a little worried that they wouldn't be quick enough. One of my friends ordered the drunken noodle (if I remember correctly) and they said it'd take a longer time to make. I know the noodles here are handmade, so I started to really worry when my friend said it was okay for the noodles to take a while longer. Well we ended up getting it rly soon. Like a few minutes at most later than the rest of us. The service was really good; since we were in a rush my friend was a little hasty but our server did the best she could to fulfill our needs. Kudos to her.

MHTxErVSmD1wZdIZZh2fbQ.text: Super delicious noodles! The texture, the spices, the service... it was all top notch! I would totally go again when I'm in Vegas! Yes a bit far from the strip, but it was a good scenic drive. I want to try more types of noodles next time. Not just the brothy ones!

TWJBOJNGoO-K9WLXDODWhA.text: I've been here a couple of times and I finally remembered to put in a review. The food here is great!   Today I came here with my partner and we shared the spicy dumplings, although they weren't spicy they did have great flavor. I had the Chong Qing soup noodles and my partner had the Dan Dan noodles. My soup had the perfect amount of noodles and damn are the noodles so good here. The soup was labeled as spicy but really I would say it was mild at best.   The Dan Dan noodles were good too. The pickled green beans provided a different but good flavor to the sauce. My partner couldn't finish his noodles and got a to go box. The male waiter came by and made a jab about how he couldn't finish it. HILARIOUS! We both chuckled.   The only reason I docked off a star was because their water tasted off. It had a funky smell and taste. We couldn't even finish our water because how off putting it was. Good thing I had soup broth.

ej1ABslZ9ix6S1zyhdUM8A.text: Amazing!!  My first time in this little plaza, and I was surprised by the wait! We were seated quickly, but the people piled in behind us. I honestly can't remember what I ordered, but the noodle soup was really good. The green onion pancake and pork belly was also very flavorful, a tad bit on the salty side.

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l_n5IZ1Dk10itdV2MGY0CQ.text: After multiple visits, I'm confident that the Magic Noodle is definitely a 5-Star worthy LV noodle spot!  I know, I know...Everyone raves about Shang Artisan, which I also like, as well, and have frequented when I'm on Spring Mountain.  However, the Magic Noodle is so much better, and I go out of my way every time to come here!! One day, when scientific evidence finally proves that carbs are actually even more healthy than fruits and vegetables, you'll find me here every day!  The noodles here are excellent, which is what you come here for, right? I am partial to their wide flat noodles and their knife cut noodles. The noodles are 100% hand made, without the aide of any machines.  If you're fortunate to be there while they're making their knife shaved noodles, be sure to take an up close peek on how they deftly flick shavings of the noodles from the massive mound of dough directly into boiling water.  A noodle artisan can flick hundreds of these within a few minutes!  Don't leave without trying the plain onion pancakes with green onions.  They are perfect! Crispy, without the omnipresent over cooked brown edges, and are amazingly, not at all greasy!  They've managed to perfect these, and should share their best practices with all other Sichuan restaurants.  They are better than I've had anywhere in the Bay Area or in the entire LV Valley!  In fact, I'd come back for these alone.  The spicy wontons are also nice, but have a bit of a predominant hint of white pepper.  If that doesn't bother you, get these too.  Today, I tried the Zhajiang Noodles, and absolutely loved the al dente texture of the knife shaved noodles!  That said, I'd strongly suggest ordering the black bean sauce on the side.  The sauce itself was far from the greatest, and was significantly more watery-thin than I would've preferred, and overwhelmingly overly salty. I ended up only using a couple of teaspoons full.  But ah, those knife shaved noodles!  Service is very nice here, and the restaurant is new and clean (unlike many places in Chinatown).  All good, all the way around!

jyLWspu9Sx6TXEP37KY6SQ.text: Well it's no secret I love a good handmade noodle! Abra-cadabra- Magic noodle did not disappoint.   Their noodles were a bit varied in size/shape. Call them imperfect...or maybe say it's a True sign they are handmade. Regardless, the texture was fresh and delightful.   I found their broth to be superior to other handmade noodle shops. The chicken and mushrooms was outstanding. We also got the brisket. The brisket was far too fatty for my liking but the few meaty pieces were tender and delicious. The broth on this was pho-esque. The dan dan noodles were very spicy. Too spicy to be able to eat an entire bowl. A few bites would suffice.   It's cute inside. We got to watch them make noodles during our visit. Service was acceptable. They don't have any diet soda, only regular.  That's weird.   A definite winner for a steaming bowl of delicious Asian noodles. I'll be back for more magic noodles!

V7fg-Nl727oUzRjUURkNpg.text: This place is amazing great service excellent food!! I couldn't believe how delicious and flavorful the broth was with the noodles.  We had fish noodles with pickled vegetables, spicy pork rib noodles, chicken chow mein for the little guy. The portions were good sized. Each dish had enough for a second meal too. My little one looked at me and said, with noodles hanging out of his mouth, (he's 2 lol) "It's good!"  I have to agree!!  One of the other customers was speaking with one of the very attentive staff, saying how good it was to not have to go to Chinatown to get good noodles anymore.  We will be back to try something else very soon!!

-dv_j8bdupWqdoyJ28zXGQ.text: I want to thank "The Magic Noodle" for their awesome customer service.   The food was amazing and the glass view of the behind the scene on how they make the noodles was a plus - while you wait for your food. But that's not the reason why we love them.   Our son is allergic to peanuts (I think they should add a note to their menu to include this) and we ordered him the Chow Mein with chicken, unknowing that there was a hint of peanut in it. My son felt it, so we asked the waiter and he confirmed it. We quickly gave him an allergy medication and he was okay. The server was so frighten and apologetic about the situation and asked to remake the meal without the peanut sauce - we can see that they were all shaken about the ordeal and so were we. We asked him to make something more simple, that was not the menu and they made it. They even removed the Chow Mein order from our bill and sincerely apologized again. They also explained to me on how they take food allergy seriously and we're glad that they're not just some money hungry restaurant that doesn't care for their customer. Our experience would have been much worst if they were the opposite. So i applaud them for their amazing customer service and good heart. We'll def. return the next time we're in Vegas but we'll probably order something else for our son.

F6Pf_iUVkOkYUSXres5B5Q.text: Let's go straight for the food since we did not expect anything else from a noodle house. Spicy wonton was really and not too spicy. DviIu7ebcvXhB47aneIe-Q.text: So disappointed bc this place was on my list to hit bc I just moved to Vegas a few weeks ago. I was looking fwd to it via the online photos etc.  We went today @3pm only a few tables in there maybe 10 + a few seats at the window where they cook. Took way too long for a bowl of wonton soup (@$8) which was seaweed a few soggy strings of bread or something weird and a few wontons-he said it tasted like a bowl of hot water-no flavor he tried to add Sriracha & spicy oil. Didn't help. The spicy dumplings were ok but the spice dust is too much. You'll have a bad free taste for hours. Blah. Why so stingy about napkins? I need more then 2" ugh.  I spilled all over my shirt so don't wear anything nice just in case! I got chicken chow main- the noodles were ok but again it had a weird lasting taste. Too many onions not enough chicken and it tasted rubbery maybe they used this meat not white chicken breast. I miss Dumpling Inn in San Diego CA. They've got great noodle fresh dishes! Also didn't like seeing the guy in the glass kitchen area putting a bowl of raw chicken next to cooked food. Seemed like a salmonella nightmare waiting to happen. Wiping his hands o seem Dirty towel sitting in the counter. Made ya very nervous! Then we had to witness one of the female staff sitting at the bar area by the kitchen window eating some soup w/meatball or some meat-she was putting it in her mouth then taking her chopsticks and pulling it out of her mouth and putting them in her napkin! Omg what the heck was she doing?! Please have your employees eat somewhere else out of the customer view if they're spitting out food!! Gross. Sorry we won't be going back.

Cucumber and fungus salad - the best! Ordered double portion. Perfectly seasoned with rice vinegar and salt.  Steamed chicken in chili oil - very bland and not much meat. It was mostly chicken skin.

pQ9V57FyEH2eqr2rF7MEAw.text: Excellent Asian noodle dishes made fresh right in front of your eyes! This is a small restaurant located in the Apache shopping plaza. nWFnBbkvl9xJoyKGg5-Y4Q.text: Chinese food on Christmas Eve is a tradition. But we've 86'd all the usual takeout places we used to patronize closer to home, after appearances on KTNV's Dirty Dining in one case, and a change of chef in another, made them no-go. So I went to Yelp and found The Magic Noodle. Despite the name, it didn't occur to me that this wasn't going to be the typical Chinese food place of our past, but oh, well, we go with the flow.   We brought along a bottle of wine, just in case they didn't serve it. Not only do they not, it was tolerated because it was Christmas Eve, but strongly discouraged other times. Good thing we thought to bring a corkscrew. And since I drink exactly two things - coffee and wine - the coffee mugs we were provided (to sort-of hide the contents) were perfectly okay with me.  Service was very friendly, and our waitress was patient with our questions. That was good, since there are virtually no explanations for menu items with Chinese names.  We started with a Szechuan dumpling appetizer, which was very tasty. I ordered Lan Zhou noodle soup, and my husband got the Szechuan beef brisket. But as soon as they were delivered, we switched dishes. He expected the brisket to be sliced, but these were chunks, and covered in fat. The Lan Zhou was sliced.  I thought I could handle the chunks of brisket, but it turned out to be so fatty that there was almost no meat to eat. I filled up a small plate completely with nothing but fat, and in the end there was virtually only soup and noodles. (The noodles were excellent and broth was good). The waitress brought me a small plate of the sliced Lan Zhou beef. I have no idea what kind of cut this is, but it was ice-cold, looked greenish in the center, and tasted weird to me.   The restaurant is clean and modern, the noodle-making show in the open kitchen is fascinating, the prices are reasonable, but to us it just wasn't worth the trip.

Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute dishes!

NIIlz3lKNSNoDvE3WOUeYg.text: Amazing noodles! As a traveler, I would say this is the top 3 noodle restaurants I've visited in the world. The noodles are handmade, and you can see it from the dining area, which is separated by a half wall and glass. The brisket is my favorite.   This is a relatively small restaurant, I would recommend getting there early with large groups.

-IYICTwByMzgM_FjOeoWow.text: First, this place is tiny and being new and we're still in the middle of a colder weather, be prepare to wait during popular dinner time. My friend and I went here for dinner around 6:30 on a Friday. We got lucky and only had to wait for 5 minutes. There's no waiting area though as space is really tight and fully utilized, so we had to awkwardly stand by the entrance door while waiting. Located in the same plaza as thai noodle house and infused tea. Plenty of parking.  We tried their spicy wontons for appetizers and they're really good. The wonton skin was soft, while the filling was firm, giving you a nice texture. I could taste the shrimp and pork in the fillings too, so they didn't have much fillers. The chili sauce had a good flavor and went well with the wontons. It's quite pricey though. $6.50 for only 6 wontons.   For noodle soup, I had their Szechuan beef brisket noodle ($8.95). I chose to have their regular hand-pulled noodle. The noodles were cooked perfectly al-dente. However, the broth was not spicy at all. I was expecting that numbing spiciness that comes from Szechuan dishes, but nope, tasted just like a regular beef broth with some chili oil. The brisket was tender for the most part and they gave a lot of it too. I do like that their broth is not too salty.   Service was ok. Had to ask for water refills a couple times. The place is clean, but you will still smell like a beef soup after. Just like after you have pho lol. I would come back again and try their other soups.

Q0ENxwC4NY-Qh5Q_8gy-bw.text: I want these noodles every day!! Its the perfect chewy texture and they're made fresh.   My friends and I got there right before the lunch rush. It's a small place, but the service is quick so you're in and out fairly quick.  Definitely worth the $20 Uber to get there from Fremont, and a must-go the next time I'm out there!

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dan Dan Noodles Spicy Dumplings and Spicy Wontons

kBMLM31-p2E1xljC1gOf8g.text: First time here and I will be back for sure! My dad and I decided to come here for lunch after I had my tires changed at Walmart (across the street). It was a cold and windy day so this place definitely hit the spot.  House special pancakes (pork): this was sooo good. The dough was thin and had a nice crunch to it. The pork inside was cooked and seasoned perfectly. Highly recommend.   Lan Zhou noodle: my dad got this dish. He's a picky eater and even he admitted that the broth and noodles were tasty. He didn't get it spicy but you do have the option to make it spicy.   Fish noodle with pickled vegetables: if you love pickled veggies, then you'll love this dish. The broth was delicious and had a nice tang to it that wasn't overwhelming from the pickled veggies.   If there was one thing I could recommend, it would be to add more meat into these dishes. I think mine only came with 5 pieces of fish and my dad's came with 3 or 4 slices of beef. I do want to try the other stuff on their menu so I will be back :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish noodle with pickled vegetables
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lan Zhou noodle

N_9CtaePNRlJxNdE9sGIWg.text: I've gotten food here Togo a few times but this was the first time I've dined in, food was just as good as dine in then it was take out, only here you get to see the noodle guys in action pulling noodles in the open kitchen.  I started with the spicy dumplings in Szechwan sauce which was recommended over spicy dumplings, the server said there's more flavor in The Szechwan sauce, highly recommended if you like garlic, lots of garlic .  These little dumplings were tasty but really difficult to eat with chopsticks so you may want to ask for a fork for these little guys.    For my entree I ordered my usual beef brisket Szechwan noodle soup with knife cut noodles.  The broth was so flavorful, meat tender and noodles were fresh!  Yes this soup is spicy so if you're looking for something to clear up your sinuses, this is the cure!    Restaurant is small so probably not great for groups but they do have a few booths and tables that can be put together.    There will more than likely be a wait here, every single time I've been in here the restaurant has pretty much been packed, a little awkward when waiting for a table or take out, no where really to stand without looking over the middle tables and standing over the current diners while waiting to experience what they are.    Portions are pretty big, I usually have leftovers and the leftovers are just as good and always a reminder as to how damn good these noodles are!

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef brisket Szechuan noodle soup with knife cut noodles

ES6S3UE42QB_dzc2QZzqOw.text: Wanted to explore a new Chinese noodle spot and that is closer to the SW side of the valley.. since other sports are starting to get packed on a normal basis and the wait times are getting kinda ridiculous...  Saw this place popped up.. and after viewing some snazzy looking pictures and reading some pretty good and honest reviews.. I decided to finally go...  Walking in.. it really reminded me of another noodle spot (The Noodle Man) on Rainbow and 215.. could be the same owners? Idk... but the decor and how there is a noodle bar and you can see the people making fresh noodles gives it that same feel... always interesting though to see someone tossing and twisting and flipping those noodles..   Service was pretty good given that this place started to get really pack the second we sat down.. it is very limited seating and they really could use more tables and chairs..   Food Review: Ordered the Spicy Brisket with original noodles. The portion weighed more on the broth as most noodles do... but the amount of brisket and noodles was ok.. maybe I'll try go the flat noodle way next time.. as I could've gotten extra noodles with my bowl. I also wished they had more veggies in there too.. the quality of taste is there.. of course being that the noodles are freshly made.. and the broth was very tasty.. could also have more spiciness though.. but you can always add more if you want.   Other than that, I'll definitely go again.. and maybe try a different item.   ENJOY!

3keXvePWlGTVY2X76zqWgQ.text: Ordered the C7 pork peanut noodles ($8.95) and beef "burrito" (about $7).  Everything was pretty good, nothing mind blowing. I like how the dishes were not too salty as sometimes noodle soups can be. The kitchen has a window where you can see workers hand pulling noodles. Service was excellent. Good prices. Clean, bright  place.  Pro tip: ask for the hoisin/plum sauce to go with the beef green onion roll. It usually comes with it inside but in this case it does not. Plaza parking, off strip.

S-SmCnt7QJgx5oXOVc-kUQ.text: Magic is made here!! The tender beef cubes and pulled noodle are just outstanding!  -The soup has a nice subtle fragrance that is not too salty or oily. The noodles chewy, yet soft. I'm not a fan of drinking the broth normally, but I slurped this bowl up!  -The beef roll was also a plus (or A+....hehehe)! The wrap was not oily but still crunchy with every bit. The beef slices were tender and then sauce was perfect! I liked this roll/burrito a lot! Who doesn't like burritos??  -The spicy wontons were okay, just skip it and go to DTF for the best spicy wontons!   The wait wasn't too bad, but it worth the wait!

H8xygpOKuJitD4qdf2XrAA.text: I found The Magic Noodle on Instagram so I started to follow them and then bookmarked it in Yelp.   I had a doctors appt close by so we decided to have lunch here before my doctors appt.  I went with my sister, mom and family friend.  We arrived around 11:30am and it was packed in there already!    We ordered the beef and pork pancakes, beef burrito, cucumber salad, beef noodle soup and a zha zhang mein with extra sauce.    I enjoyed magic noodles beef burrito more than Mr Chopstix bcs MN puts in cucumbers and cilantro and it's quite tasty.  MrC only has green onions and sometimes puts too much oyster sauce.  The beef pancake tasted better than the pork but they were both piping hot and juicy.  The cucumber salad was a little disappointing bcs it smelled like the flavors were all there but when you taste it, the flavors haven't soaked into the cucumbers fully... it feels like it needs to marinate for another hour or so for the flavors to penetrate in.   The beef noodle soup was good but not great.  They used too much white pepper in it.  The meat was super tender and the veggies were fresh.  We actually shared the bowl between the 4 of us.   The server told us that the zha zhang mein sauce could get salty so we should mix in a little at a time.  She was right but I used almost all of it with the knife cut noodles since they were thick and wide and needed the extra sauce to coat everything.  I liked the amount of bean sprouts and cucumbers they had in the bowl.  Usually it's ground pork in the sauce but their sauce calls for pork chucks - different but pretty tasty.    The restaurant was busy all through our meal with ppl waiting for seats and for pick up.  There were 2 servers and they could probably use a little more help during the lunch hour... where's the owners or manager?  There were 3 cooks in the kitchen pumping out order after order.  We decided to order take out and we ordered chicken chow mein since it seemed like a really popular dish.  We also ordered 2 more noodle soups to go.  We weren't able to finish all our appetizers so they packed it up for us.  I like when  restaurants do that, that's called, service!   The chicken chow mein had plenty of chicken which was cool but they again used too much white pepper and a tad too much garlic so I didn't really enjoy it.    When we left the place I was so thirsty and kept drinking all this water... so that means they use msg in their food... my mom said the same thing too... aghhhh not cool!!!    I did enjoy the knife cut noodles and the beef burrito - but I don't think I'll make a special trip down there just for their msg, white pepper laden food.  I didn't even really take any pics for IG either...   My next doctors appt is in 3 months so I think we'll go back to Mr Chopstix for that appt... I gave this place 4 stars due to the servers being nice and helpful even during the lunch chaos.    Oh, they don't have any hot water... my mom always drinks hot water... kinda surprised us when they told us they don't have hot water... all chinese restaurants have hot water... this was a first for us... they should consider getting a tea kettle to have some hot water on hand and they can also serve some tea.  All their beverages are bottled.

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zha zhang mein with extra sauce

BQwUnt4G-GXmPxZKRBW78A.text: Mmm... Yelp did not disappoint with this spot! Delicious beef brisket noodle soup! Tried both the spicy and non spicy and the regular as well as the wide noodles. Everything was delicious.   Only knocking off a star because half the party got their soups earlier than the other half. The appetizer came after we all got our soup too. Beef pancake app was good but I'd say skip if you are already ordering an entree.   Definitely come here if you are a fan of noodles and soup. You won't be sorry.

peD726WwOp7-d7h77_tEzA.text: So, so good! There are windows that allow you to see the person who is pulling the noodles. There's pretty much someone who is pulling handmade noodles the entire time!   My party had to wait a little, but was treated with excellent customer service when at our table. The food was honestly mind blowing! My beef brisket noodle had the best tasting soup and meat. The soup was not too oily or salty, and was perfectly flavorful with each spoonful. The meat was probably my favorite part which is weird because it usually isn't for me- just goes to show how bomb it was. The meat fell apart so easily and I am now left questioning when my next visit to the restaurant will be hahaha   Now to get to the noodles itself. They were so chewy, which I liked. I got the regular noodles, which are thin, but I regret not getting the thick noodles. The waitress had mentioned thin is better, so I was (too easily and regrettably) swayed. I'll try the thick noodles next time.   Everything I had was good! Cucumbers, spicy wonton, beef wraps, and noodles- all things I would recommend

Had the Dan Dan noodles and sampled some of the Szechuan beef brisket noodles along with spicy wonton and the beef burrito. I thought the beef was very tender and flavorful. I did not sample the soup though. The spicy wontons were pretty good.  And the beef burrito was served cold which should be mentioned in the the menu. Not a fan of cold food.

The hand pulled noodles are so perfectly chewy, and their broth for each soup pairs so perfectly to never make them mush. Let me tell you though, taking it home and reheating it is never the same, so inhale it all when you go!  I highly recommend the spicy dumplings, onion pancakes, or the beef burrito to start. The szcheuan beef brisket with hand pulled noodles is the main star of their menu. I did try the thick and wide noodles with, freaking tasty too!

PfmE7lp9wJpE2z3QqeTVMg.text: Located off Trop and FT Apache, this quaint noodle shop is... absolutely worth the squeeze!   Like most legit noodle shops, they make their fresh noodles by hand daily.  I've been here 3 times now, and each time it's been food-tastic!   The Szechuan beef brisket is so tender and flavorful and goes well with the broth and veggies if it's your first time here. Would also recommend the spicy Szechuan dumplings to start, you won't be disappointed.    Magic Noodle is located in a plaza where there are lots of other awesome choices as well so there's a little bit everything for everyone if noodles aren't what you're in the mood for.  But if it is, enjoy and slurp away as loud as you want.

Gwk-O6eeL6UVMC9E7pJgPQ.text: This is by far the best Chinese noodle place in Las Vegas, hands down! I would drive 25 mins just to treat myself once in awhile. That's how good it is! Everything is made scratch in house from the noodles to their house chili sauce. There is a big window you can see the worker making the noodles. You can order original, knife cut, or flat wide noodles to any dish.  I recommend the spicy Szechuan beef brisket (#C4) with flat noodles. The house made chili gives the broth so much bold and rich flavor. It's a joy in every bite! If you can't eat spicy, opt for C3 which is the same without the house chili. I also recommend the beef house special pancake and spicy wonton if you have an appetite. This place will not dissapoint. So grab your friends and take a trip to this place.

mc-6oUYEvmhHP7NlrF3pjQ.text: We arrived and everything was very clean and new. We ordered red braised beef noodle soup, house chow mein, and their gyoza/potstickers. I originally wanted the vegetable chow mein and asked our waiter if that was good and his response was, "if that's what you like." And then I said well you work here.. have you tried the noodles?? Did you like them? What would you recommend? So that's how we ended up choosing the house chow mein.   The beef noodle soup came out and we were eating. It was very salty and not as rich as beef noodle soup is supposed to be.   The chow mein came out and it was good. It was tasty.. But salty also. The house chow mein comes with shrimp, pork, chicken, and beef. The whole works. I wonder if the vegetable one would have came out the exact same except with vegetables and if the waiter only suggested the house one over the vegetable one bc he liked how it came with a lot of meat.. as most guys would enjoy that kind of dish. I on the other hand do love my veggies.   The gyoza/potstickers came out and I really liked them! I liked them so much I ordered another. But at the same time I also wondered if I liked them so much bc I was hungry hahahahah and didn't really eat much of the 2 salty noodle dishes.   The bill came and I was disappointed and surprised at how much the gyoza/potstickers were!... $7.50 for 6 pieces.. the 6 pieces were in actuality only 3 since they cut it in half.  Imagine an egg roll.. cut diagonally. The chow mein was $8.99.   Safe to say at least I tried it.

S4YTh2Hl9JPsW_86t9Ttyw.text: I crave this place at least 3 times a week. It's just that good! I am in love with their brisket noodle soup. Tender juicy brisket with handmade noodles are to die for! I seriously recommend this place.

taA_Q2nlILRzZp_4AKBDoA.text: Overall this place was pretty good, service was quick and to the point. In terms of the food it was pretty good and in big portions. I tried both the Mongolian beef chow mein and the beef brisket noodles (not pictured). I'd definitely recommend the Mongolian beef chow mein but for the beef brisket noodles I would be wary if you prefer a moderately savory/salty broth as this one was pretty salty. Both dishes were served with flat wide noodles which had an extremely nice texture and chew. I wouldn't exactly deem this restaurant as a 5/5 as I felt it lacked any redeeming, special qualities setting it apart from any other noodle restaurant. But I still recommend it to anyone who loves good handmade noodles!

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mongolian beef with their flat wide noodles

qUnokXC7z_0W-BNBXqeo7g.text: Great food at a good price. A little drive away from the strip but found it very parking friendly and ate well.

SLKGQNxwe2dUbQY5V2VwnA.text: Was here on my lunch break and it was super busy. Luckily, I ordered ahead of time. I ordered the spicy wontons and the Lan Zhou noodles. The spicy wonton has the perfect between sweet, salty, and spicy. Super delicious. The portion was just right. The Lan Zhou noodles was really good also. The noodles were perfectly cooked, not too hard, not too soft. The noodles had just enough springiness to it (all noodles are made in house). Would recommend the soup for anyone that wants a soup that is not too overpowering with seasoning or too plain. Definitely does the soul good on a cold night.

k0CQfjYsid7JnYxsMzwfbg.text: I wasn't too impressed with the food here. I frequent noodle shops and asian cuisine establishments, and really wanted to like this place... But I went once and haven't been back. Ill give it another try and follow up my review.

9z6uRxjHw09UjvLVv-dQPg.text: Fantastic noodle spot! Ambiance, service and food were all spot on. We had the Spicy Wontons to start, followed by the Mongolian Chow Mein for myself and the Beef Soup for my wife. We both left very impressed and no doubt will be making the long trek from Henderson as new regulars. My wife spent some time living in Taiwan and claims this as close to the real thing as it gets. We were left unimpressed by another very popular noodle place that gets high marks on Yelp - so if you were too, this may hit the spot.

dYnUSjmaPod1tsiYF11R1w.text: This place is ok, I expected a little more. However, they have this amazing onion pancakes. Their dumplings are pretty good too.

BQ6dmitPDcp3nNTX07EMWA.text: Amazing noodle shop! I wish they had a larger menu; but what they have they do well. Our server was very funny as well; maybe a tad bit inappropriate for my 10 and 13 year olds but very funny:) you don't find many genuine Chinese noodle shops; so happy to find this gem:)

pmjVIjsTzAHRNqi_HXYPQg.text: I started with the veggie pancake and had the knife cut noodle in the schezuan beef brisket soup. Both were very flavorful and I enjoyed both dishes. Servers are really nice too.

TWcqgU0el1wYkRzwae096g.text: Love coming here, the noodles are great and the soup is always piping hot! Recently tried their chow mein too and it's also very good.

The food was delicious, fresh and served to order. We will be back! Laid back atmosphere and modern decorating. Good service and watching the handpulled noodles being made was really cool. Highly recommend!

Tn7XH83DxppeM6WKr78SQw.text: Outstanding noodle house! They make the noodles in front of you and even went out of their way to accommodate my families allergies (wife/onion daughter/peanuts). It can get busy at lunch and there is limited seating. Service is always friendly and prompt.

NPVZoNogh9vdyzbZoiQt_Q.text: Super delicious, super fresh, super friendly   It just has to be good when you walk in and you are the only non-Chinese in the restaurant. B1ATZy3g0lwtDQ1G14Cy0w.text: Good noodle soup place. I had the need brisket soup. The broth is solid, not quite the best I have had (that belongs to a restaurant in Atlanta), but competently prepared and flavorful. The beef also wasn't quite the best I have had (one or two pieces were a bit tough), but no serious complaints. The noodles themselves are the highlight. The service was friendly. And the prices are reasonable--$9 for a solid dinner.

K12HotwbQuJeMIQhrybQEg.text: This is the second time Ive been here since they opened... yes within a week too. People like me needs a restaurant to eat a good quick meal and move on with our day. This is the place to be. The ambiance is nice and casual here. Noodles are hand stretched, I've seen that at Beijing Noodle No 9 at Caesars palace. My brother loves watching stretching noodles from the window. Food is nicely presented, yes, I'm talking about even noodles. Definitely recommended to everyone!

WXd1avy3IFA5cLUo08Hufg.text: This is the fall back place we go when we forgot to pull out dinner. It is so good we could eat it every night. It is a great atmosphere to come in and watch them making the noodles right in front of you. We usually order online and take it home to eat. We really enjoy the flavor of everything. IWR37pNu4X_fK2fJlijxQQ.text: Stopped in for lunch. The food was great!  The service was not. Not enough waters brought to the table, no one checked in on us and we had to flag them down for everything.  I will definitely come back for the Kung Pao noodles with chicken and the onion pancakes. Hopefully the service will be better next time.

NNindLZZHa_QQPJmWGyKjA.text: This place opened recently and its walking distance from my house. That's dangerous because...carbs? I've been here twice but both times I've left very happy.  You walk in the place and see guys hand pulling noodles behind a glass window so I don't think the noodles could be any fresher. The first time I visited I got the beef brisket soup. Tons of meat and flavorful broth. When my waiter checked up on me, he offered more soup and I obliged him. No extra charge. Nice touch!  Earlier this week, I had the house special chow mein. Great sauce, chunks of chicken and pork and a few shrimp in there as well. I might have licked the plate if nobody was around. The guy sitting next to me at the noodle bar (if that's what it's called?) was obviously a regular as the waiter insisted he try something different this time. The guy refused and I couldn't help but chuckle. He got the onion pancake appetizer; I haven't tried them but he seemed to enjoy. I don't remember what entree he ordered but apparently everything at this place is amazing.  Please stay away so I don't need to wait next time I come back.

GwcKBkTZgrV-eEfkLJ3jww.text: They make the noodles fresh and in front of you so you know it's going to be good! The soups are delicious. I picked the seafood one because I don't eat pork and it was delish. The chicken fried rice is a fave of our 7 y.o. and the chow mien is tasty. The only problem was the service. Not enough staff was working the floor and it was busy with no one bussing tables. Don't let that deter you from the food though. It's worth it .

On the stirred noodle, I preferred my vegetables blanched slightly.  Will go back for sure.

le8eQ94vUSc34yle-IRl1Q.text: Absolutely loved this noodle house. It was quick and the noodles are to die for. I hope I'm on this side of town for lunch again soon.

rMimzd20TkVk6qY1D3_d2Q.text: These hand-pulled noodles are the real deal! I came out with my family of very picky food snobs and surprisingly, no complaints! Stunning reviews all around, we each ordered different noodles and each had its own amazing and unique flavor (I ordered the chicken mushroom one). The noodles are hand pulled in front of you and are made to order, but even if you couldn't see it directly in front of you, you can definitely tell from the texture of the noodles, they have the perfect chew! The broth was flavorful and you have the option of adjusting the spice level if necessary (perfect for me!). Amazing food and FANTASTIC service! 10/10 recommend  :)

mv8PuspxnBy-jqbkaYHFpA.text: As a fellow fresh noodle lover... we can definitely appreciate a good hand pull noodle!  Noodle Master Andy isn't afraid to show up his tricks up his sleeves and we can definitely taste the difference!  We tried the Spicy brisket with hand pulled noodles and also the pickled fish with shaved noodles.  Both have good flavors but more importantly great texture in the noodles!  They're also conveniently located by lots of anchors like Walmart and Lowe's so you can easily take a break from errands and grab yourself a bowl of noodles!

Eex_MhKcent7tSpDWWR1qQ.text: This is a fun place where they make your noodles fresh and you can see the action from the sitting area.  The quality is top notch.  I was in the mood for a little spicy, but I'm sure I could have asked for it or added it myself.  Chow Main was yummy!

LiUvjUhwetB5tvopGoyFxg.text: First time experience at a Chinese Noodle restaurant. The decor is modern and through the large glass windows into the kitchen, you can watch them make the noodles. I had the spicy beef noodle soup (can't remember the actual name). It was really tasty and quite spicy but I didn't realize this dish is a ground beef dish which isn't my preference. I will come back and try another soup. It was really inexpensive as well. I left under $10!! Service was very fast as well. I do recommend this place. Give it a try next time you're in the area.

IHpQthVOXDb3NcWDqpmlnw.text: Instead of eating on the strip we took an Uber all the way out here for their hand pulled and shaved noodles.   The place was clean with a limited seating. We took a seat at the bar so I could see into their open kitchen. I especially liked the show that the noodle guy put on, although I might have made him a bit nervous with my staring, but he should be used to it.   Only suggestion I have is to let the waitress know what kind of noodles you want. I made the mistake of ordering by the number with the picture and got the hand pulled noodles even though the picture on the menu was clearly shaved noodles. And the waitress didn't ask even when we informed her it was our first time here. They were hesitant to switch it for me...but the shaved noodle was bomb.

Only downside is that it's a bit of a squeeze with sitting in the restaurant but you can take the food home and it'll still taste good. I like how you can watch them make the noodles and food. Very entertaining. Might have been short staffed when I went and busy too so longer wait times but definitely worth it.

Evv-GOk7cQ-Af-guSI23SQ.text: Noodles are delicious and cheap, service is quick.  A great option for dinner or lunch whenever you want something unfussy.  My favorite is the knife cut noodle - it has the best texture :)

GI8CKi0-8bi9E5DDxt5Eyg.text: This has become our go to!! Best place I've been too in a long time! Tried 6 different bowls of soup and all are great! Atmosphere is awesome! Mix of new and old. Plus you can see the noodles being made fresh. Everything is priced just right. You can eat like a King for 20 dollars

hD9Fak_UX32VhEP3OpxGzw.text: I heard about this place for little while now. So when my friend visiting from Honolulu came into town, I thought that this hand-pulled noodle joint would be a perfect place to have lunch since it's not to far from my house.  We arrived at 12:45 pm on a Thursday.  There were 8 people lining up outside and I thought to myself, this better be worth the wait.  I went inside to put down my name on the wait list and was quite surprised that within 5 minutes my name was called and we were seated. The restaurant is not too big with an open kitchen concept. Through the glass, we watched one of their noodle masters making these "magic" noodles by pulling and swirling the noodles into thin uniform noodles.  They don't mind you going up to their window to have a closer look or to snap a few photos. The cook will even pose for you.  The menu is only one page, front and back, but has quite a few items on it.  Many of their menu items are spicy and are identified with a chili symbol next to them.  We both ordered their staple noodles.  I ordered the beef brisket flat wide noodles and my friend ordered the Lan Zhou noodles (noodle soup with slices of cooked beef). We also shared an order of their pan fried onion pancakes. Everything came out pretty fast.  I really enjoyed my savory bowl of noodle. The broth and beef were very flavourful and the texture of the noodle was perfect.  My friend said he enjoyed his bowl of noodle as well.  The onion pancakes were also quite tasty, crispy on the outside and soft inside. While we were eating, there were non-stop people waiting to be seated. My verdict, this place serves wonderfully fresh and delicious hand-pulled noodles.  I am definitely a fan and yes, it was definitely worth the wait!

P0ysw1lVcDzAkIdEAeYxbA.text: Amazing service and the best hand pull noodles I've had! We ordered the kung pao chicken noodles, beef brisket soup, and chili wontons - highly recommend all three dishes! The prices are reasonable and the staff are super friendly! Can't wait to come back for more!

l8RGwEoP2H_04eBXlxkPHg.text: A Chinese Noodle Restaurant on the Westside--yay!   I went here with a friend of mine and we ordered their Chinese Spicy Dumplings which for my opinion was really good and tasty.  We've ordered their Beef Brisket Noodle and their Lan Zhou Noodle. You can taste the freshness of their noodles and the broth I was expecting it to be more thicker for the Brisket because that's what I'm used to---over all my cravings has been satisfied and it was really good.  You will be able to see through how they make their noodles which is fascinating and entertaining at the same time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Brisket and Lan Zhou Noodle Soup!
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Dumplings

p2ZsHfXpx5zcHMSjdtjojQ.text: Needed something quick before work and this was on the way,  so I decided to drag my coworker and have lunch.  Luckily we missed the lunch rush, so we were greeted and sat quickly with very prompt water service.  We got the treat of seeing the noodle man handmaking the noodles, so definitely worth the wait since the times I've went to Noodle Man, there was no noodle maker!  With the help of our server, Benny, we picked out their house special Beef Brisket Noodle  (next visit will be with the knife cut noodle) and Mongolian Beef Chow Mein.  The broth of the beef brisket noodle had great depth and body to it. Noodles were al dente, with enough bite. And the seasoning all through out was amazing. For someone whose allergies are working on overtime and can still discern the taste of the dish, it makes me wonder how others can say their food is bland...   The Mongolian Beef Chow Mein had great spice and heat. Definitely made my nose run, but not horribly. Fifteen minutes in I'm surprised my allergies weren't kicking in to overdrive. With all the soy sauce that they use, most Asian restaurants I go to my sinuses are already going full force, but not here.   The highlight of the meal was when I kiddingly asked our waiter, "As you can see, my friend is white, are you sure he can handle the spice levels?" Without missing a beat, he said it's not the spicy but throughout the meal, he was very nice to ask to make sure it really wasn't spicy haha. Sorry Larry, love you friend!  Definitely coming back to try their other dishes. Move over Noodle Man.  Too bad they don't have a dessert menu :-3

h8w8N3WXKTcigewN9B3HTg.text: This is the best chinese place that we've been to. They make the new noodles fresh right before your eyes! They are always packed, you can tell they have loyal patrons that don't get tried of their food! Just like us.

WV2_6fpRriBkhIARO5jryQ.text: Their noodles is aiiiight. Had the dan dan. But their beef pancake is off the hook. Crispy and juicy. I like it.

g5-pSekZ7pu6xsqpscJkeQ.text: 100% Satisfied. Lived up to the hype. Noodles were so fresh. I loved that they had slightly different widths since they were hand-cut. Gives them all slightly different textures. Will definitely go out of my way to come here again while visiting Las Vegas.

mv3-y4lAbS6lRclNVb_Dzg.text: This restaurant definitely competes with the ones in SoCal (specifically the Diamond Bar/Rowland Heights area). Here's a breakdown:  Spicy Szechuan Dumplings: super flavorful and spicy! Warning: they are very addictive despite the small appetizer portion.  Lan Zhou Noodles: my favorite dish here! It's like a Chinese take on Vietnamese pho. The broth has hints of star anise and bits of nostalgia.  Beef Brisket Noodle: tasty and flavorful, a good break from all the spicy food we order. Never disappoints.  Dan Dan Noodle: love how there was a lot of cucumber and bean sprouts to counteract with the spice.  Mongolian Beef Chow Mein: I was never a fan of chow mein because it's super oily, but the noodles were extra chewy and they weren't drenched in oil. Plus!  TLDR; Anything will be good here, but this place gets packed during the weekends! Plan accordingly!

CXGOuU4c1h5MC4FqyXPKzA.text: This place is a little smaller but it's great. The staff is super friendly and hard working. I really enjoyed all the food we ordered. We see ourselves inviting friends here on our return trip. You but try the Sichuan Beef Brisket! It is a bit spicy but the meat is so tender.

k4u3tsWimphycksAfIrFyA.text: BEST NOODLE SHOP IN TOWN!!  The chefs prepare all the food behind glass panels, so the guests can see the process of how their meal is made and all of the noodles are made in house. The ingredients for the dishes from fried rice to ramen are fresh, zesty and filling. My favorites are the chicken and mushroom soup and the chicken chow mein. On top of that, the prices are soooo cheap! It's around the price of a Panda Express meal, but far less processed and doesn't leave you with that gross, greasy feeling. Every time I come here the service is always excellent and the food of consistent quality. A must try!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x-L5dLoOvdovhgxUBmtoAQ.text: So finally got around to checking out The Magic Noodle. I was in carb recovery kind of mood post long bike day. I had noodles on my mind and thought of the perfect spot that been on my radar. So first impression was really like the interior with the original artwork one of the walls, the open kitchen look always favorite, and ample seating from counter area to tables. Truthfully it set up like lot of Ramen or Noodle shops around the valley or the ones I have been to. The menu is nothing crazy only two pages but has most of your favorites soup base noodles, sauce noodles, stir-fried and fried rice plus appetizers. The key or trending is the noodles  fresh made or really not keeping up with the times. Lol. It was lot of decisions only because it was my first time. I ended up settling for the Mongolian Beef Chow Mein and since first time had get appetizer went with the Onion Pancake.   The Onion Pancake asked my server if should go with the add egg. He told me is very popular but wanted try the pancake without no distractions. It was pretty awesome. The texture is little bit like pancake. It not as fluffy or looks like pancake. I more like pita bread kind of. It filling like bread, see the onions, not over powering but definitely can taste the green onion, and nice starter or like getting basket of bread. Maybe if add the egg game changer?? I enjoyed it and would recommend it as starter.  The Mongolian Beef Chow Mein was awesome. The portion size is generous and not doubt get your money worth in food. I love! Hearty this dish was with ample amounts of noodles. The vegetables and the beef felt like every bite got the best of all worlds. It had nice depth of flavor in the sauce. Solid noodle dish.   The service was five stars!!!!! The gentlemen was awesome since it was my first time. Never had empty glass of water. Checked several times make sure everything was good. Friendly.   The Magic Noodle player in the noodle game for me. I love the fact close to home for me. No doubt plan on coming back cause barely tapped the menu. Till my next noodle recovery meal. lol!

Nt0sNpfiTfL-xVer2UEF-g.text: I have tried many beef noodle soups in my travels. The Magic Noodle lives up to its name as it definitely has one of the best beef noodle soups I have eaten. I ate an amazing beef brisket noodle soup. It was an immaculate bowl and checked off all the boxes. The brisket was extremely tender. The handmade noodles were soft and chewy. Of course, the soup is a key cog in any noodle soup bowl. It was excellent and had great flavor.

5G4rMyQmDbwcrwFgB2ho1Q.text: My experience with the main star, the noodles was an okay kind of thing. The Dan Dan was not what I was expecting, the seasoning in the Dan Dan made my throat numb and I ended up having my taste buds not taste any of the other foods I had ordered! I have to say the noodles are fresh and is pretty good. I would definitely recommend the knife cut noodles for those would like fresh made noodles with a bit of a chewy texture to it. The soup had an okay flavor, just a bit of more spice would make it better! Overall, I found the flavor of the broths ok, the noodles were definitely fresh, and one of the side dishes I had ordered, the spicy wonton, I think it was called, was definitely delicious!

95cm5QfTsfi6Y3bEts6o6A.text: Took fam here, it was great! Food was delicious, staff was really nice let us take pics of them making noodles. Had spicy beef soup soooo good.

MTGyi9ouMorczlK5sr2MJQ.text: Very friendly host, food is definitely better than Noodle man on Rainbow.  I can feel they really put their heart into making food for you.

RA8LU_8Oh10CTdjRk2VqFg.text: My friend actually recommended this place. I had the Song Sao noodles today and it was amazing. The noodles texture were great and price was very reasonable too. Our server was very sweet and attentive. I have found my new favorite noodle place.

I highly recommend the Beef Brisket Noodles. The food came out fast, and it was hot -which was awesome. Overall, this place is a new fave of mine.
