It's hard to find a good Chinese restaurant, luckily I found one. The staff was great and helpful. I plan on doing pick up when I don't have time to cook.

We also had the beef brisket noodle, Lan Zhou noodles and Mongolian Chow Mein. Everything was delicious and the service was great. Can't wait to go back next time to try other items.

9aNzg-6EEaP4CBZ7kZVCqQ.text: The food is delicious, ( I ordered beef noodle and beef pancakes)very good service. I like the energy of this place. One thing that I noticed while I was eating was the happiness in the face of the guys making the noodles inside the kitchen. Also the kitchen is impeccably clean and you can see everything from outside. The happy energy of the employees got me. They work hard to give you the best at that place. iqX0sRvH2noYQJaMrjt9Wg.text: Their Szechuan Beef Brisket Noodle (C4) is a must-have! It has the right amount of spicy and tangy-ness that keeps me coming back for more. I like it the most with thin noodles. I also recommend the Spicy Wontons - they are just as good as the ones found in Din Tai Fung, a popular joint found in the LA area; their Steamed Chicken with Chili Sauce, and Sweet and Sour Black Fungas Salad (weird, but so tasty and apparently very healthy!). I love how this location is in the Southwest area so I can always just stop by and have a quick dinner. Highly recommended!

lxnfRNCp2xJEhCb_Z8QKUQ.text: The food was delicious. The noodles were great and the soup was astounding. It was at a reasonable price.  We had some good service as well. Will come back again.

LeHhS3yOTIgpDE9VRVsttQ.text: Excellent food!  Hand made noodles were great in the Mongolian Beef Chow Mein.  Hot and cold appetizers are also very good-try the Chinese Beef Burrito!  Highly recommended.

oSDwb7M62Ony5A1NoJ3GnQ.text: Stopped in tonight small place but great food .Watched them making noodles staff very friendly will be going back next week and probably the week after and the week after!!!! 7TOKeNYkc-2eVANwaQvYZA.text: cool that they are hand made noodle and you can watch the guy make them... still very greasy

W0Kd9gVHzYiUGWCvTaxmNQ.text: So yummy and the service from Jennifer is awesome! She is very welcoming and serves you right away with your drink. The beef brisket noodle soup is to die for - huge bowl filled with tasty broth, lots of fresh hand-made noodles and the most tender beef you can imagine. It's cool to watch them make the hand pulled noodles from scratch right in front of you! I can't wait to go back and try the rest of their menu items. Thank you for opening as you are now my favorite go to place for beef noodle soup!

kviES1uOBMLgyo6RPuEUPg.text: Always delicious and hot. I love this place and my favorite is the Spicy Wonton and I just tried the Chicken Chow Mien with knife cut noodles. Perfect. The service is amazing and always friendly. We are Happy Customers.

3iPkVD8UpzmY594-i5iPjg.text: It's a small restaurant but the people are nice, and the food is great!  Try the panckes and the fried rice

uvS1LScsk9-9B9BCCAF7Dg.text: I'd love to rate with 5 stars but my dan dan was salty. I'll come back again, hoping the saltiness can be adjusted.

bJH2IHFIf0gkIvPeKp6nYw.text: I'm very fond of this style of Chinese cooking, and with this place being so close to where I live, decided to try it. It was also a rainy day, which is perfect for hot noodle soups. The food here is just ok. I had the "beef burrito" aka taiwanese beef roll, and the pork pancake to start. The pancakes are long and rectangular, not like the normal shape of this dish at most places. The beef roll was a small portion for $6.50 and was just mediocre at best, like the kitchen didn't really care when they made this. I ordered a C1 lan zhou soup and subbed knife sliced noodles for my entree. The soup broth had a pleasant taste. Although whoever cut my noodles needs to learn to be a little more uniform in their slicing. Some were really thin, and some were way too thick and not cooked in the middle. And the chili sauce which is on the table, they need to fix this. Has no flavor at all, it's not spicy, just tastes like straight oil and sesame. That was really disappointing. But they are a new restaurant and probably still figuring things out, so I'll give it another try in the future.

vqoGj8anhC4pLX3gufdw7g.text: We loved this place.  Great service, awesome food, and great price. The food was fresh and it was cool to see the chefs making the noodles behind the counter.  We got the wonton appetizer, the Mongolian beef chow mein, and beef brisket noodle bowl.  We wish the meal came with a larger protein portion, but other than that, we loved it.

acjs-_Jan_zE_Ryc5YZC6g.text: I love this place its simple menu but ive probably had almost every and ive never had an issue with any dish. Everything is super yummy filled with flavor. I love their C4 spicy szechuan brisket noodle soup, the brisket is always very tender and the broth is full of flavor. Its amazing how the make the noodles as well. I will always recommend this place

GaZdeTHJ2BBM3KkIQxi6EA.text: Great place, everything I order tasted great. Absolutely love watching them hand pull the noodles as it never gets old.

HsNamkEeC_ccibB-4N8mSg.text: Came here during lunch time at noon. Place was pretty busy. We did not get seated until almost 12:30. They took too long to seat us even when there was an empty table. There definitely were enough employees working. They just didn't work with a sense of urgency. Location is convenient and decor was very nice and clean. Service was decent. We ordered the Lan Zhou Noodle and Dan Dan Noodle.  Lan Zhou Noodle did not have much flavor and it wasn't even served hot. Dan Dan Noodle was not very good either. It had a weird after taste.

gZWi73xZ-ptNlAhnQtOK2w.text: I was SO excited to come and try this place out after seeing some pictures of the food on instagram. What caught my eye was the wide cut noodles.. looked delicious! When I came in, I sat down and ordered the spicy brisket soup noodle. After a few mins minutes of ordering, I realized the waitress never asked what type of noodles I wanted. I grabbed her attention and made sure she knew I was here for the wide cut noodles, not original. She proceeded to tell me how original was the best for this kind of soup and that's how they usually make it. She wasn't rude about it, but we literally went back and fourth for a while until I finally gave up and told her, "you know what? Bring me whatever it is you think is best for this type of soup". I don't know if it was the language barrier or she really just wanted me to try the regular noodles? I didn't understand. How hard was it to get the plate on the picture? I used to be a server so I wasn't going to make a scene about it either. I was just disappointed. The soup overall was good.... but hey, could have been better with the noddles I wanted. I honestly left there pretty unsatisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basic original noodles which I didn&#39;t even want.

P_4v7U070LcTCRI-S-GJLg.text: I really liked the Lan Zhou noodles! They were delicious. Also the cold cucumber appetizer was super garlicky, sour and delicious. Plus points for the Chinese TV in the background that was playing some delicious looking cooking show. My fiancee got the Chong Ching noodles, which were pleasantly mala.  This feels like a strange reason to knock the review down a peg, but I did notice that this restaurant has no ambient music. Maybe it was the day I was there, but there was no background music at all. This lead to easily hearing conversations in the kitchen, as well as from other customers. I prefer there at least to be some background music to set the tone. As it was...it just felt quiet. I would have appreciated some tone-setting tunes.  We're getting down to the nitty gritty again, but the owner/server seemed like in a big rush to do everything- set down utensils, clear tables, and take orders. Not that it's bad to do things quickly, but I picked up a rushed, almost frantic vibe. I guess it's good for speed of service though.  Price is great, service is quick. Highly recommend.

wp-ylkuwZiufYJUIopRNfg.text: Real Chinese noodle house.  Lives and worked in that part of the world for several years. This is flash back medicine. If you want to know what real Chinese noodle houses serve...this is it.

6y0ZxhJ0jhgOhmf1bh4VPg.text: OMG! Found my new hand made noodle spot. This place is sooooo good. Everything is flavorful just the way it should be. We tried the Beef Brisket noodles, Dan Dan noodles and the onion pancake with braised pork belly today. Everything was delicious. We'll be back again and again and again.

9mXzvOnlfnvY5zkJMp8aIg.text: I love knife cut noodles so had to come here to experiment. The noodles weren't chewy like how I expected it to taste.  Bc I'm so used to eating knife cut noodles, I know what is good vs bad and these were on the bad side of the spectrum. Also the spicy dumplings weren't that great either! I'm normally not this big of a good snob but when it comes to Sichuan, I know what's good.  I would need to go back to try the other noodles, but would not recommend the thick knife cut noodles. I liked the restaurant in itself because they ha e glass walls - you have a clear viewing of the kitchen. Service was great and the restaurant was sanitary.

zB_J4Vt08EY2WaqAJ1-_Jw.text: It is so sad that most of the reviews state how excellent their service was, but you receive the total opposite. The owner Andy and his employees don't care their customer when there is a problem, all they think about just MONEY and MORE MONEY!!!!!!!!!!  On Sunday 7/22/18, I ordered a togo which contains Sezchuan Beef Brisket Noodle, Spicy Wonton, Spicy Beef Shank w/ Beef Tenderloin, and Steamed Chicken w/Chili Sauce. The following day, the food gave me a really bad food poison. I was having diarrhea, migraine, and whole body was sort and tired. I ended up taking antibiotic to kill all the bacteria and pain killer to release my migraine.  When I feeling a little better on Tuesday, I contacted the restaurant and asked to speak to the manager or owner. The server asked me what is it about and I told him that I got food poison after eating the food from this restaurant. I was immediately told they are not here and will be back tomorrow.   So I called this morning and the food server asked the same question what is this about. So I told him that I got food poison after eating the food from food here, he immediately told me the owner or manager is not here. So I told him that I called yesterday and was informed they will be here today.  the food server was like oh, let me see if they are here. So magically he was able to put Bill (dont know what is his position) on the phone. I re-explained what happened and Bill said it could be the weather that cause you to have diarrhea. And I said "you are funny. this is the first time I heard weather can cause diarrhea." The he changed to maybe the stuff you drink. Bill just keep coming up with excuses. He did take down my contact info and said the manager will contact me asap which is a lie. The owner Andy was there and he is not willing to talk to me (see below).  The thing that Bill didn't know was that I can understand both Cantonese and Mandarin. Andy only speaks Mandarin and Bill speaks both. From the background while I was on hold, I heard Bill explained what is going on to Andy in Mandarin and Andy told Bill just say he is not here which was what I was informed.   This is the first and last time I will eat in this restaurant and hopefully they can pass the health inspection when the SNHD comes.

zkcaf6i6cICP6h7rzUuiZg.text: So good! Meat just melts apart, broth is amazing. I would say this is my 2nd fave spot for hand pulled noodle soup - Chinese noodles!

ufNck2ML8D2mx3ogfiZifg.text: The Magic Noodle is the holy grail of noods. Nay, of all foods. Hand pulled noodles are hard to find in The U.S., but it wasn't just their fresh noods that shined. They had the best broth I have ever had in my life. It was so good we went back two days in a row, even skipping the dayclubs in Vegas to get these soups. No regrets.  You can chose between 3 types of noodles, the OG hand pulled noodles (long spaghetti like noodles), knife shaved and the thick noodles. I personally love the thicker noodles because you get a doughy taste to them.  My favorite dish was C4, the spicy Szechuan beef noodle soup. The beef was so tender and I love their broth, but you can also add vinegar and more spices if you want! Also a must is the onion pancake appetizer. I will be making the trip back to Vegas solely for this restaurant.

bOszypN_EE2dzU7iITycWQ.text: FRESH HAND PULL NOODLE!!! Went their twice for lunch both time food was excellent and service was great :)

Epagn4dPZcpFiy6p6clpVA.text: This was a yelp find. We started with the house pancakes, which were excellent. We both ordered noodle soups. I enjoyed the spicy brisket and it was good. The place is a storefront and the service is friendly and helpful.

KDGm-yR28iPkvanShbtPpQ.text: I went for the first time the other day. Food was amazing! Staff was awesome, just wish it had more seating.

pPp6AXhIAxLRYMOdB9SB1w.text: Watching the noodles being made was good. The soup was good, but the pork belly was exceedingly good, worth a 5-star rating.  Just get the pork belly over rice and other materials as they suit you.

eEnluoV_Qo4IbhkUCF9OFQ.text: Hot and new noods!  If you're in a mood for good noods, try the Magic Noodle, where we got a free show with our delicious meal.  When we arrived last night, we were seated immediately although we probably came at just the right time because the place was full of patrons.  Mr. Wang was pulling noodles almost the whole time we were there (I only know his name because I asked our server who that hard-working bespectacled fellow was behind the glass).  That's the free show part.  The delicious part came when we had our noodles. I chose the knife cut noodles for the Beef Brisket soup.  These noodles were just the right consistency, not too firm and not too soft.  I loved the tender beef brisket served with the soup, as well, with its nice flavor and quite a generous amount of beef.  Service was great throughout our meal as we were checked on often and our water glasses were never empty.  I would definitely recommend this place for a magical meal.

photos.caption: Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Knife Cut noods with the Beef Brisket soup
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Knife cut noodles in Beef Brisket soup
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hand cut noodles in Beef Brisket soup

wyvF5p4XWwSxIwCVvX5XMQ.text: The noodles here are by far a 5 star rating!! But the service well that's a different story. I brought my boyfriend and son here for lunch recently, so it was very busy. The waiter asked us to wait for a larger family to finish with the main table to seat us, instead of having us sit at one of the two readily available smaller tables to the side, and was going to sit the woman who had come in after us at one of the said smaller tables instead. I explained we were on a time crunch and the smaller table would be okay. Even the woman behind us was confused as to why they wanted to skip us and have us wait... we waited a good 20 minutes before getting served any drinks. We ordered our food with our drinks and I would say it took at least 40 minutes before being served any of our food items, even appetizers. Even the same woman that was behind us in line, who ended up sitting next to us and was super sweet, was annoyed and confused as to why she and her date had been served immediately but not us. Long story short, I think the woman who took our order forgot to put it in, and our original waiter had no clue what was going on it seemed. People all around us seemed to be waiting on something, and granted it was busy, I noticed staff doing other tasks like making pre-wrapped silverware sets instead of tending to customers, as if they had just forgotten.   The food is VERY good, but the beef brisket seems to be just a bunch of fatty meat each time I've ordered it. I will still continue to enjoy their noodles but probably to-go from here on out.

zVX_NVVq4c61Ezs85KS5Xg.text: Stumbled into this place unintentionally, looking for some late-night (9:30) Chinese food....and got so much more!!! First of all, it was a real challenge trying to decide what to order but our young waiter was helpful and funny! Feeling a little under the weather, I chose the Szechwan Brisket soup (monstrous bowl and very spicy), my hubs chickened out with the hand-pulled noodle chow mein and a side of the wrapped pork pancakes--delicious!! Waiter told us we were smart to come in late as every dinner and lunchtime they're packed and on Fri & Sat nights, people wait hours to get in! Hard to believe cuz it's such a modest but well-appointed casual place but it is quite small. Fun to watch the guy behind the glass pulling the noodles--who knew? Go--you won't regret it!

Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Magic Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vKmPT3zYI8vnuC0WZSv7LA.text: Five whooooole stars.   The service is fast, they try to accommodate every customer in the pretty small space they have. But it all still feels very clean which I love.   I had the spicy dumplings and the C4 Szechuan beef noodle ... I feel like I'm totally butchering the name. And the dumplings stole the show. 10/10 would recommend. The noodles were super delicious too, I loved how the noodles were fresh and cooked to the perfect texture. You totally get your monies worth with the amount of food you're given, and the server was amazing and checked up on us multiple times asking how our food was. And their food is just aesthetically pleasing, totes IG worthy.   My only complaint is that I wish there was more salt & flavor to the broth but that could be my Filipino talking as well. Great place & great food and I plan on coming back in the future!

KvG2_bIWj5HEdAZ4Iq1DJw.text: I thoroughly enjoyed The Magic Noodle. The layout is perfect for watching the kitchen make your fresh noodles. The service was overly friendly and attentive. The food did not disappoint.  I ordered the beef brisket noodle soup with knife cut noodles. The noodles were probably the only minor negative for me. Being knife cut, they were naturally imperfect, going from thick and chewy on one end to super thin on the other. Next time, I'll try their hand-pulled noodles so I can get my slurp on. I thought the beef and the broth were flavorful with the meat being incredibly tender.  We also tried the sweet and sour black fungus salad. Definitely up there on my list of favorite types of fungus! I just love the texture.

yyLhNkDanF1GMiwwn_1SEg.text: This review is solely based on a phone call we made asking if this restaraunt will be open on 4th of July. We were told yes, they are open everyday. We arrive with a party of 8, and its closed.

0NhdpskAt-hhf0gQoRdFZg.text: This is my go to Chinese noodle place in the southwest. Solid food with fast friendly service. The noodz are freshly made and fantastic. All the dishes I've tried are very savory, spicy beef, minced pork, some mix noodle dish.

qIVmgW8REpYg75Q2OhrKrw.text: It was so delicious. The broth was so flavorful. My family were so pleased with this restaurant and they said the flavor and texture was comparable to restaurants in New York

I ordered a spicy vegetarian soup due to my dietary restrictions and the flavor was under-whelming. Sweet and Sour Black Fungus (Mushroom) Salad $4.95 texture was pretty interesting but the salad is yummy!  Sweet & Sour Cucumber $4.95 generous portion. 2O2HcD9DqzRfx6EP5oB8Rg.text: We were seated at the window viewing the making of the Magic noodle. It was entertaining to see the operation of this place. Basically, I saw one guy who prepared all the noodle bowls and the ingredients for the cook to stir fry. One lady made the pancake rolls without plastic gloves which concerned me because I do not like my food prepared without gloves. We ordered the beef noodle, spicy won ton, and the Mongolian beef noodle plate. The spicy won ton was by far the best tasting sauce I have had since my frequent visits to Chengdu. The beef noodle soup had an excellent broth with very tender beef. There was nothing magical about the taste of the fresh noodles, but the broths and sauces make up for it.

ag5F1-VY5GbjlquEdSH9sw.text: TL;DR. Great hand-pulled noodles. Good flavor. Very satisfying beef noodle soup!  Come, my friendly folk. Come around the digital campfire! ... Yo! WTF! This place is fantastic. I had doubts about the Sichuan (szechuan) experience in Las Vegas, but my buddies who have lived here for over a year brought me to this place while I interviewed for a job. They helped me figure out how to get the experience I looked for, so I got the hand-pulled noodles with beef brisket soup.  Typically, in the San Gabriel Valley (in Southern California), a default sichuan dish would be spicy right away. This one was mild by default, but the sichuan peppers still kicked-in so my mouth was a little numb ('cuz i'm a closet-masochist and I enjoy this experience like Trevor James @ The Food Ranger). I've been told they can amp up the spiciness as you please, but if you're bringing people who aren't used to spicy food-- this place will work as an intro to sichuan food. Fantastic flavor!  My friends still visit this place as a go-to and it isn't even on Spring Mountain Rd where the majority of asian food/restaurants are at.

jtxe9br5Xs2pRM15O2VO1Q.text: First time eating here. Tried the Beef brisket noodle. So so good!  Also had the onion pancake with beef. Another winner. The house fried rice had a mix of chicken, beef and shrimp so try that if you are undecided.  My next visit will be C3, Beef brisket noodle again for sure.

Highly recommend with only a few caveats!!!

YaT_bGiSel2wmas8dsHKxA.text: We ordered the wontons in spicy sauce and the Szechuan noodles in beef broth. Make sure you specify whether you want thick or thin noodles because they will assume thin. Unfortunately my party did not know this and asked for a change in our order from the thin noodle to the thick noodle. Although the manager insisted we try thin, he reluctantly switched out our order to thick noodles after we asked a second time.  The noodles themselves were good! Thick and chewy. However, the broth was MAD spicy. The Szechuan spice made my tongue burn like a MF almost to the point of it being unenjoyable.   I'd probably go back just for the wontons.

q2vhWtglw55TJZaiTdeNig.text: I rarely give places 5 stars on first tries but this place is bomb! I had just arrived to vegas that and after a long nap it was lunch time, I yelped for noodles and found this place near by where my friend lives... It is authentic chinese noodles and for those who know me... i'm a snob on chinese food and noodles!   This place has hand made noodles and you can have them cut in whatever way you like....   Green onion pancakes (4/5): thin and crispy. went well with the chili oil sauce. It wasn't burnt which is a plus!  C4 Szechuan brisket beef w/ knife cut noodles (4/5): broth wasn't as spicy so i added more chili oil but they put lots of beef briskets.   C1 Lan zhou w/knife cut (3/5): not spicy broth more of a pork base and flavor was ok.   Service is good, even though the place is small... the workers are hustling... They do speak chinese but I spoke in english when I ordered.

4tA9rg2ZvsHNpjB0A_wVIQ.text: Taste and smell receptions in your face cannot thank you enough for the decision to check out The Magic Noodles.  I was thoroughly impressed.  Good old Lanzhou la mian, hand pulled noodles, with lots of meat, tasty broth, and a nice spoon ladle to scope in all the goodness.  They do not mess around here.  I saw someone order fried noodles and it also looked delicious.  The best food here though is when the staff sit down to eat their own lunch.  They livin' good!  I ain't hatin'. Ek332BdBF6PbdGaLj4nNWA.text: Absolutely delicious knife shaved beef noodles. I got the sichuan spicy version and it definitely hit the spot. Their beef was very tender and the soup base was super flavorful. The portion side is large so it could be shared. Also ordered the spicy wontons, which had a more peanut taste, but still a great snack.

d-DqruOvKStmjJLhwuD7mg.text: I don't know if I believe in magic, but I do believe in knife-shaved noodles! Much like Shaang and Noodle Man, Magic Noodle offers a similar menu of housemade noodle dishes, rices, and apps, served in a wood-accented dining room where the focal point is a glassed-in kitchen where the staff are stretching and pulling the noodles to order. The guys here have been especially great about putting on a show for the camera, so whip out your phone and get it on the 'gram.  I always have to order spicy wontons if I see them on a menu, and the version here were generously portioned and very thinly-skinned, with a great house-made chili oil sauce. The Szechuan Beef Noodle Soup is a huge portion of "spicy" (not really) broth with chunks of beef brisket, broccoli, and plenty of noodles- specify knife-shaved for the chewy, curly style I like best.  Looking forward to revisiting for the pancakes and burrito apps next time!

opZLoiopjdnJvP_fERzdbw.text: I was in town for a national pug meet up for the weekend and this was nearby the hotel. Located in a strip mall where there is plenty of parking.   The noodles are made in house which is common in the San Gabriel Valley of So Cal. It was lunch time and I ordered the spicy beef noodle soup and pork belly & green onion pancakes. The pancakes were a smaller portion that I normally get - but the flavor and texture was spot on. The beef noodle soup was also hearty, tasty and just as good as the places I frequent in So Ca. I chatted with the owner who was younger and friendly just like my server.  Credit cards are accepted here. I would definitely recommend Magic Noodle if you're in the area and craving fresh hand pulled noodles.

urJ19PUdD-Ldn2-xIvbCyQ.text: This past Monday, I was hoping to Hawaiian food.  Fortunately, they were closed on Memorial day so I ended up a few doors down at the Magic Noodle.    First impressions walking in, it's a nice setup.  Because I was alone, I opted to sit at the bar, especially because I could see the kitchen hand making the noodles.  Lunch and show.  On this visit, I opted for chicken and mushroom.  Once it came out and letting it sit a few minutes to cool down, the first thing I did was to taste the soup.  The soup was bland.  I then made the slow attempt to taste the mushroom and it was fantastic, as well as the chicken.  Eat the noodle, soup, chicken and mushroom certainly tasted great. And just to be sure, tasting the soup when it was the only thing left had very little taste.  Good service, ok broth, great noodles, chicken and soup, clean restaurant and nice atmosphere.  I'll be back for sure.

piw-iVKJ5JXNC0XymYjuuQ.text: So good!   When I discovered this restaurant last night, I ended up having dreams of food. Amazing. It lived up to all my hopes and dreams.   Onion pancakes with pork belly was absolutely delicious. Tender and seasoned perfectly. Beef burrito thing... think of it as a cold roast beef sandwich with cilantro and onions and a sweet sauce. The combination fried rice was delicious. The soups.  Spicy but not. Perfect!!!

MvwSBLGJHnW-Hs43fIps1A.text: What a cute little spot!  This cafe serves freshly made noodles, including their famous "knife cut" ones, on the premises, and behind a glass partition so that you can see the action as it happens.  You can then order said bespoke noodles in a soup, such as the beef brisket one with spicy broth and vegetables, as I did, on a wintry cold (for Las Vegas) day last week.  It was delicious.  The chef made some really good decisions here.  The broth is super well-balanced, even the spicy version, with just the right amount of seasoning, spices, and aromatic herbs and vegetables.  You could separate the chunks of beef with a spoon, it was so tender, and yet, it did not fall apart in the soup.  Seems as though someone knows exactly what they are doing in the kitchen.  The noodles did not disappoint or spoil the party, either.  I ordered--against my server's advice--the knife-cut noodles.  He thought I would not enjoy them since they may be, apparently, an "acquired" taste.  He suggested that I have the thinner noodles, or else the wide noodles that are not cut with a knife.  These tend to be less chewy and therefore, it goes, more palatable to Westerners.  Respectfully, he was wrong! (And to his credit, he was happy about that--and beamed broadly when he saw me slurping up my soup and noodles, joining the "clean plate," er, "bowl" club).  I liked the wide, chewy noodles with the soup.  They did not take away from the flavor of the broth, but did not totally soak it up, either.  It was distinct, yet integrated, like a complementary relationship.  And the texture was chewy, but not unlike an al dente pasta, if you know what I mean.  The only reason for the star knock-off is the seating.  It is a very small cafe, and it can feel a bit claustrophobic.  I think they could use the space a teeny bit better, too.  There is a table to the right, that seems to store odds and ends, that could be cleared off and dispatched to accommodate more customers.  I also see a possibility for another bar along the other side of the noodle display kitchen for seating (assuming the Fire Dept. has no problem with a more narrow hallway).  The kitchen could probably use less space, too, in favor of more seating.  As it is, you should expect to wait at least 15-20 minutes or so to be seated, and then you will be in a closely cramped quarters, and in an uncomfortable chair.  Leave your coat and bags in the car.  If they can fix this, it will be a contender for "perfect."

0X9BeTNfqGsUrlbs75kqQw.text: I have been wanting to try this place out for a while now and I am so glad I finally did! This place is my new favorite noodle place in town! You cannot go wrong with handmade noodles made right in front of you! There was so much to choose from on the menu that I did not know what I wanted to get. The waiter gave me his suggestion and told me the favorite among most customers, the C4 Szechuan Beef Brisket Noodle. I am not usually a spicy food kind of person, mainly because I can't handle spicy but I asked if they could lessen the spice for me and it was perfect! The broth was so warm and delicious and the noodles were amazing. Definitely a place to go anytime you are in the mood for fresh noodles. You definitely won't be disappointed!

upUdxVyP5FUkYsiYAZm05Q.text: One of my favorite restaurants! This place is always busy but we live down the street so we typically opt for takeout which is just as tasty, not to mention super fast. We eat Magic Noodle at least a couple times a month it's that good. The spicy wontons, Mongolian beef noodles and spicy brisket soup are among our go-to items. Everything is made fresh and you can't beat the texture of fhe noodles, cooked to perfection.

vfECD6BRM8og0ONySqfOWw.text: I black out EVERY SINGLE TIME. How the heck can this place be soooo consistent, have such high quality, so authentic and affordable EVERY SINGLE TIME?! Mind blown.  Order the Beef Brisket Noodle with original noodles. The noodles are al dente, while the brisket is super tender and soft (no need for floss because it's stuck in yo teeth). The broth will make you pass out and feel like time-traveled to Asia.  Make friends with Stephen (the only slim dude server with glasses and a big personality). Between Stephen's funny warm hospitality and these damn good noodles, you WIN AT LIFE.

wl2wiTe3RlAcKYHWpVNKJA.text: If the recent chilly weather is making you crave comfort food, try this hot little spot for yummy noodles. Randomly picked this after a "fun" time at the DMV. The Yelp reviews looked promising, and this place did not disappoint. Got seated promptly during normal lunch time, noon. The place was busy but not crazy busy. Order was taken quickly and water was served. I ordered a "lemon iced tea" which turned out to be a can of Brisk Lemon Iced Tea. Would never have ordered that but . Anyway, I ordered the C4, Szechuan Beef Brisket Noodle bowl and my wife ordered the Chicken Chow Mein. The interior decor is really well done and welcoming , and it is neat to see the noodles and food being made behind the glass. The tables are somewhat on the small side, with only a few booths for bigger parties. There are tables for 4 as well.  It took a normal amount of time for our food to be served, and it was presented nicely and I had the option of getting a fork. Appearance of the food was a 10 for sure. There were big pieces of brisket in the broth, and daaaang they were tender and really flavorful, almost like they'd been marinated and/or slow cooked. The noodles were cooked perfectly and were SO yum!! I would definitely order the C4 again. My wife was very happy with hers as well, and it too, was presented nicely. All in all, loved the atmosphere, loved the food, prices were perfect, service was fine, I will definitely return for my noodle fix and definitely recommend this place to friends

R24Gon9R7-X0-k5F8v6D_w.text: The schezuan style noodles are quite incredible. I love that their noodles are handmade, and definitely loved their noodles with the spicy soup. Heat level is average.   The dumplings were delicious as well.   Service can be a bit of a struggle. The food took much longer than anticipated.

f2BwQ4flUUuOZGqKT510rg.text: Awesome noodles!  Our family stopped by as we were headed out of Las Vegas.  We tried the regular hand pulled, wide hand pulled, and knife cut noodles.  Our favorite was the knife cut noodles.  Perfect amount of chew and bounce.  Our waiter explained that each bowl was made to order and may take a bit of time.  We ended up getting our food within 15 mins and we're out of there in 30 since we were in a hurry.  Will be back when we're back in town.

rgAKTfWqMa88cSM9SB70HA.text: Overall: excellent.  We went on Saturday for lunch at about 11:10 with 6 adults and a toddler and got the last table.  Get here early, 10 mins after opening there was a line out the door.  We started with the spicy wontons, the spicy dumplings, and the onion pancakes with pork belly.  They were all delicious, but they all had a lot of oil, that would be my only detraction from this eating experience.  We then got several soup noodle dishes, fried rice and chow mein.  All were outstanding, with condiments available to increase the heat level.  The service was prompt, courteous, and professional.  In the future, if they could add a soda fountain and unlimited ice tea, that would be a plus.  I highly recommend this place.

WZDBRl4cdZ-gMyxx_FkLJQ.text: I went here on a date night on a Wednesday evening around 4:30 P.M.   Its off of the 215/Tropicana Exit in a large shopping Plaza. It's located next to a few other local businesses such as "Sweet Addiction Cookies and Ice Cream." Parking is spacious.  Entering The Magic Noodle, there is open seating. You can watch as the chefs make the noodles from scratch and also watch them cook your meal!  There was plenty of options on the menu. I selected their Garlic Chicken noodle dish. I was pleasantly surprised at how flavorful the dish is! The noodles tasted amazing - fresh and home-made! The chicken was cooked well, it wasn't over-cooked or under cooked. The Garlic was not overwhelming and the dish wasn't spicy! Just a tip, you can ask them to make your dish mild if you do not like spice.  Just to note, when it was about 5:30, the place was packed!! There was about 15 people waiting for their food orders or waiting for a open table! Try to get there early before rush hour or go later in the day!  This food is amazing though! I'd recommend trying The Magic Noodle once! The only reason why I am giving it 4 out of 5 was when I was there eating, there were several people complaining about the way that there food was cooked. Supposedly there was one of the chefs not wearing gloves and he was touching the noodles, and then handling dishes. The individuals were upset and were sort-of making a scene in the restaurant unfortunately.

The beef pcs never trimmed before so it's more fat than beef actually! 3 servers Who barely speak English tuning the place- If you like a mediocre it's the perfect place for you!

wAjO56fP8HlqrMx7ZALTfQ.text: Definitely a fan of this place! We used to go to Noodle Man but their service as been pissing me off so we are looking for new options. My sister recommended this place and I really liked it. First off kudos to the server working there, he was very honest about the menu and made honest recommendations and did not just say yes to what I asked for when he knows it would not be a good choice, I appreciate the honesty! I ordered the first noodle and asked for knife cut noodle and the server said that is not a good choice because the broth works better with the regular noodle so of course I went with his recommendation!  We both got the first noodle on the menu (forgot what it's called), and it was so good. Noodle was fresh and chewy, broth was simple but so flavorful with a little chili providing a nice kick. The only thing that threw me off was the meat, it had that "fridge" smell that was a little strong. It was not inedible or anything but ruined the noodle a bit.   I cannot wait to come back and try more.

OfJMOd1PlqUpyXdXGhH4RA.text: Sometimes the wait is a little ridiculous so I wouldn't go if you are on a time restraint, unless you called in an order to go, but the food doesn't disappoint. I come here often.

lf1ghNZIBpQ4i_YMxi6cTw.text: Best Chinese Noodle house in Vegas that I've been to so far. My wife and I came in on a Friday around 4pm and it was shockingly kind of busy already. Regardless we were seated promptly and I like that they give you a glass of water without having to ask. The service was great and my glass never went below half empty. The food made me feel even nostalgic and that's a compliment. My wife and I got the brisket soup and Mongolian noodles with original noodles and it was amazing. We will definitely be coming back. 4 stars instead of 5 since my wife went with her friends a few days prior around 9pm. She mentioned that the service was horrible but the quality and taste of the food made up for it.

4eCDGFkvUrjsK8TKX2pt1g.text: Love this place. Spicy wontons and the secshwan beef every time. Only draw back is that they aren't on Postmates. PLEASE REGISTER WITH POSTMATES!

IQ5gJC80stkRus4TJ5fZow.text: I saw a pop up on Yelp a month ago, saved it and got the chance to try it out today.  The Magic Noodle reminds me a lot of The Noodle Man off Rainbow.  The Magic Noodle is a little bigger.  It's clean and has great customer service.   We ordered:  -Sliced Pork Garlic Sauce (If you love pork and garlic, this dish is a must!) -Spicy Beef Shank with Beef Tenderloin (Meaty, it wasn't bad.  We were hoping it was similar to another dish at Chef Hung in Irvine.  We miss their Spicy Beef Tendon.  This dish has the same taste, but different texture since we had beef tendon there.  Fresh and cold.) -C1  Lan Zhou Noodle (Clean broth, fresh noodles, I think I like the noodle texture at Noodle Man better.  But this is still very good.) -C3  Beef Brisket Noodle  (Husband had this noodle soup and he really liked it.)  We enjoyed the service and food here.  Only about 2 miles away from home.  Happy there is another noodle spot similar to The Noodle Man, since it's a pain to drive to off the Rainbow.  Also, in the summertime this place should be cooler than The Noodle Man.  This store doesn't get the afternoon sun.

UiuAr9yuKRq6irpIjLBKjQ.text: Yummy! I love this newer Chinese Restaurant and have been here now countless times, mostly take out. My favorites apps are their spicy wontons, beef pancakes, and the Spicy Beef Shank cold dish.   My favorite dishes are the Lan Zhou, Szechuan Beef, and Tomato and Egg Noodle. Sometimes the broth is super flavorful some days and others it's more bland. That would be my only real complaint.   The service here has always been too notch and I never have to wait long for a takeout order. I love it too because it's in a super convenient location.

5MsDwjqsZMaw0IbJv5IrgQ.text: Get there early or prepare to wait. But, it is worth the wait!  The noodles are made in an open kitchen and watching them being made is very interesting. Best part though is eating the noodles, the chicken and mushroom noodles and the beef noodles are really good.

5yAYptpIxjH-FStAyDbuKQ.text: Honestly this is the best noodles I've had in a long long time! First timer and I'm already planning to come back tomorrow. It's so delicious the fresh hand made noodles you can tell the difference it's amazing! So much flavor in every single bite. Such a perfect name for this restaurant. It really is the magic noodle but for the customer like myself, it's the magic plate because the noodles disappeared (like pooof!) as soon as it came to my table. I almost took a bite of my wooden chopsticks because that's how scrumptious it was LOL!

LnnX32LuOAIiMCgt5GcBlA.text: This is the spot! We love coming her for the beef noodle soup, shrimp fried rice and there spicy dumplings. So authentic and flavorful. cQl62r0RzthmzgDuOZssIA.text: The food, the taste, the quality....5 stars!!!  The service, while it isn't bad...they can't handle being busy. They don't seem to have the right process down and because of their quality of their food they have been getting incredibly busy for being open such a short period.   My suggestion? Come during "off times" and if you must come during dinner time, be prepared to wait.

npdZi1IcYUcPoL0HBponJA.text: I found this incredible place on Instagram, and went on a mission to find it when I was in town. About 20 minutes from the strip, it's worth the trip. It's now my favorite thing to eat in Vegas. It's a small place in a random strip mall and from the outside you have no idea how unique and delicious the food inside truly is.  The spicy dumplings are wonderful. Get your own and don't share, trust me. I got the spicy beef broth with regular noodles. The broth is homey, delicious and rich, slow cooked on the back of the burner low and slow. Hints of ginger and cilantro. Big chunks of beef. Just enough spice to have a kick, yet not kill your stomach. The noodles are handmade right in front of you, and they are perfectly irregular in thickness, giving away the fact that they are handmade with love. Perfectly cooked. You can't help but slurp and gulp up all that delicious noodle soup. It's very affordable Asian comfort food at its finest, and I find myself craving it even now as I type this. Yum! I'll come back every time I'm in Vegas for sure.

PHlm3TN2YwvdCrkIbuaBpw.text: Instagram brought me here. Very photogenic noodles lol. Walked in was immediately greeted and taken care of. Was recommended the thin noodles so i got that and szechuan beef spicy. Was pretty damn good. Was a little pricey for soup but $10 seems like the going rate for lunch anymore.   I wasnt a fan of the drink offers. Its canned. I dont think you can get away with serving can sodas and teas these days. If i were the boss i would do something about that. Other than that, everything was good. I will come back.

4hLj2BONIpC-19rZ4xPbqw.text: Delicious! First, the service here was very friendly and helpful, even though it is extremely busy. The food was spot on, the beef pancake, onion pancake, beef noodle soup, lan zhou soup, as Szechuan spicy beef soup were all great. The beef pancakes were crunch, with a succulent beef filling served with a kickass sauce sweet and spicy dipping sauce. The Lan Zhou noodles came with melt-in-your mouth brisket and the Szechuan Soup had a pleasant oily texture with delicious chunks of beef, bits of parsley or cilantro, green onion, bok choy (or possibly Chinese broccoli) and a perfect kick of spice that didn't overpower the dish. The spice dumplings were surprisingly small for the price, but still very delicious. Absolutely wonderful restaurant, I recommend it wholeheartedly.

0gCyVuC1C2sP2Az1mXPztA.text: I thought it was pretty decent. I ordered the Mongolian beef to go and asked that they cook the beef extra well. The order came out in like 3 minutes. No way was it cooked well done. Also, there wasn't that much beef in it. Hopefully, they add more in the future.  Other than that the taste was good.

jAdJjLDDv6YsB6cN0XJ4Rg.text: This brand new spot features delicious Chinese hand pulled noodles featured in delicious broths and sauces.  Beef Brisket Noodle (soup) - DELICIOUS. The broth is truly amazing and reminiscent of Oxtail soup, but better lol. The noodles and their variance in thickness was very pleasant in this flavorful but light broth.  The meat was so tender and again very flavorful.    House Chow Mein Noodles - Featured a variety of veggies and meats but was very flavorful. Definitely not your average chow Mein!  Spicy Won Ton - Good, not what I was expecting but very good nonetheless.  Beef Pancake - So fun and yummy! It says 3 pieces but they're not small pieces at all, so do get it!   Food:  Great. Fun environment, entertaining to watch and all in all great.  The noodles they give you in each meal is A LOT - don't be like us and eat so fast you get full quickly lol.  -1 Star on Service: Serving slightly slow but they're new and trying to figure out their systems and processes, as with all new restaurants.  Plus they have to hand make your noodles so I do appreciate that.  I look forward to them growing and settling in their processes.  Delicious and enjoyable, I highly recommend and will visit again!

A95RXYqxNgqEtQxGbL9Mjw.text: The best noodles I have had in Las Vegas. Lots of their dishes only have a couple different vegetables in them, so if you happen not to like one or both of those vegetables it can ruin that dish for you. However, this is one of the few places I have been which cooks flavor into their vegetables well enough that you can enjoy eating them on their own, so I would recommend trying the vegetables, even if you normally would not like that type of vegetable. The beef is very obviously high cut and we'll prepared: soft and lovely. Be aware that you will not be seated within 30 minutes of the advertised closing time, but the food they prepare you for takeaway is fully up to par. The descriptions on the menu are not detailed, feel free to try to get a better details from the server. Also: FREE TEA!

SBCTfwbwrT5BaqToucd7tw.text: This place was my favorite noodle place for awhile.  I can visit the place 2-3 times a week.  It is possibly the most authentic Chinese noodle place in Vegas.  This place remind me of the street vendors when I was in China more than 20 years ago.   I am writing this to let the management know that I am not going back for minimum of 12 months.  Because the food is so good, I can over look the poor services and horrible sanitation.  Until  one day, my 6 year old son and I was completely ignored in the place for 20 minutes.  Our order was taken for awhile and the customers came after us were taking care of.  When my son told me the 3rd time "Dad, I am hungry."  This is enough.

bIjx_t-aAa_eX72t50nt3A.text: Food was outstanding! Great customer service as well. The noodles are fresh and literally prepared in front of of you. Prices are reasonable also. Definitely coming back and would give this place 6 stars if I could.
